Amidst: In the midst or middle of; surrounded or encompassed by; among.
Asphodel: A general name for a plant of the genus Asphodelus. The asphodels are hardy perennial plants, several species of which are cultivated for the beauty of their flowers.
Antiphrasis: The use of words in a sense opposite to their proper meaning; as when a court of justice is called a court of vengeance.
Alacrity: A cheerful readiness, willingness, or promptitude; joyous activity; briskness; sprightliness; as, the soldiers advanced with alacrity to meet the enemy.
Angustation: The act of making narrow; a straitening or contacting.
Avenger: One who avenges or vindicates; as, an avenger of blood.
Ambs-ace: Double aces, the lowest throw of all at dice. Hence: Bad luck; anything of no account or value.
Assaying: The act or process of testing, esp. of analyzing or examining metals and ores, to determine the proportion of pure metal.
angiocarpic: of or pertaining to an angiocarp; angiocarpous.
Aumery: A form of Ambry, a closet; but confused with Almonry, as if a place for alms.
allophonic: of or pertaining to an allophone.
Aristocratic: Of or pertaining to an aristocracy; consisting in, or favoring, a government of nobles, or principal men; as, an aristocratic constitution.
auto-da-fe: A judgment of the Inquisition in Spain and Portugal condemning or acquitting persons accused of religious offenses.
Absume: To consume gradually; to waste away.
Antitheist: A disbeliever in the existence of God.
Archi-: A prefix signifying chief, arch; as, architect, archiepiscopal. In (Biol.) and (Anat.) it usually means primitive, original, ancestral; as, archipterygium, the primitive fin or wing.
Alert: An alarm from a real or threatened attack; a sudden attack; also, a bugle sound to give warning.
Auriculate: Having ears or appendages like ears; eared.
Antiorgastic: Tending to allay venereal excitement or desire; sedative.
Anarchism: The doctrine or practice of anarchists.
Abbreviature: An abbreviation; an abbreviated state or form.
Alkali: Soda ash; caustic soda, caustic potash, etc.
Aphoristic: In the form of, or of the nature of, an aphorism; in the form of short, unconnected sentences; as, an aphoristic style.
Anarchist: An anarch; one who advocates anarchy of aims at the overthrow of civil government.
Astraddle: In a straddling position; astride; bestriding; as, to sit astraddle a horse.
Anisyl: The univalent radical, CH3.O.C6H4-, of which anisol is the hydride.
Antichronism: Deviation from the true order of time; anachronism.
Agio: The premium or percentage on a better sort of money when it is given in exchange for an inferior sort. The premium or discount on foreign bills of exchange is sometimes called agio.
Archil: A violet dye obtained from several species of lichen (Roccella tinctoria, etc.), which grow on maritime rocks in the Canary and Cape Verd Islands, etc.
Apollyon: The Destroyer; -- a name used (Rev. ix. 11) for the angel of the bottomless pit, answering to the Hebrew Abaddon.
5-hitter: a game in which a pitcher allows the opposing team 5 hits.
Asphodelus: small genus of tall striking annuals or perennials with grasslike foliage and flowers in dense racemes or panicles; Mediterranean to Himalayas; sometimes placed in family Asphodelaceae.
appalled: struck with fear, dread, or consternation.
Athrepsia: Profound debility of children due to lack of food and to unhygienic surroundings.
arbitrational: relating to or resulting from arbitration.
anabiosis: suspended animation in organisms during periods of extreme drought from which they revive when moisture returns.
Anthonys Fire: See Saint Anthony's Fire, under Saint.
Amphoric: Produced by, or indicating, a cavity in the lungs, not filled, and giving a sound like that produced by blowing into an empty decanter; as, amphoric respiration or resonance.
Anatomist: One who is skilled in the art of anatomy, or dissection.
Apomorphia: A crystalline alkaloid obtained from morphia. It is a powerful emetic.
Areolate: Divided into small spaces or areolations, as the wings of insects, the leaves of plants, or the receptacle of compound flowers.
A\u00ebrolite: A stone, or metallic mass, which has fallen to the earth from distant space; a meteorite; a meteoric stone.
Ameliorative: Tending to ameliorate; producing amelioration or improvement; as, ameliorative remedies, efforts.
Athermancy: Inability to transmit radiant heat; impermeability to heat.
Alexandria: a city on the Mediterranean Sea, the chief port of Egypt.
A\u00ebriform: Having the form or nature of air, or of an elastic fluid; gaseous. Hence fig.: Unreal.
Accessibility: The quality of being accessible, or of admitting approach; receptibility.
Anserinae: a family name used in some classifications for the swans.
Archivist: A keeper of archives or records.
Alphabetic: Pertaining to, furnished with, expressed by, or in the order of, the letters of the alphabet; as, alphabetic characters, writing, languages, arrangement.
adrenocorticotrophic: stimulating or acting on the adrenal cortex
Apennine: Of, pertaining to, or designating, the Apennines, a chain of mountains extending through Italy.
-ate: As an ending of participles or participial adjectives it is equivalent to -ed; as, situate or situated; animate or animated.
Acetonic: Of or pertaining to acetone; as, acetonic bodies.
Adversifoliate: Having opposite leaves, as plants which have the leaves so arranged on the stem.
Apollo: A deity among the Greeks and Romans. He was the god of light and day (the “sun god”), of archery, prophecy, medicine, poetry, and music, etc., and was represented as the model of manly grace and beauty; -- called also Phébus.
Alegar: Sour ale; vinegar made of ale.
Amphibiology: A treatise on amphibious animals; the department of natural history which treats of the Amphibia.
Antemural: An outwork of a strong, high wall, with turrets, in front of the gateway (as of an old castle), for defending the entrance.
Anthozoic: Of or pertaining to the Anthozoa.
Affamish: To afflict with, or perish from, hunger.
Abhor: To shrink back with horror, disgust, or dislike; to be contrary or averse; -- with
Alhambraic: Made or decorated after the fanciful style of the ornamentation in the Alhambra, which affords an unusually fine exhibition of Saracenic or Arabesque architecture.
Adelantado: A governor of a province; a commander.
Aroma: The quality or principle of plants or other substances which constitutes their fragrance; agreeable odor; as, the aroma of coffee.
Adductive: Adducing, or bringing towards or to something.
Astatki: A thick liquid residuum obtained in the distillation of Russian petroleum, much used as fuel.
Amarine: A characteristic crystalline substance, obtained from oil of bitter almonds.
Almandine: The common red variety of garnet.
Almude: A measure for liquids in several countries. In Portugal the Lisbon almude is about 4.4, and the Oporto almude about 6.6, gallons U. S. measure.  In Turkey the “almud” is about 1.4 gallons.
Arithmetical: Of or pertaining to arithmetic; according to the rules or method of arithmetic.
Asparagus: A genus of perennial plants belonging to the natural order Liliaceæ, and having erect much branched stems, and very slender branchlets which are sometimes mistaken for leaves. Asparagus racemosus is a shrubby climbing plant with fragrant flowers.  Specifically: The Asparagus officinalis, a species cultivated in gardens.
Amaurosis: A loss or decay of sight, from loss of power in the optic nerve, without any perceptible external change in the eye; -- called also gutta serena, the “drop serene” of Milton.
Ambidextrousness: The quality of being ambidextrous; ambidexterity.
Aspirator: An apparatus for passing air or gases through or over certain liquids or solids, or for exhausting a closed vessel, by means of suction.
Androtomy: Dissection of the human body, as distinguished from zoötomy; anthropotomy.
Adrian: Pertaining to the Adriatic Sea; as, Adrian billows.
Assortment: Act of assorting, or distributing into sorts, kinds, or classes.
Abaciscus: One of the tiles or squares of a tessellated pavement; an abaculus.
Arching: The arched part of a structure.
Attribute: That which is attributed; a quality which is considered as belonging to, or inherent in, a person or thing; an essential or necessary property or characteristic.
Acton: A stuffed jacket worn under the mail, or (later) a jacket plated with mail.
Adjectional: Pertaining to adjection; that is, or may be, annexed.
Amplificatory: Serving to amplify or enlarge; amplificative.
Air engine: An engine driven by heated or by compressed air.
Aneurismal: Of or pertaining to an aneurism; as, an aneurismal tumor; aneurismal diathesis.
Above: In a higher place; overhead; into or from heaven; as, the clouds above.
Acre: Any field of arable or pasture land.
Archival: Pertaining to, or contained in, archives or records.
Apocopate: Shortened by apocope; as, an apocopate form.
Approvedly: So as to secure approbation; in an approved manner.
A-: A, as a prefix to English words, is derived from various sources. (1) It frequently signifies on or in (from an, a forms of AS. on), denoting a state, as in afoot, on foot, abed, amiss, asleep, aground, aloft, away (AS. onweg), and analogically, ablaze, atremble, etc. (2) AS. of off, from, as in adown (AS. ofdūne off the dun or hill). (3) AS. ā- (Goth. us-, ur-, Ger. er-), usually giving an intensive force, and sometimes the sense of away, on, back, as in arise, abide, ago. (4) Old English y- or i- (corrupted from the AS. inseparable particle ge-, cognate with OHG. ga-, gi-, Goth. ga-), which, as a prefix, made no essential addition to the meaning, as in aware. (5) French à (L. ad to), as in abase, achieve. (6) L. a, ab, abs, from, as in avert. (7) Greek insep. prefix α without, or privative, not, as in abyss, atheist; akin to E. un-.
Algebraic: Of or pertaining to algebra; using algebra; according to the laws of algebra; containing an operation of algebra, or deduced from such operation; as, algebraic characters; algebraical writings; algebraic geometry.
Apparitional: Pertaining to an apparition or to apparitions; spectral.
Abacus: A table or tray strewn with sand, anciently used for drawing, calculating, etc.
AA: acronym for Associate in Arts, a college degree granted for successful completion of a two-year course of study in arts or general topics.
Anagrammatize: To transpose, as the letters of a word, so as to form an anagram.
Anthropopathite: One who ascribes human feelings to deity.
Anfractuosity: A state of being anfractuous, or full of windings and turnings; sinuosity.
Antechoir: A space inclosed or reserved at the entrance to the choir, for the clergy and choristers.
Artful: Performed with, or characterized by, art or skill.
Appendiculata: An order of annelids; the Polychæta.
Aposteme: An abscess; a swelling filled with purulent matter.
Appendiculate: Having small appendages; forming an appendage.
Anapophysis: An accessory process in many lumbar vertebræ.
Acetin: A combination of acetic acid with glycerin.
Ac: the chemical symbol for actinum, a radioactive element.
Ab: The fifth month of the Jewish year according to the ecclesiastical reckoning, the eleventh by the civil computation, coinciding nearly with August.
Attainableness: The quality of being attainable; attainability.
Adjectively: In the manner of an adjective; as, a word used adjectively.
Ai: The three-toed sloth (Bradypus tridactylus) of South America. See Sloth.
Ah: An exclamation, expressive of surprise, pity, complaint, entreaty, contempt, threatening, delight, triumph, etc., according to the manner of utterance.
Atmospherology: The science or a treatise on the atmosphere.
Am: The first person singular of the verb be, in the indicative mode, present tense. See Be.
An: If; -- a word used by old English authors.
Abatement: The act of abating, or the state of being abated; a lessening, diminution, or reduction; removal or putting an end to; as, the abatement of a nuisance is the suppression thereof.
At: Primarily, this word expresses the relations of presence, nearness in place or time, or direction toward; as, at the ninth hour; at the house; to aim at a mark. It is less definite than in or on; at the house may be in or near the house. From this original import are derived all the various uses of at.
Av: the eleventh month of the civil year; the fifth month of the ecclesiastical year in the Jewish calendar (in July and August).
Ax: To ask; to inquire or inquire of.
Amphisb\u00e6na: A fabled serpent with a head at each end, moving either way.
Aphoristically: In the form or manner of aphorisms; pithily.
Ash: To strew or sprinkle with ashes.
amphotericin: an antibiotic and antifungal agent (C47H73NO17), produced by a strain of Streptomyces nodosus.  It is one of a class of polyene macrolide antibiotics effective against fungal infections.  It has a molecular weight of 924.11; it is soluble in oganic solvents but only slightly soluble in water.
Avicular: Of or pertaining to a bird or to birds.
Adenoma: A benign tumor of a glandlike structure; morbid enlargement of a gland.
Aftergrass: The grass that grows after the first crop has been mown; aftermath.
Aspiring: That aspires; as, an Aspiring mind.
aerator: That which supplies with air or gas
Apocalyptically: By revelation; in an apocalyptic manner.
Aware: Watchful; vigilant or on one's guard against danger or difficulty.
Archaic: Of or characterized by antiquity or archaism; antiquated; obsolescent.
Agoing: In motion; in the act of going; as, to set a mill agoing.
Altiscope: An arrangement of lenses and mirrors which enables a person to see an object in spite of intervening objects.  Since the early 1900's, most commonly called periscope.
abdominousness: distension of the stomach area due to overweight.
80th: coming next after the seventy-ninth in a series
Anodon: A genus of fresh-water bivalves, having no teeth at the hinge.
Ad captandum: A phrase used adjectively sometimes of meretricious attempts to catch or win popular favor.
Acquisition: The act or process of acquiring.
Alternator: An electric generator or dynamo for producing alternating currents.
Acetate: A salt formed by the union of acetic acid with a base or positive radical; as, acetate of lead, acetate of potash.
Adjudication: The act of adjudicating; the act or process of trying and determining judicially.
Ametabolic: Not undergoing any metamorphosis; as, ametabolic insects.  Opposite of metabolic.
Absinth: The plant absinthium or common wormwood.
Adulterant: That which is used to adulterate anything.
Atomization: The act of reducing to atoms, or very minute particles; or the state of being so reduced.
Awkly: In an unlucky (left-handed) or perverse manner.
Asinine: Of or belonging to, or having the qualities of, the ass, as stupidity and obstinacy.
Ampliate: Having the outer edge prominent; said of the wings of insects.
Animalize: To endow with the properties of an animal; to represent in animal form.
Apyretic: Without fever; -- applied to days when there is an intermission of fever.
Anastomosis: The inosculation of vessels, or intercommunication between two or more vessels or nerves, as the cross communication between arteries or veins.
Airman: A man who ascends or flies in an aircraft; an aviator; an airplane pilot.
Apotheosis: The act of elevating a mortal to the rank of, and placing him among, “the gods;” deification.
Amateur: A person attached to a particular pursuit, study, or science as to music or painting; esp. one who cultivates any study or art, from taste or attachment, without pursuing it professionally.
Anient: To frustrate; to bring to naught; to annihilate.
Agglomeration: The act or process of collecting in a mass; a heaping together.
Arthurian: Of or pertaining to King Arthur or his knights.
Aspection: The act of viewing; a look.
Arcanum: A secret; a mystery; -- generally used in the plural.
Adventuress: A female adventurer; a woman who tries to gain position by equivocal means.
Ana\u00ebrobiotic: Related to, or of the nature of, anaërobies.
Arsenide: A compound of arsenic with a metal, or positive element or radical; -- formerly called arseniuret.
Apportionment: The act of apportioning; a dividing into just proportions or shares; a division or shares; a division and assignment, to each proprietor, of his just portion of an undivided right or property.
airspace: the atmosphere above a nation and deemed to be under its jurisdiction.
Assistance: The act of assisting; help; aid; furtherance; succor; support.
Abacinate: To blind by a red-hot metal plate held before the eyes.
antineutrino: The antiparticle of a neutrino.  Each type of neutrino has a corresponding antineutrino.
addressed: marked with a destination; -- of mail
abrocome: ratlike rodent of the Andes with soft fur and large ears.
Adaptive: Suited, given, or tending, to adaptation; characterized by adaptation; capable of adapting.
Abdest: Purification by washing the hands before prayer; -- a Mohammedan rite.
Arrowroot: A white-flowered west Indian plant of the genus Maranta, esp. Maranta arundinacea, now cultivated in many hot countries.  Its root yields arrowroot starch.  It said that the Indians used the roots to neutralize the venom in wounds made by poisoned arrows.
asynchronism: the relation that exists when things occur at unrelated times.
Anamniotic: Without, or not developing, an amnion.
anchorperson: an anchorman or anchorwoman..  The anchorperson usually begins the broadcast, discusses certain topics, and introduces new topics, which may be discussed by other reprorters, especially when the report is recorded or broadcast from a location other than the main broadcast studio.
Almucantar: A small circle of the sphere parallel to the horizon; a circle or parallel of altitude. Two stars which have the same almucantar have the same altitude. See Almacantar.
70th: coming next after the sixty-ninth in a series
Admiring: Expressing admiration; as, an admiring glance.
Ambrosia beetle: A bark beetle that makes and feeds on ambrosia{4}.
Arduously: In an arduous manner; with difficulty or laboriousness.
appointed: having acquired an office or responsibility through appointment; -- said of officials, and contrasting with elected.
Auricle: The external ear, or that part of the ear which is prominent from the head.
Alienage: The state or legal condition of being an alien.
Anorexia: Want of appetite, without a loathing of food.
Aphlogistic: Flameless; as, an aphlogistic lamp, in which a coil of wire is kept in a state of continued ignition by alcohol, without flame.
Aftercast: A throw of dice after the game in ended; hence, anything done too late.
Acescent: A substance liable to become sour.
Antiptosis: The putting of one case for another.
Archimage: The high priest of the Persian Magi, or worshipers of fire.
Athyriaceae: alternative names for one of a number of families into which the family Polypodiaceae has been subdivided in some classification systems.
Adulatory: Containing excessive praise or compliment; servilely praising; flattering; as, an adulatory address.
Ailuropodidae: in some classifications considered the family comprising the giant pandas.
Antelucan: Held or being before light; -- a word applied to assemblies of Christians, in ancient times of persecution, held before light in the morning.
Abrasion: The act of abrading, wearing, or rubbing off; the wearing away by friction; as, the abrasion of coins.
Aspiratory: Of or pertaining to breathing; suited to the inhaling of air
Acquainted: Personally known; familiar. See To be acquainted with, under Acquaint, v. t.
Alloo: To incite dogs by a call; to halloo.
Allice: The European shad (Clupea vulgaris); allice shad. See Alose.
Allow: To admit; to concede; to make allowance or abatement.
Alexia: As used by some, inability to read aloud, due to brain disease.
Acequia: A canal or trench for irrigating land.
Astro-: The combining form of the Greek word 'a`stron, meaning star.
agenda: a temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to.
Allanite: A silicate containing a large amount of cerium. It is usually black in color, opaque, and is related to epidote in form and composition.
Appendicularia: A genus of small free-swimming Tunicata, shaped somewhat like a tadpole, and remarkable for resemblances to the larvæ of other Tunicata. It is the type of the order Copelata or Larvalia. See Illustration in Appendix.
acetylate: introduce an acetyl group into a chemical compound
Allocation: The act of putting one thing to another; a placing; disposition; arrangement.
angledozer: a bulldozer with an angled moldboard to push earth to one side.
Argentiferous: Producing or containing silver; as, argentiferous lead ore or veins.
Allerion: Am eagle without beak or feet, with expanded wings.
Amortize: To make as if dead; to destroy.
auto: of or pertaining to an automobile; as, an auto mechanic.
Alcoholometer: An instrument for determining the strength of spirits, with a scale graduated so as to indicate the percentage of pure alcohol, either by weight or volume. It is usually a form of hydrometer with a special scale.
Aniline: Made from, or of the nature of, aniline.
Apothegmatist: A collector or maker of apothegms.
Attach\u00e9: One attached to another person or thing, as a part of a suite or staff. Specifically: One attached to an embassy.
Audaciously: In an audacious manner; with excess of boldness; impudently.
Abeam: On the beam, that is, on a line which forms a right angle with the ship's keel; opposite to the center of the ship's side.
Athanasian: Of or pertaining to Athanasius, bishop of Alexandria in the 4th century.
altostratus: A cloud formation similar to cirro-stratus, but heavier and at a lower level; a stratus cloud at an intermediate altitude of 2 or 3 miles.
aggravated: made more severe or intense, especially in law; as, aggravated assault.
Aid-de-camp: An officer selected by a general to carry orders, also to assist or represent him in correspondence and in directing movements.
Acrocarpous: Having a terminal fructification; having the fruit at the end of the stalk.
Ambitious: Possessing, or controlled by, ambition; greatly or inordinately desirous of power, honor, office, superiority, or distinction.
Asserter: One who asserts; one who avers pr maintains; an assertor.
Apotome: The difference between two quantities commensurable only in power, as between √2 and 1, or between the diagonal and side of a square.
Arctogeal: Of or pertaining to arctic lands; as, the arctogeal fauna.
Austereness: Harshness or astringent sourness to the taste; acerbity.
activism: a policy of taking direct and militant action to achieve a political or social goal.
angiocarp: tree bearing fruit enclosed in a shell or involucre or husk.
Adrianople: a city in Northwest Turkey; a Thracian town that was rebuilt and renamed by the Roman emperor Hadrian.
activist: advocating a cause or engaged in activism
Antonym: A word of opposite meaning; a counterterm; -- used as a correlative of synonym.
Antipathic: Belonging to antipathy; opposite; contrary; allopathic.
Alstroemeriaceae: one of many families or subfamilies into which some classification systems subdivide the Liliaceae but not widely accepted; sometimes included in subfamily Amaryllidaceae.
Amyloid: A non-nitrogenous starchy food; a starchlike substance.
ackee: red pear-shaped tropical fruit with poisonous seeds; its flesh is poisonous when unripe or overripe.
Adders-tongue: A genus of ferns (Ophioglossum), whose seeds are produced on a spike resembling a serpent's tongue.
Anito: In Guam and the Philippines, an idol, fetich, or spirit.
Allocution: The act or manner of speaking to, or of addressing in words.
Accouterments: Dress; trappings; equipment; specifically, the devices and equipments worn by soldiers.
Alluvium: Deposits of earth, sand, gravel, and other transported matter, made by rivers, floods, or other causes, upon land not permanently submerged beneath the waters of lakes or seas.
Antinational: Antagonistic to one's country or nation, or to a national government.
Admove: To move or conduct to or toward.
Arsine: A compound of arsenic and hydrogen, AsH3, a colorless and exceedingly poisonous gas, having an odor like garlic; arseniureted hydrogen.
Agnail: A corn on the toe or foot.
Allonge: To thrust with a sword; to lunge.
Animated: Endowed with life; full of life or spirit; indicating animation; lively; vigorous.
Agape: The love feast of the primitive Christians, being a meal partaken of in connection with the communion.
Argot: A secret language or conventional slang peculiar to thieves, tramps, and vagabonds; flash.
Anywise: In any wise or way; at all.
Argos: an ancient city in SE Greece; dominated the Peloponnese in the 7th century BC.
Argon: A colorless, odorless gas occurring in the air (of which it constitutes 0.93 per cent by volume), in volcanic gases, etc.; -- so named on account of its inertness by Rayleigh and Ramsay, who prepared and examined it in 1894-95. Symbol, A; at. wt., 39.9. Argon is condensible to a colorless liquid boiling at -186.1° C. and to a solid melting at -189.6° C. It has a characteristic spectrum. No compounds of it are known, but there is physical evidence that its molecule is monatomic. Weight of one liter at 0° C. and 760 mm., 1.7828 g.
Abature: Grass and sprigs beaten or trampled down by a stag passing through them.
Argonauta: A genus of Cephalopoda. The shell is called paper nautilus or paper sailor.
Aryan: Of or pertaining to the people called Aryans; Indo-European; Indo-Germanic; as, the Aryan stock, the Aryan languages.
avianise: to modify microorganisms by repeated culture in the developing chick embryo.
Aftersensation: A sensation or sense impression following the removal of a stimulus producing a primary sensation, and reproducing the primary sensation in positive, negative, or complementary form. The aftersensation may be continuous with the primary sensation or follow it after an interval.
ASL: same as American sign language, the sign language used in the US.
Alumna: A female pupil; especially, a graduate of a school or college.
abolitionary: relating to or favoring abolition, especially the abolition of slavery.
Ach\u00e6an: Of or pertaining to Achaia in Greece; also, Grecian.
Argive: Of or performance to Argos, the capital of Argolis in Greece.
azonal: not divided into zones; -- opposite of zonal.
Acanthuridae: a family of fishes consisting of the surgeonfishes.
Ajutage: A tube through which water is discharged; an efflux tube; as, the ajutage of a fountain.
Anhima: A South American aquatic bird; the horned screamer or kamichi (Palamedea cornuta). See Kamichi.
Anti: A prefix meaning against, opposite or opposed to, contrary, or in place of; -- used in composition in many English words. It is often shortened to ant-; as, antacid, antarctic.
Ahull: With the sails furled, and the helm lashed alee; -- applied to ships in a storm. See Hull, n.
Appetite: The desire for some personal gratification, either of the body or of the mind.
Anta: A species of pier produced by thickening a wall at its termination, treated architecturally as a pilaster, with capital and base.
Antibrachial: Of or pertaining to the antibrachium, or forearm.
Absolution: An absolving, or setting free from guilt, sin, or penalty; forgiveness of an offense.
Agedness: The quality of being aged; oldness.
Analytic: Of or pertaining to analysis; resolving into elements or constituent parts; as, an analytical experiment; -- opposed to synthetic.
Agglutinant: Uniting, as glue; causing, or tending to cause, adhesion.
Administrator: One who administers affairs; one who directs, manages, executes, or dispenses, whether in civil, judicial, political, or ecclesiastical affairs; a manager.
Aerobe: an organism such as a microorganism that requires oxygen for life or growth.
Ardently: In an ardent manner; eagerly; with warmth; affectionately; passionately.
Assail: To attack with violence, or in a vehement and hostile manner; to assault; to molest; as, to assail a man with blows; to assail a city with artillery.
Archaism: An ancient, antiquated, or old-fashioned, word, expression, or idiom; a word or form of speech no longer in common use.
Anonymousness: The state or quality of being anonymous.
Apidae: a family of insects comprising the bees; examples are: honeybees; carpenter bees; bumblebees.
Annularity: Annular condition or form; as, the annularity of a nebula.
Alioth: A star in the tail of the Great Bear, the one next the bowl in the Dipper.
Acquirement: The act of acquiring, or that which is acquired; attainment.
Amoret: An amorous girl or woman; a wanton.
Ablaze: On fire; in a blaze, gleaming.
Antacid: A remedy for acidity of the stomach, as an alkali or absorbent.
Atelets sauce: A sauce (such as egg and bread crumbs) used for covering bits of meat, small birds, or fish, strung on skewers for frying.
Angostura: A bitter aromatic bark, obtained from a South American tree of the rue family (Galipea cusparia, or Galipea officinalis).  It is used used as a tonic, in medicines, liqueurs and bitters.
Anticline: A structure of bedded rocks in which the beds on both sides of an axis or axial plane dip away from the axis; an anticlinal.  Contrassted with syncline.
Acts: one of the books of the Christian New Testament describing the activities of Christ's apostles after his death.
Apod: One of certain animals that have no feet or footlike organs; esp. one of certain fabulous birds which were said to have no feet.
Aromatic: A plant, drug, or medicine, characterized by a fragrant smell, and usually by a warm, pungent taste, as ginger, cinnamon, spices.
A\u00ebrotaxis: The positive or negative stimulus exerted by oxygen on aërobic and anaërobic bacteria.
Anther: That part of the stamen containing the pollen, or fertilizing dust, which, when mature, is emitted for the impregnation of the ovary.
Anisodactyla: A group of herbivorous mammals characterized by having the hoofs in a single series around the foot, as the elephant, rhinoceros, etc.
Anachronize: To refer to, or put into, a wrong time.
Achromic: Free from color; colorless; as, in (Physiol. Chem.), the achromic point of a starch solution acted upon by an amylolytic enzyme is the point at which it fails to give any color with iodine.
Ascertainment: The act of ascertaining; a reducing to certainty; a finding out by investigation; discovery.
Augmenter: One who, or that which, augments or increases anything.
Anlaut: An initial sound, as of a word or syllable.
Accomplished: Completed; effected; established; as, an accomplished fact.
Admirative: Relating to or expressing admiration or wonder.
Animator: One who, or that which, animates; an animater.
Automatism: The state or quality of being automatic; the power of self-moving; automatic, mechanical, or involuntary action.
Attributive: A word that denotes an attribute; esp. a modifying word joined to a noun; an adjective or adjective phrase.
Austrian: Of or pertaining to Austria, or to its inhabitants.
Agenesis: Any imperfect development of the body, or any anomaly of organization.
Aleutian: a member of the people inhabiting the Aleutian Islands.
Averpenny: Money paid by a tenant in lieu of the service of average.
Agonothetic: Pertaining to the office of an agonothete.
Amidogen: A compound radical, NH2, not yet obtained in a separate state, which may be regarded as ammonia from the molecule of which one of its hydrogen atoms has been removed; -- called also the amido group, and in composition represented by the form amido.
Alpha paper: A sensitized paper for obtaining positives by artificial light. It is coated with gelatin containing silver bromide and chloride.
Auncel: A rude balance for weighing, and a kind of weight, formerly used in England.
Allowableness: The quality of being allowable; permissibleness; lawfulness; exemption from prohibition or impropriety.
Annueler: A priest employed in saying annuals, or anniversary Masses.
Albuminimeter: An instrument for ascertaining the quantity of albumen in a liquid.
Affusion: The act of pouring upon, or sprinkling with a liquid, as water upon a child in baptism.
armor-clad: protected with a covering of armor.
Ammonal: An explosive consisting of a mixture of powdered aluminum and ammonium nitrate.
Aditya: one of 7 to 12 sons of Aditi; gods of celestial light.
Amberboa: a genus of herbs of Mediterranean to Central Asia cultivated for their flowers.
Astrognosy: The science or knowledge of the stars, esp. the fixed stars.
almond-shaped: having the shape of an almond, i.e. ellipsoidal with somewhat pointed ends.
Agreeably: In an agreeably manner; in a manner to give pleasure; pleasingly.
African: A native of Africa; also one ethnologically belonging to an African race.
Apastron: That point in the orbit of a double star where the smaller star is farthest from its primary.
Aromatizer: One who, or that which, aromatizes or renders aromatic.
Agreeable: Pleasing, either to the mind or senses; pleasant; grateful; as, agreeable manners or remarks; an agreeable person; fruit agreeable to the taste.
aloes: a purgative made from the leaves of aloe.  Same as aloe{3}.
Alish: Like ale; as, an alish taste.
aquilegia: a plant of the genus Aquilegia having irregular showy spurred flowers; N temperate regions esp. mountains.
Anastomose: To inosculate; to intercommunicate by anastomosis, as the arteries and veins.
Asclepiadaceae: a widely distributed family of herbs and shrubs most with milky juice; examples are the milkweeds (genus Asclepias).
Agonistics: The science of athletic combats, or contests in public games.
Academician: A member of an academy, or society for promoting science, art, or literature, as of the French Academy, or the Royal Academy of arts.
Antecedent: That which goes before in time; that which precedes.
Aprocta: A group of Turbellaria in which there is no anal aperture.
Anconal: Of or pertaining to the ancon or elbow.
Augur: To predict or foretell, as from signs or omens; to betoken; to presage; to infer.
And: A particle which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Antelope: One of a group of ruminant quadrupeds, intermediate between the deer and the goat. The horns are usually annulated, or ringed. There are many species in Africa and Asia.
Ana: Of each; an equal quantity; as, wine and honey, ana (or, contracted, aa), &unr_; ij., that is, of wine and honey, each, two ounces.
Ann: A half years's stipend, over and above what is owing for the incumbency, due to a minister's heirs after his decease.
Acanthine: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, the plant acanthus.
Ani: A black bird of tropical America, the West Indies and Florida (Crotophaga ani), allied to the cuckoos, having a compressed, bladelike bill and remarkable for communistic nesting.
Ant: A hymenopterous insect of the Linnæan genus Formica, which is now made a family of several genera; an emmet; a pismire.
Abelmoschus: genus of tropical coarse herbs having large lobed leaves and often yellow flowers.
Any: To any extent; in any degree; at all.
Adlegation: A right formerly claimed by the states of the German Empire of joining their own ministers with those of the emperor in public treaties and negotiations to the common interest of the empire.
Anthracene oil: A heavy green oil (partially solidifying on cooling), which distills over from coal tar at a temperature above 270°. It is the principal source of anthracene.
Archdeacon: In England, an ecclesiastical dignitary, next in rank below a bishop, whom he assists, and by whom he is appointed, though with independent authority.
Adipocere: A soft, unctuous, or waxy substance, of a light brown color, into which the fat and muscle tissue of dead bodies sometimes are converted, by long immersion in water or by burial in moist places. It is a result of fatty degeneration.
Allegoric: Belonging to, or consisting of, allegory; of the nature of an allegory; describing by resemblances; figurative.
Accipitrine: Like or belonging to the Accipitres; raptorial; hawklike.
Alveary: A beehive, or something resembling a beehive.
Arctoidea: A group of the Carnivora, that includes the bears, weasels, etc.
Analogy: A resemblance of relations; an agreement or likeness between things in some circumstances or effects, when the things are otherwise entirely different. Thus, learning enlightens the mind, because it is to the mind what light is to the eye, enabling it to discover things before hidden.
Asbolin: A peculiar acrid and bitter oil, obtained from wood soot.
Amassment: An amassing; a heap collected; a large quantity or number brought together; an accumulation.
Arabism: An Arabic idiom peculiarly of language.
Anacreontic: A poem after the manner of Anacreon; a sprightly little poem in praise of love and wine.
Angioma: A tumor composed chiefly of dilated blood or lymph vessels.
Arabist: One well versed in the Arabic language or literature; also, formerly, one who followed the Arabic system of surgery.
Anhydrous: Destitute of water; as, anhydrous salts or acids.
Arango: A bead of rough carnelian. Arangoes were formerly imported from Bombay for use in the African slave trade.
Aluminum: The metallic element forming the base of alumina. This metal is white, but with a bluish tinge, and is remarkable for its resistance to oxidation, and for its lightness, having a specific gravity of about 2.6. Atomic weight 27.08. Symbol Al.  Also called aluminium.
Asiphonate: Destitute of a siphon or breathing tube; -- said of many bivalve shells.
Audience: The act of hearing; attention to sounds.
Astarboard: Over to the starboard side; -- said of the tiller.
Agnate: A relative whose relationship can be traced exclusively through males.
A\u00ebrostatics: The science that treats of the equilibrium of elastic fluids, or that of bodies sustained in them. Hence it includes aëronautics.
Arrasene: A material of wool or silk used for working the figures in embroidery.
Arrenotokous: Producing males from unfertilized eggs, as certain wasps and bees.
Araucariaceae: a family of tall evergreen cone-bearing trees of South America and Australia with broad leathery leaves; in some classifications included in the Pinaceae.
Affined: Joined in affinity or by any tie.
Adventive: A thing or person coming from without; an immigrant.
Antipyrine: An artificial alkaloid, believed to be efficient in abating fever.
ampicillin: a semisynthetic penicillin which can be considered as the common benzylpenicillin containing an amino group at the alpha benzyl position.
Alamodality: The quality of being à la mode; conformity to the mode or fashion; fashionableness.
Allopathically: In a manner conformable to allopathy; by allopathic methods.
Astrolabe: An instrument for observing or showing the positions of the stars. It is now disused.
Amusive: Having power to amuse or entertain the mind; fitted to excite mirth.
Andropogon: A very large and important genus of grasses, found in nearly all parts of the world. It includes the lemon grass of Ceylon and the beard grass, or broom sedge, of the United States. The principal subgenus is Sorghum, including  Andropogon sorghum and Andropogon halepensis, from which have been derived the Chinese sugar cane, the Johnson grass, the Aleppo grass, the broom corn, and the durra, or Indian millet. Several East Indian species, as Andropogon nardus and Andropogon schœnanthus, yield fragrant oils, used in perfumery.
Abandonee: One to whom anything is legally abandoned.
A\u00ebrobic: Growing or thriving only in the presence of oxygen; also, pertaining to, or induced by, aërobies; as, aërobic fermentation.
Attraction: An invisible power in a body by which it draws anything to itself; the power in nature acting mutually between bodies or ultimate particles, tending to draw them together, or to produce their cohesion or combination, and conversely resisting separation.
Allecret: A kind of light armor used in the sixteenth century, esp. by the Swiss.
Aleberry: A beverage, formerly made by boiling ale with spice, sugar, and sops of bread.
Abusively: In an abusive manner; rudely; with abusive language.
Anophyte: A moss or mosslike plant which cellular stems, having usually an upward growth and distinct leaves.
arc-boutant: A buttress that stands apart from the main structure and connected to it by an arch; same as flying buttress.
Admiralship: The office or position oaf an admiral; also, the naval skill of an admiral.
Absorptive: Having power, capacity, or tendency to absorb or imbibe.
amberfish: Any of several amber to coppery fork-tailed warm-water carangid fishes of the genus Seriola, especially a large vigorous sport fish of the southern Atlantic coast (Seriola Dumerili).  It is also called the amberjack.
Anglicism: An English idiom; a phrase or form language peculiar to the English.
agism: discrimination against middle-aged and elderly people.
Appanagist: A prince to whom an appanage has been granted.
Alderney: One of a breed of cattle raised in Alderney, one of the Channel Islands. Alderneys are of a dun or tawny color and are often called Jersey cattle. See Jersey, 3.
Accidentally: In an accidental manner; unexpectedly; by chance; unintentionally; casually; fortuitously; not essentially.
Amp\u00e8re foot: A unit, employed in calculating fall of pressure in distributing mains, equivalent to a current of one ampère flowing through one foot of conductor.
Allnight: Light, fuel, or food for the whole night.
Allegation: The act of alleging or positively asserting.
Acetous: Having a sour taste; sour; acid.
alkalic: having the properties of an alkali.  Opposite of acidic.
Azedarach: a handsome tree (Melia azedarach) of the mahogany family, native to Northern India and China, having long clusters of fragrant purple blossoms and small ornamental but inedible yellow fruits.  It has been naturalized as a shade tree and is common in the southern United States; -- called also, chinaberry, China tree, Pride of India, Pride of China, and Bead tree.
Accelerative: Relating to acceleration; adding to velocity; quickening.
Ant-eater: One of several species of edentates and monotremes that feed upon ants. See Ant-bear, Pangolin, Aard-vark, and Echidna.
Antiquity: The quality of being ancient; ancientness; great age; as, a statue of remarkable antiquity; a family of great antiquity.
Autodidact: One who is self-taught; an automath.
Anasarca: Dropsy of the subcutaneous cellular tissue; an effusion of serum into the cellular substance, occasioning a soft, pale, inelastic swelling of the skin.
Aged: Old; having lived long; having lived almost to or beyond the usual time allotted to that species of being; as, an aged man; an aged oak.
autostrada: an expressway in an Italian-speaking country.
Antinomy: Opposition of one law or rule to another law or rule.
Abaca: The Manila-hemp plant (Musa textilis); also, its fiber. See Manila hemp under Manila.
Absence: A state of being absent or withdrawn from a place or from companionship; -- opposed to presence.
Approach: The act of drawing near; a coming or advancing near.
-ance: A suffix signifying action; also, quality or state; as, assistance, resistance, appearance, elegance. See -ancy.
Anthracosis: A chronic lung disease, common among coal miners, due to the inhalation of coal dust; -- called also collier's lung and miner's phthisis.  See also the related conditions pneumomelanosis and pneumoconiosis (black lung).
Assistant: One who, or that which, assists; a helper; an auxiliary; a means of help.
Aceton\u00e6mia: A morbid condition characterized by the presence of acetone in the blood, as in diabetes.
Ajar: In a state of discord; out of harmony; as, he is ajar with the world.
Afar: At, to, or from a great distance; far away; -- often used with from preceding, or off following; as, he was seen from afar; I saw him afar off.
Archership: The art or skill of an archer.
abducent: drawing away from the midline of the body or from an adjacent part; -- especially of muscles
abducens: a small motor nerve supplying the lateral rectus muscle of the eye.
Aorta: The great artery which carries the blood from the heart to all parts of the body except the lungs; the main trunk of the arterial system.
Agalloch: A soft, resinous wood (Aquilaria Agallocha) of highly aromatic smell, burnt by the orientals as a perfume.  It is called also agalwood and aloes wood.  The name is also given to some other species.
Appalachian: Of or pertaining to a chain of mountains in the United States, commonly called the Allegheny mountains.
Abattoir: A public slaughterhouse for cattle, sheep, etc.
Antepenultimate: Of or pertaining to the last syllable but two.
autarky: economic independence as a national policy.
Assientist: A shareholder of the Assiento company; one of the parties to the Assiento contract.
Annalistic: Pertaining to, or after the manner of, an annalist; as, the dry annalistic style.
Amasthenic: Uniting the chemical rays of light into one focus, as a certain kind of lens; amacratic.
Afrit: A powerful evil jinnee, demon, or monstrous giant.
Abnegator: One who abnegates, denies, or rejects anything.
Affecting: Moving the emotions; fitted to excite the emotions; pathetic; touching; as, an affecting address; an affecting sight.
Ally: See Alley, a marble or taw.
Amber tree: A species of Anthospermum, a shrub with evergreen leaves, which, when bruised, emit a fragrant odor.
Anthraquinone: A hydrocarbon, C6H4.C2O2.C6H4, subliming in shining yellow needles. It is obtained by oxidation of anthracene.
Antherogenous: Transformed from anthers, as the petals of a double flower.
Asymmetry: Want of symmetry, or proportion between the parts of a thing, esp. lack of bilateral symmetry.
Antipetalous: Standing before a petal, as a stamen.
Argil: Clay, or potter's earth; sometimes pure clay, or alumina. See Clay.
Apochromatic: Free from chromatic and spherical aberration; -- said esp. of a lens in which rays of three or more colors are brought to the same focus, the degree of achromatism thus obtained being more complete than where two rays only are thus focused, as in the ordinary achromatic objective.
Apostolic delegate: The diplomatic agent of the pope highest in grade, superior to a nuncio.
Arnica: A genus of plants; also, the most important species (Arnica montana), native of the mountains of Europe, used in medicine as a narcotic and stimulant.
Ametropia: a visual impairment resulting from faulty refraction of light rays in the eye.   Subtypes include myopia astigmatism and hyperopia.
Anteport: An outer port, gate, or door.
Actium: naval battle where Antony and Cleopatra were defeated by Octavian's fleet under Agrippa in 31 BC.
Aroid: Any plant of the Arum family (Araceæ); -- have small flowers massed on a spadix surrounded by a large spathe.
Anility: The state of being and old woman; old-womanishness; dotage.
Astrophyton: A genus of ophiurans having the arms much branched.
andrena: a bee that is a a member of the genus Andrena..
Astringer: A falconer who keeps a goshawk.
Acetimetry: The act or method of ascertaining the strength of vinegar, or the proportion of acetic acid contained in it.
Analgesic: a medication which serves to reduce the sensibility to pain without loss of consciousness.  Aspirin and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are commonly used non-prescription analgesics.
Appeal: An application for the removal of a cause or suit from an inferior to a superior judge or court for reëxamination or review.
Addict: To apply habitually; to devote; to habituate; -- with to.
Athyrium: a genus temperate and tropical lady ferns; in some classifications placed in family Polypodiaceae or in the genus Asplenium.
Airer: One who exposes to the air.
Amiableness: The quality of being amiable; amiability.
Anomalism: An anomaly; a deviation from rule.
Angiopathy: Disease of the vessels, esp. the blood vessels.
Astute: Critically discerning; sagacious; shrewd; subtle; crafty.
Anacoluthon: A lack of grammatical sequence or coherence in a sentence; an instance of a change of construction in a sentence so that the latter part does not syntactically correspond with the first part.
Airwoman: A woman who ascends or flies in an aircraft; a woman aviator; a woman airplane pilot or balloonist; an aviatrix.
Alma Mater: A college or seminary where one is educated.
Actinism: The property of radiant energy (found chiefly in solar or electric light) by which chemical changes are produced, as in photography.
Angiology: That part of anatomy which treats of blood vessels and lymphatics.
Amphineura: A division of Mollusca remarkable for the bilateral symmetry of the organs and the arrangement of the nerves.
Accent: A superior force of voice or of articulative effort upon some particular syllable of a word or a phrase, distinguishing it from the others.
Allegiance: The tie or obligation, implied or expressed, which a subject owes to his sovereign or government; the duty of fidelity to one's king, government, or state.
Aves: The class of Vertebrata that includes the birds.
Agister: Formerly, an officer of the king's forest, who had the care of cattle agisted, and collected the money for the same; -- hence called gisttaker, which in England is corrupted into guest-taker.
Accend: To set on fire; to kindle.
Alligator wrench: A kind of pipe wrench having a flaring jaw with teeth on one side.
Approximation: The act of approximating; a drawing, advancing or being near; approach; also, the result of approximating.
Angiography: A description of blood vessels and lymphatics.
albuca: any of various plants of the genus Albuca having large clusters of pale yellow flowers; native to South Africa.
Anticathode: The part of a vacuum tube opposite the cathode. Upon it the cathode rays impinge.
Apposer: An examiner; one whose business is to put questions. Formerly, in the English Court of Exchequer, an officer who audited the sheriffs' accounts.
Algin: A nitrogenous substance resembling gelatin, obtained from certain algæ.
Acinet\u00e6: A group of suctorial Infusoria, which in the adult stage are stationary. See Suctoria.
Affecter: One who affects, assumes, pretends, or strives after.
Apposed: Placed in apposition; mutually fitting, as the mandibles of a bird's beak.
Ataunt: Fully rigged, as a vessel; with all sails set; set on end or set right.
Afterbirth: The placenta and membranes with which the fetus is connected, and which come away after delivery.
archipallium: the olfactory cortex of the cerebrum.
100: the Arabic numerals representing the number one hundred; denoting a quantity consisting of one more than ninety nine and one less than one hundred and one; ten times ten
Accordantly: In accordance or agreement; agreeably; conformably; -- followed by with or to.
Atypic: That has no type; devoid of typical character; irregular; unlike the type.
Allheal: A name popularly given to the officinal valerian, and to some other plants.
All Saints: The first day of November, called, also, Allhallows or Hallowmas; a feast day kept in honor of all the saints; also, the season of this festival.
Atrip: Just hove clear of the ground; -- said of the anchor.
Archangel: A chief angel; one high in the celestial hierarchy.
Afraid: Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear; apprehensive.
Acidimeter: An instrument for ascertaining the strength of acids.
Amaranth: An imaginary flower supposed never to fade.
Allocate: To distribute or assign; to allot.
avens: A plant of the genus Geum, of the rose family, esp. Geum urbanum, or herb bennet.  They may bear red, yellow, or white flowers.
Ash-furnace: A furnace or oven for fritting materials for glass making.
Avercorn: A reserved rent in corn, formerly paid to religious houses by their tenants or farmers.
Accidental: A property which is not essential; a nonessential; anything happening accidentally.
aepyornis: A gigantic (to 9 ft.) extinct flightless bird, of which fossils were found in Madagascar.
Antipeptone: A product of gastric and pancreatic digestion, differing from hemipeptone in not being decomposed by the continued action of pancreatic juice.
Alepole: A pole set up as the sign of an alehouse.
Alces: a genus of elk or moose.
Accommodating: Affording, or disposed to afford, accommodation; obliging; as an accommodating man, spirit, arrangement.
Acipenser: A genus of ganoid fishes, including the sturgeons, having the body armed with bony scales, and the mouth on the under side of the head. See Sturgeon.
Astr\u00e6an: Pertaining to the genus Astræa or the family Astræidæ.
aligned: in or brought into line with or into proper relative position; -- of spatial position.
Anthracite: A hard, compact variety of mineral coal, of high luster, differing from bituminous coal in containing little or no bitumen, in consequence of which it burns with a nearly non luminous flame. The purer specimens consist almost wholly of carbon. Also called glance coal and blind coal.
Appaloosa: a hardy breed of horse developed in western North America and characteristically having a spotted rump.
Annotate: To make notes or comments; -- with on or upon.
Alabama period: A period in the American eocene, the lowest in the tertiary age except the lignitic.
Alpist: The seed of canary grass (Phalaris Canariensis), used for feeding cage birds.
Apt: To fit; to suit; to adapt.
Autography: The science of autographs; a person's own handwriting; an autograph.
Angiogram: am X-ray photograph produced by angiography.
Avernal: Of or pertaining to Avernus, a lake of Campania, in Italy, famous for its poisonous vapors, which ancient writers fancied were so malignant as to kill birds flying over it. It was represented by the poets to be connected with the infernal regions.
Asystole: A weakening or cessation of the contractile power of the heart.
\u00c6dile: A magistrate in ancient Rome, who had the superintendence of public buildings, highways, shows, etc.; hence, a municipal officer.
adventurism: recklessness in politics or foreign affairs.
Arch\u00e6olithic: Of or pertaining to the earliest Stone age; -- applied to a prehistoric period preceding the Paleolithic age.
Alsophila: a genus comprising the geometrid moths.
ataraxic: drug that reduces nervous tension and gives peace of mind.
Ant bird: See Ant bird, under Ant, n.
Anthropolite: A petrifaction of the human body, or of any portion of it.
Anhinga: An aquatic bird of the southern United States (Platus anhinga); the darter, or snakebird.
Actinaria: An order of Anthozoa, including those which have simple tentacles and do not form stony corals. Sometimes, in a wider sense, applied to all the Anthozoa, expert the Alcyonaria, whether forming corals or not.
Adesmy: The division or defective coherence of an organ that is usually entire.
Aceldama: The potter's field, said to have lain south of Jerusalem, purchased with the bribe which Judas took for betraying his Master, and therefore called the field of blood. Fig.: A field of bloodshed.
Argonaut: Any one of the legendary Greek heroes who sailed with Jason, in the Argo, in quest of the Golden Fleece.
ambivalent: undecided as to whether or not to take a proposed course of action; having feelings both for and against the proposed action.
Ale: An intoxicating liquor made from an infusion of malt by fermentation and the addition of a bitter, usually hops.
Abundantly: In a sufficient degree; fully; amply; plentifully; in large measure.
Air stove: A stove for heating a current of air which is directed against its surface by means of pipes, and then distributed through a building.
Alt: The higher part of the scale. See Alto.
Anabasis: A journey or expedition up from the coast, like that of the younger Cyrus into Central Asia, described by Xenophon in his work called “The Anabasis.”
Altazimuth: An instrument for taking azimuths and altitudes simultaneously.
Arpent: Formerly, a measure of land in France, varying in different parts of the country. The arpent of Paris was 4,088 sq. yards, or nearly five sixths of an English acre. The woodland arpent was about 1 acre, 1 rood, 1 perch, English.
Ascidium: A pitcher-shaped, or flask-shaped, organ or appendage of a plant, as the leaves of the pitcher plant, or the little bladderlike traps of the bladderwort (Utricularia).
Antacrid: Corrective of acrimony of the humors.
Acclamation: A shout of approbation, favor, or assent; eager expression of approval; loud applause.
Anoxic: of, pertaining to, or suffering from, anoxia.
Ahoy: A term used in hailing; as, “Ship ahoy.”
Aport: On or towards the port or left side; -- said of the helm.
Anion: An electro-negative atom or group of atoms, or the element which, in electro-chemical decompositions, is evolved at the anode; -- opposed to cation.
Appropriament: What is peculiarly one's own; peculiar qualification.
Alternatively: In the manner of alternatives, or that admits the choice of one out of two things.
atherosclerosis: a form of arteriosclerosis characterized by irregular fatty deposits on the inner surface of large and medium-sized arteries; the deposits are associated with fibrosis and calcification of the inner layer of the arteries.  Similar conditions may be found in swine and fowl.  The deposits may become large enough to impede the blood circulation and in some cases may restrict the blood supply to the heart.
Anisometric: Not isometric; having unsymmetrical parts; -- said of crystals with three unequal axes.
Arch\u00e6opteryx: A fossil bird, of the Jurassic period, remarkable for having a long tapering tail of many vertebræ with feathers along each side, and jaws armed with teeth, with other reptilian characteristics.
Additory: Tending to add; making some addition.
Amphibole: A common mineral embracing many varieties varying in color and in composition. It occurs in monoclinic crystals; also massive, generally with fibrous or columnar structure. The color varies from white to gray, green, brown, and black. It is a silicate of magnesium and calcium, with usually aluminium and iron. Some common varieties are tremolite, actinolite, asbestus, edenite, hornblende (the last name being also used as a general term for the whole species). Amphibole is a constituent of many crystalline rocks, as syenite, diorite, most varieties of trachyte, etc. See Hornblende.
Apneumatic: Devoid of air; free from air; as, an apneumatic lung; also, effected by or with exclusion of air; as, an apneumatic operation.
Adverbialize: To give the force or form of an adverb to.
Aggeration: A heaping up; accumulation; as, aggerations of sand.
After-image: The impression of a vivid sensation retained by the retina of the eye after the cause has been removed; also extended to impressions left of tones, smells, etc.
Accreditation: The act of accrediting; as, letters of accreditation.
adobo: a Philippine dish of marinated vegetables and meat or fish; served with rice.
Axial: Of or pertaining to an axis; of the nature of, or resembling, an axis; around an axis.
Alexipyretic: Serving to drive off fever; antifebrile.
autotroph: an organism which is autotrophic, i. e., an organism (such as most plants and certain microorganisms) which are capable of synthesizing its own food from simple organic substances, requiring only minerals as nutrients for growth, and using carbonate or carbon dioxide as a source of carbon and simple inorganic nitrogen as a nitrogen source; the energy required is derived from photosynthesis or chemosynthesis.  Opposed to heterotroph.  See also auxotroph.
Aragonese: Of or pertaining to Aragon, in Spain, or to its inhabitants.
Assimilative: Tending to, or characterized by, assimilation; that assimilates or causes assimilation; as, an assimilative process or substance.
Animadversive: Having the power of perceiving; percipient.
Allegheny: Of or pertaining to the Allegheny Mountains, or the region where they are situated. Also Al"le*gha`ny.
Acutilobate: Having acute lobes, as some leaves.
Arsenical: Of or pertaining to, or containing, arsenic; as, arsenical vapor; arsenical wall papers.
Alexipharmic: An antidote against poison or infection; a counterpoison.
Anchor watch: A detail of one or more men who keep watch on deck at night when a vessel is at anchor.
Angrily: In an angry manner; under the influence of anger.
Augustinian: One of a class of divines, who, following St. Augustine, maintain that grace by its nature is effectual absolutely and creatively, not relatively and conditionally.
Anguidae: a family comprising the alligator lizards.
Abuttal: The butting or boundary of land, particularly at the end; a headland.
Azadirachta: a genus of large important East Indian trees: the neem trees.
Acock: In a cocked or turned up fashion.
Avoke: To call from or back again.
astronautics: the theory and practice of navigation through the upper atmosphere or outer space; the science of travel in space.
Apteria: Naked spaces between the feathered areas of birds. See Pteryliæ.
Alburn: The bleak, a small European fish having scales of a peculiarly silvery color which are used in making artificial pearls.
Approve: To make profit of; to convert to one's own profit; -- said esp. of waste or common land appropriated by the lord of the manor.
Art union: An association for promoting art (esp. the arts of design), and giving encouragement to artists.
accroach: To hook, or draw to one's self as with a hook.
Artiad: Even; not odd; -- said of elementary substances and of radicals the valence of which is divisible by two without a remainder.
Annelid: Of or pertaining to the Annelida.
Azoth: The first principle of metals, i. e., mercury, which was formerly supposed to exist in all metals, and to be extractable from them.
Aerie: The nest of a bird of prey, as of an eagle or hawk; also a brood of such birds; eyrie. Shak. Also fig.: A human residence or resting place perched like an eagle's nest.
Aretology: That part of moral philosophy which treats of virtue, its nature, and the means of attaining to it.
Archduchy: The territory of an archduke or archduchess.
Archon: One of the chief magistrates in ancient Athens, especially, by preëminence, the first of the nine chief magistrates.
Abatis: A means of defense formed by felled trees, the ends of whose branches are sharpened and directed outwards, or against the enemy.
Adjunctly: By way of addition or adjunct; in connection with.
ameban: of or pertaining to amoebae.  Same as amoeban.
all-time: unsurpassed in some respect up to the present.
Animation: The act of animating, or giving life or spirit; the state of being animate or alive.
Adequateness: The quality of being adequate; suitableness; sufficiency; adequacy.
Aden ulcer: A disease endemic in various parts of tropical Asia, due to a specific microörganism which produces chronic ulcers on the limbs. It is often fatal. Called also Cochin China ulcer, Persian ulcer, tropical ulcer, etc.
Assentive: Giving assent; of the nature of assent; complying.
anole: A small arboreal tropical American insectivorous lizard (Anolis carolinensis) with the ability to change skin color.
Admittatur: The certificate of admission given in some American colleges.
Appertinent: That which belongs to something else; an appurtenant.
Acquittal: The act of acquitting; discharge from debt or obligation; acquittance.
Alimentary: Pertaining to aliment or food, or to the function of nutrition; nutritious; alimental; as, alimentary substances.
Attorney: To perform by proxy; to employ as a proxy.
Affricate: A combination of a stop, or explosive, with an immediately following fricative or spirant of corresponding organic position, as pf in german Pfeffer, pepper, z (= ts) in German Zeit, time.
Archlute: A large theorbo, or double-necked lute, formerly in use, having the bass strings doubled with an octave, and the higher strings with a unison.
Apothecium: The ascigerous fructification of lichens, forming masses of various shapes.
annoyed: aroused to impatience or anger; as, feeling annoyed by the constant teasing.
Acanthopterygii: An order of fishes having some of the rays of the dorsal, ventral, and anal fins unarticulated and spinelike, as the perch.
Accelerometer: An apparatus for measuring the velocity imparted by gunpowder.
Auctioneer: To sell by auction; to auction.
American plan: In hotels, aplan upon which guests pay for both room and board by the day, week, or other convenient period; -- contrasted with European plan.
Accipitres: The order that includes rapacious birds. They have a hooked bill, and sharp, strongly curved talons. There are three families, represented by the vultures, the falcons or hawks, and the owls.
Ardor: Heat, in a literal sense; as, the ardor of the sun's rays.
10: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than nine and one less than eleven; -- representing the number ten as Arabic numerals
Albanian: Of or pertaining to Albania, a province of Turkey.
Atmosphere: The whole mass of aëriform fluid surrounding the earth; -- applied also to the gaseous envelope of any celestial orb, or other body; as, the atmosphere of Mars.
Atonable: Admitting an atonement; capable of being atoned for; expiable.
Aigret: The small white European heron. See Egret.
Acotyledonous: Having no seed lobes, as the dodder; also applied to plants which have no true seeds, as ferns, mosses, etc.
Avoyer: A chief magistrate of a free imperial city or canton of Switzerland.
18: one more than seventeen; denoting a quantity consisting of one more than seventeen and one less than nineteen; -- representing the number eighteen as Arabic numerals
Apothem: The perpendicular from the center to one of the sides of a regular polygon.
Azolla: a genus of ferns, someties placed in its own family Azollaceae.
Afterwise: Wise after the event; wise or knowing, when it is too late.
Araceous: Of or pertaining to an order of plants, of which the genus Arum is the type.
Avocative: That which calls aside; a dissuasive.
Assayer: One who assays. Specifically: One who examines metallic ores or compounds, for the purpose of determining the amount of any particular metal in the same, especially of gold or silver.
Apple-john: A kind of apple which by keeping becomes much withered; -- called also Johnapple.
Archegonium: The pistillidium or female organ in the higher cryptogamic plants, corresponding to the pistil in flowering plants.
Ampyx: A woman's headband (sometimes of metal), for binding the front hair.
Argent: Made of silver; of a silvery color; white; shining.
Aciniform: Having the form of a cluster of grapes; clustered like grapes.
Australasian: Of or pertaining to Australasia; as, Australasian regions.
Aplustre: An ornamental appendage of wood at the ship's stern, usually spreading like a fan and curved like a bird's feather.
androgen: a hormone, such as testosterone or androsterone, that promotes development and maintenance of typical male sexual characteristics.  They are mostly produced in the testes.
Appease: To make quiet; to calm; to reduce to a state of peace; to still; to pacify; to dispel (anger or hatred); as, to appease the tumult of the ocean, or of the passions; to appease hunger or thirst.
Abnormal: Not conformed to rule or system; deviating from the type; anomalous; irregular.
Amine: One of a class of basic substances derived from ammonia by replacement of one or more hydrogen atoms by an alkyl or aryl group.  Compare amide, in which an acyl group is attached to the nitrogen.  Hydroxylamine and hydrazine, which are not an organic compounds, are also basic and may also be considered amines.
Asternal: Not sternal; -- said of ribs which do not join the sternum.
Aggravate: To make heavy or heavier; to add to; to increase.
Adeptness: The quality of being adept; skill.
Autobiography: A biography written by the subject of it; memoirs of one's life written by one's self.
Antidotal: Having the quality an antidote; fitted to counteract the effects of poison.
Androcephalous: Having a human head (upon an animal's body), as the Egyptian sphinx.
Acrylic resin: a thermoplastic made by polymerization of acrylic acid or methacrylic acid or some derivative of these (such as the esters or amides).  It can be formed into a clear hard plastic, and is the basis for the commercial plastics called Lucite and Plexiglass.
Attachment: The act attaching, or state of being attached; close adherence or affection; fidelity; regard; an&unr_; passion of affection that binds a person; as, an attachment to a friend, or to a party.
Allantoidea: The division of Vertebrata in which the embryo develops an allantois. It includes reptiles, birds, and mammals.
Adorable: Deserving to be adored; worthy of divine honors.
Amazonian: Pertaining to or resembling an Amazon; of masculine manners; warlike.
Assumer: One who assumes, arrogates, pretends, or supposes.
Accusable: Liable to be accused or censured; chargeable with a crime or fault; blamable; -- with of.
Acreage: Acres collectively; as, the acreage of a farm or a country.
Acadia: the French-speaking part of the Canadian Maritime Provinces.
Acquiescent: Resting satisfied or submissive; disposed tacitly to submit; assentive; as, an acquiescent policy.
\u00c6sculapius: The god of medicine. Hence, a physician.
Arbutus: The strawberry tree, a genus of evergreen shrubs, of the Heath family. It has a berry externally resembling the strawberry; the arbute tree.
Appui: A support or supporter; a stay; a prop.
Acerose: Having the nature of chaff; chaffy.
Ale silver: A duty payable to the lord mayor of London by the sellers of ale within the city.
Adiaphorist: One of the German Protestants who, with Melanchthon, held some opinions and ceremonies to be indifferent or nonessential, which Luther condemned as sinful or heretical.
Advertiser: One who, or that which, advertises.
Anaglyptic: Relating to the art of carving, enchasing, or embossing in low relief.
Athletic: Of or pertaining to athletes or to the exercises practiced by them; as, athletic games or sports.
Abandonment: The act of abandoning, or the state of being abandoned; total desertion; relinquishment.
Alphabetics: The science of representing spoken sounds by letters.
Apostatize: To renounce totally a religious belief once professed; to forsake one's church, the faith or principles once held, or the party to which one has previously adhered.
aeroplane: A light rigid plane used in aërial navigation to oppose sudden upward or downward movement in the air, as in gliding machines; specif., such a plane slightly inclined and driven forward as a lifting device in some flying machines.  Also called airfoil.
Angio-: A prefix, or combining form, in numerous compounds, usually relating to seed or blood vessels, or to something contained in, or covered by, a vessel.
alkaline-loving: thriving in a relatively alkaline environment; (especially of plants requiring a pH above 7)
ampere-second: a unit of charge equal to that acquired by the accumulation of one ampere for one second.
Arrangement: The act of arranging or putting in an orderly condition; the state of being arranged or put in order; disposition in suitable form.
Allude: To compare allusively; to refer (something) as applicable.
Anguilla: a British colony, comprising an island in the Caribbean Sea, east of Puerto Rico, with a total area of 91 sq km.  Its population in 1996 was estimated at 10,424. The official language is English.
Assyriological: Of or pertaining to Assyriology; as, Assyriological studies.
Apathetic: Void of feeling; not susceptible of deep emotion; passionless.
Air gap: An air-filled gap in a magnetic or electric circuit; specif., in a dynamo or motor, the space between the field-magnet poles and the armature; clearance.
Autosuggestion: Self-suggestion as distinguished from suggestion coming from another, especially in hypnotism. Autosuggestion is characteristic of certain mental conditions in which expectant belief tends to produce disturbance of function of one or more organs.
Axillary: Of or pertaining to the axilla or armpit; as, axillary gland, artery, nerve.
Anthophagous: Eating flowers; -- said of certain insects.
Associational: Of or pertaining to association, or to an association.
Aldehydic: Of or pertaining to aldehyde; as, aldehydic acid.
Abuna: The Patriarch, or head of the Abyssinian Church.
Aim: The pointing of a weapon, as a gun, a dart, or an arrow, in the line of direction with the object intended to be struck; the line of fire; the direction of anything, as a spear, a blow, a discourse, a remark, towards a particular point or object, with a view to strike or affect it.
Angle of entry: The angle between the tangent to the advancing edge (of an aërocurve) and the line of motion; -- contrasted with angle of trail, which is the angle between the tangent to the following edge and the line of motion.
achimenes: any plant of the genus Achimenes having gloxinialike flowers.
Abominable: Worthy of, or causing, abhorrence, as a thing of evil omen; odious in the utmost degree; very hateful; detestable; loathsome; execrable.
Astrology: In its etymological signification, the science of the stars; among the ancients, synonymous with astronomy; subsequently, the art of judging of the influences of the stars upon human affairs, and of foretelling events by their position and aspects.
Archeology: the branch of anthropology that studies prehistoric people and their cultures.  Same as Archæology, etc.
Attestant: a person who attests to the genuineness of a document or signature by adding their own signature.
Aubin: A broken gait of a horse, between an amble and a gallop; -- commonly called a Canterbury gallop.
A\u00ebrophone: A form of combined speaking and ear trumpet.
Amaryllidaceae: a family of flowering plants including the snowdrop, narcissus, and daffodil; in some classification systems considered a subfamily of the Liliaceae.
Acanthocephala: A group of intestinal worms, having the proboscis armed with recurved spines.
Aquarius: The Water-bearer; the eleventh sign in the zodiac, which the sun enters about the 20th of January; -- so called from the rains which prevail at that season in Italy and the East.
Adrenaline: a hormone secreted by the adrenal medulla that acts as a powerful stimulant in reponse to fear or stress; it stimulates autonomic nerve action.  It can be obtained as a crystalline substance, C9H13NO3. It is used in medicine as a vasoconstrictor (hemostatic) and cardiac stimulant, also to reduce allergic reactions and to stimulate the heart in cases of cardiac arrest.
Aquarium: An artificial pond, or a globe or tank (usually with glass sides), in which living specimens of aquatic animals or plants are kept.
allele: one of two or more alternative forms of a gene that can have the same place on homologous chromosomes and are responsible for alternative traits.
Angelify: To make like an angel; to angelize.
Abscissa: One of the elements of reference by which a point, as of a curve, is referred to a system of fixed rectilineal coördinate axes.
Anim\u00e9: A resin exuding from a tropical American tree (Hymenæa courbaril), and much used by varnish makers.
Absist: To stand apart from; top leave off; to desist.
airheaded: lacking seriousness; given to frivolity; scatterbrained; stupid; simple-minded; as, airheaded teenagers.  Contrasted with serious, solemn
Aspic: A savory meat jelly containing portions of fowl, game, fish, hard boiled eggs, etc.
andrenid: a bee that is a a member of the genus Andrena..
Aliphatic: Of, pertaining to, or derived from, fat; fatty; -- applied to compounds having an open-chain structure. The aliphatic compounds thus include not only the fatty acids and other derivatives of the paraffin hydrocarbons, but also unsaturated compounds, as the ethylene and acetylene series.  Compare alicyclic and aromatic.
Arc: To form a voltaic arc, as an electrical current in a broken or disconnected circuit.
Asphaltic: Pertaining to, of the nature of, or containing, asphalt; bituminous.
Are: The unit of superficial measure, being a square of which each side is ten meters in length; 100 square meters, or about 119.6 square yards.
Arm: To provide one's self with arms, weapons, or means of attack or resistance; to take arms.
assimilating: tending to or characterized by or causing assimilation (being absorbed into or incorporated).
Adjunct: Something joined or added to another thing, but not essentially a part of it.
Alatern: An ornamental evergreen shrub (Rhamnus alaternus) belonging to the buckthorns.
Aplanogamete: A nonmotile gamete, found in certain lower algæ.
Autodynamic: Supplying its own power, as a hydraulic ram.
Arecidae: one of four subclasses or superorder of Monocotyledones; comprises about 6400 species in 5 families of trees and shrubs and terrestrial herbs and a few free-floating aquatics including: Palmae; Araceae; Pandanaceae: and Lemnaceae.
Acrolein: A limpid, colorless, highly volatile liquid, obtained by the dehydration of glycerin, or the destructive distillation of neutral fats containing glycerin. Its vapors are intensely irritating.
Amulet: An ornament, gem, or scroll, or a package containing a relic, etc., worn as a charm or preservative against evils or mischief, such as diseases and witchcraft, and generally inscribed with mystic forms or characters. [Also used figuratively.]
Amomum: A genus of aromatic plants. It includes species which bear cardamoms, and grains of paradise.
Arcadia: A mountainous and picturesque district of Greece, in the heart of the Peloponnesus, whose people were distinguished for contentment and rural happiness.
Able-bodied: Having a sound, strong body; physically competent; robust.
Agedly: In the manner of an aged person.
Astrofel: A bitter herb, probably the same as aster, or starwort.
Alkalifiable: Capable of being alkalified, or converted into an alkali.
Ammonite: A fossil cephalopod shell related to the nautilus. There are many genera and species, and all are extinct, the typical forms having existed only in the Mesozoic age, when they were exceedingly numerous. They differ from the nautili in having the margins of the septa very much lobed or plaited, and the siphuncle dorsal. Also called serpent stone, snake stone, and cornu Ammonis.
Actiniopteris: a genus of terrestrial ferns of tropical Asia and Africa.
Abstract: That which comprises or concentrates in itself the essential qualities of a larger thing or of several things. Specifically: A summary or an epitome, as of a treatise or book, or of a statement; a brief.
Apophyllite: A mineral relating to the zeolites, usually occurring in square prisms or octahedrons with pearly luster on the cleavage surface. It is a hydrous silicate of calcium and potassium.
astrocyte: a large star-shaped neuroglial cell in nervous tissue.
Abdominales: A group including the greater part of fresh-water fishes, and many marine ones, having the ventral fins under the abdomen behind the pectorals.
Articled: Bound by articles; apprenticed; as, an articled clerk.
Aboveboard: Above the board or table. Hence: in open sight; without trick, concealment, or deception.
Astray: Out of the right, either in a literal or in a figurative sense; wandering; as, to lead one astray.
aminomethane: a methyl with the hydrogen atom replaced by an amino radical.
Astral: Pertaining to, coming from, or resembling, the stars; starry; starlike.
Atheistic: Pertaining to, implying, or containing, atheism; -- applied to things; as, atheistic doctrines, opinions, or books.
African-American: an American whose ancestors were born in Africa, especially a United States citizen of African descent.
acarid: very small free-living arachnid that is parasitic on animals or plants; related to ticks.
Afflictedness: The state of being afflicted; affliction.
Aleurometer: An instrument for determining the expansive properties, or quality, of gluten in flour.
Assume: To be arrogant or pretentious; to claim more than is due.
