Availableness: Competent power; validity; efficacy; as, the availableness of a title.
Apathy: Want of feeling; privation of passion, emotion, or excitement; dispassion; -- applied either to the body or the mind. As applied to the mind, it is a calmness, indolence, or state of indifference, incapable of being ruffled or roused to active interest or exertion by pleasure, pain, or passion.
Aroph: A barbarous word used by the old chemists to designate various medical remedies.
Archimedes: An extinct genus of Bryzoa characteristic of the subcarboniferous rocks. Its form is that of a screw.
Atrabilarian: A person much given to melancholy; a hypochondriac.
Antecedency: The state or condition of being antecedent; priority.
Amentiferae: used in some classification systems for plants that bear catkins.
Agrostology: That part of botany which treats of the grasses.
Adrianopolis: a city in Northwest Turkey; a Thracian town that was rebuilt and renamed by the Roman emperor Hadrian.
Armozeen: A thick plain silk, generally black, and used for clerical.
Antecedence: The act or state of going before in time; precedence.
Amatorial: Of or pertaining to a lover or to love making; amatory; as, amatorial verses.
Abstractiveness: The quality of being abstractive; abstractive property.
28th: coming next after the twenty-seventh in a series
Ascend: To go or move upward upon or along; to climb; to mount; to go up the top of; as, to ascend a hill, a ladder, a tree, a river, a throne.
A\u00ebrobiotic: Related to, or of the nature of, aërobies; as, aërobiotic plants, which live only when supplied with free oxygen.
Acalycine: Without a calyx, or outer floral envelope.
Aphorism: A comprehensive maxim or principle expressed in a few words; a sharply defined sentence relating to abstract truth rather than to practical matters.
Avestan: Of or pertaining to the Avesta or the language of the Avesta.
Arthritis: Any inflammation of the joints, including the gout.  A variety of forms of arthritis are recognized, some of which (such as rheumatoid arthritis, also called arthritis deformans and arthritis nodosa) are chronic and progressive, and lead to incapacitation and deformity.
Andrew: one of the twelve apostles of Jesus; brother of Peter; patron saint of Scotland.
Assay ton: A weight of 29.166 + grams used in assaying, for convenience. Since it bears the same relation to the milligram that a ton of 2000 avoirdupois pounds does to the troy ounce, the weight in milligrams of precious metal obtained from an assay ton of ore gives directly the number of ounces to the ton.
Arthrotome: A strong scalpel used in the dissection of joints.
Axle: The pin or spindle on which a wheel revolves, or which revolves with a wheel.
Aphorist: A writer or utterer of aphorisms.
Amateurish: In the style of an amateur; superficial or defective like the work of an amateur.
Amateurism: The practice, habit, or work of an amateur.
Apologue: A story or relation of fictitious events, intended to convey some moral truth; a moral fable.
Araliaceae: a family of mostly tropical trees and shrubs and lianas: ginseng; hedera.
authorities: the organization that is the governing authority of a political unit.
Asiarch: One of the chiefs or pontiffs of the Roman province of Asia, who had the superintendence of the public games and religious rites.
Amon-Ra: the ancient Egyptian sun god; supreme god of the universe in whom Amen and Ra were combined; principal deity during Theban supremacy.
Atmometer: An instrument for measuring the rate of evaporation from a moist surface; an evaporometer.
Anglo-French: the French (Norman) language used in medieval England.
Anthophyllite: A mineral of the hornblende group, of a yellowish gray or clove brown color.
Adopted: Taken by adoption; taken up as one's own; as, an adopted son, citizen, country, word.
Amphigean: Extending over all the zones, from the tropics to the polar zones inclusive.
Autoplasty: The process of artificially repairing lesions by taking a piece of healthy tissue, as from a neighboring part, to supply the deficiency caused by disease or wounds.
Aland: On land; to the land; ashore.
Asiphonea: A group of bivalve mollusks destitute of siphons, as the oyster; the asiphonate mollusks.
21st: coming next after the twentieth in a series
Atacamite: An oxychloride of copper, usually in emerald-green prismatic crystals.
Ambulatory: A place to walk in, whether in the open air, as the gallery of a cloister, or within a building.
0: indicating the absence of any or all units under consideration; -- representing the number zero as an Arabic numeral
Alluvion: Wash or flow of water against the shore or bank.
Annuitant: One who receives, or its entitled to receive, an annuity.
Atlanta: A genus of small glassy heteropod mollusks found swimming at the surface in mid ocean. See Heteropod.
antediluvian: Of or relating to the period before the Deluge in Noah's time; hence, antiquated; as, an antediluvian vehicle.
Abusiveness: The quality of being abusive; rudeness of language, or violence to the person.
archegoniate: of or pertaining to an archegonium.
Aufkl\u00e4rung: A philosophic movement of the 18th century characterized by a lively questioning of authority, keen interest in matters of politics and general culture, and an emphasis on empirical method in science. It received its impetus from the unsystematic but vigorous skepticism of Pierre Bayle, the physical doctrines of Newton, and the epistemological theories of Locke, in the preceding century. Its chief center was in France, where it gave rise to the skepticism of Voltaire , the naturalism of Rousseau, the sensationalism of Condillac, and the publication of the “Encyclopedia” by D'Alembert and Diderot. In Germany, Lessing, Mendelssohn, and Herder were representative thinkers, while the political doctrines of the leaders of the American Revolution and the speculations of Benjamin Franklin and Thomas Paine represented the movement in America.
advised: Carefully thought out; likely to be the best course; -- said of actions.  Often used in combination; as, ill-advised, well-advised.
Appendage: Something appended to, or accompanying, a principal or greater thing, though not necessary to it, as a portico to a house.
Ant-cattle: Various kinds of plant lice or aphids tended by ants for the sake of the honeydew which they secrete; plural of ant cow. See Aphips.
apartheid: segregation by race; -- a term used in South Africa.
arenicolous: growing or living or burrowing in sand.
Apperception: The mind's perception of itself as the subject or actor in its own states; perception that reflects upon itself; sometimes, intensified or energetic perception.
Au gratin: With a crust made by browning in the oven, especially by sprinkling with bread crumbs or grated cheese and browning in a broiler; as, spaghetti may be served au gratin.
Arachnidium: The glandular organ in which the material for the web of spiders is secreted.
Arenaceous: Sandy or consisting largely of sand; of the nature of sand; easily disintegrating into sand; friable; as, arenaceous limestone.
Adonist: One who maintains that points of the Hebrew word translated “Jehovah” are really the vowel points of the word “Adonai.” See Jehovist.
Aline: To range or place in a line; to bring into line; to align.
Acidify: To make acid; to convert into an acid; as, to acidify sugar.
Appreciation: A just valuation or estimate of merit, worth, weight, etc.; recognition of excellence.
Accessible: Easy of access or approach; approachable; as, an accessible town or mountain, an accessible person.
Aimer: One who aims, directs, or points.
Antithesis: An opposition or contrast of words or sentiments occurring in the same sentence; as, “The prodigal robs his heir; the miser robs himself.”  “He had covertly shot at Cromwell; he how openly aimed at the Queen.”
Amphoral: Pertaining to, or resembling, an amphora.
Acotyledon: A plant which has no cotyledons, as the dodder and all flowerless plants.
Anthobian: A beetle which feeds on flowers.
Admission: The act or practice of admitting.
Acidifier: A simple or compound principle, whose presence is necessary to produce acidity, as oxygen, chlorine, bromine, iodine, etc.
Alidade: The portion of a graduated instrument, as a quadrant or astrolabe, carrying the sights or telescope, and showing the degrees cut off on the arc of the instrument
Antipathy: Contrariety or opposition in feeling; settled aversion or dislike; repugnance; distaste.
ailing: sick; unhealthy.  Opposite of well or healthy.
Achieve: To carry on to a final close; to bring out into a perfected state; to accomplish; to perform; -- as, to achieve a feat, an exploit, an enterprise.
Appliqu\u00e9: Ornamented with a pattern (which has been cut out of another color or stuff) applied or transferred to a foundation; as, appliqué lace; appliqué work.
aspidistra: an evergreen perennial (Aspidistra elatio) with large handsome basal leaves; grown primarily as a foliage houseplant.
Abaxial: Away from the axis or central line; eccentric.
after-shave lotion: a fragrant lotion for a man's face after shaving.
Adjourn: To suspend business for a time, as from one day to another, or for a longer period, or indefinitely; usually, to suspend public business, as of legislatures and courts, or other convened bodies; as, congress adjourned at four o'clock; the court adjourned without day.
Altitude: Space extended upward; height; the perpendicular elevation of an object above its foundation, above the ground, or above a given level, or of one object above another; as, the altitude of a mountain, or of a bird above the top of a tree.
Agriculturist: One engaged or skilled in agriculture; a husbandman.
Awkward squad: A squad of inapt recruits assembled for special drill.
Atrocity: Enormous wickedness; extreme heinousness or cruelty.
affixial: of or pertaining to an affix.
Arborary: Of or pertaining to trees; arboreal.
Augmentative: A word which expresses with augmented force the idea or the properties of the term from which it is derived; as, dullard, one very dull. Opposed to diminutive.
9th: coming next after the eighth and just before the tenth in position
Abnet: The girdle of a Jewish priest or officer.
Abay: Barking; baying of dogs upon their prey. See Bay.
Archive: The place in which public records or historic documents are kept.
Adaptedness: The state or quality of being adapted; suitableness; special fitness.
Anopsia: Want or defect of sight; blindness.
Anemographic: Produced by an anemograph; of or pertaining to anemography.
Approachable: Capable of being approached; accessible; as, approachable virtue.
A\u00ebrify: To infuse air into; to combine air with.
Abject: A person in the lowest and most despicable condition; a castaway.
Australize: To tend toward the south pole, as a magnet.
Attitudinize: To assume affected attitudes; to strike an attitude; to pose.
Acerous: Destitute of tentacles, as certain mollusks.
Awlwort: A plant (Subularia aquatica), with awl-shaped leaves.
Aberrance: the state or condition of being aberrant; a wandering from the right way; deviation from truth, rectitude, etc.
Amphitheatrically: In the form or manner of an amphitheater.
Amic: Related to, or derived, ammonia; -- used chiefly as a suffix; as, amic acid; phosphamic acid.
Actinophonic: Pertaining to, or causing the production of, sound by means of the actinic, or ultraviolet, rays; as, actinophonic phenomena.
Anthropologist: One who is versed in anthropology.
Arsenopyrite: A mineral of a tin-white color and metallic luster, containing arsenic, sulphur, and iron; -- also called arsenical pyrites and mispickel.
6th: Coming next after the fifth in a series
Aculeolate: Having small prickles or sharp points.
Acrophony: The use of a picture symbol of an object to represent phonetically the initial sound of the name of the object.
Artillery wheel: A kind of heavily built dished wheel with a long axle box, used on gun carriages, usually having 14 spokes and 7 felloes; hence, a wheel of similar construction for use on automobiles, etc.
Anchovy pear: A West Indian fruit like the mango in taste, sometimes pickled; also, the tree (Grias cauliflora) bearing this fruit.
Applier: He who, or that which, applies.
Arraswise: Placed in such a position as to exhibit the top and two sides, the corner being in front; -- said of a rectangular form.
Argentamine: A solution of silver phosphate in an aqueous solution of ethylene diamine, used as an antiseptic astringent and as a disinfectant.
Actinomycosis: A chronic infectious disease of cattle and man due to infection with actinomycetes, especially by Actinomyces bovis in cattle and by Actinomyces israeli or Arachnia propionica in man. It is characterized by hard swellings usually in the mouth and jaw.  In man the disease may also affect the abdomen or thorax.  Called also lumpy jaw or big jaw.
Aviette: A heavier-than-air flying machine in which the motive power is furnished solely by the aviator.
Achilles tendon: The strong tendon formed of the united tendons of the large muscles in the calf of the leg, an inserted into the bone of the heel; -- so called from the mythological account of Achilles being held by the heel when dipped in the River Styx.
applecart: the planning that is disrupted when someone "upsets the applecart".
A\u00ebrographer: One versed in aëography: an aërologist.
Asexual: Having no distinct sex; without sexual action; as, asexual reproduction. See Fission and Gemmation.
Anbury: A soft tumor or bloody wart on horses or oxen.
Adulteration: The act of adulterating; corruption, or debasement (esp. of food or drink) by foreign mixture.
Adulterer: A man who commits adultery; a married man who has sexual intercourse with a woman not his wife.
Amphipneust: One of a tribe of Amphibia, which have both lungs and gills at the same time, as the proteus and siren.
Apprehensive: Capable of apprehending, or quick to do so; apt; discerning.
Armorer: One who makes or repairs armor or arms.
Affliction: The cause of continued pain of body or mind, as sickness, losses, etc.; an instance of grievous distress; a pain or grief.
Adays: By day, or every day; in the daytime.
Archeus: The vital principle or force which (according to the Paracelsians) presides over the growth and continuation of living beings; the anima mundi or plastic power of the old philosophers.
Autarchy: Self-sufficiency, especially economic self-sufficiency as applied to nations.
Arsenicism: A diseased condition produced by slow poisoning with arsenic.
Altarwise: In the proper position of an altar, that is, at the east of a church with its ends towards the north and south.
ascendent: position or state of being dominant or in control.
3rd: coming next after the second in a series
Amphigory: A nonsense verse; a rigmarole, with apparent meaning, which on further attention proves to be meaningless.
aqualung: an apparatus containing compressed air or other oxygen-gas mixture, permitting a person to breathe under water; -- also called a scuba.
Anthropomorphosis: Transformation into the form of a human being.
Acetosity: The quality of being acetous; sourness.
ammoniate: treat with ammonia; expose to ammonia
Asteridian: Of or pertaining to the Asterioidea.
aioli: a French garlic-flavored mayonnaise.  It is often served with fish and other seafood, and sometimes with vegetables.
Adularia: A transparent or translucent variety of common feldspar, or orthoclase, which often shows pearly opalescent reflections; -- called by lapidaries moonstone.
Afternoon: The part of the day which follows noon, between noon and evening.
Already: Prior to some specified time, either past, present, or future; by this time; previously.
Azotine: An explosive consisting of sodium nitrate, charcoal, sulphur, and petroleum.
Agnatha: a class of eel-shaped chordates with a cartilaginous skeleton lacking jaws, scales, and pelvic fins.  Among these are the lampreys and hagfishes.  There are some extinct forms.
Amphitheater: An oval or circular building with rising tiers of seats about an open space called the arena.
Apo: A prefix from a Greek preposition. It usually signifies from, away from, off, or asunder, separate; as, in apocope (a cutting off), apostate, apostle (one sent away), apocarpous.
Annualist: One who writes for, or who edits, an annual.
Ape: To mimic, as an ape imitates human actions; to imitate or follow servilely or irrationally.
Authenticate: To render authentic; to give authority to, by the proof, attestation, or formalities required by law, or sufficient to entitle to credit.
Abscission: The act or process of cutting off.
Aphilanthropy: Want of love to mankind; -- the opposite of philanthropy.
Amioid: Like or pertaining to the Amioidei.
Arc light: The light of an arc lamp.  See arc lamp under lamp.
Anglo-American: an American who was born in England or whose ancestors were English.
Abjuration: The act of abjuring or forswearing; a renunciation upon oath; as, abjuration of the realm, a sworn banishment, an oath taken to leave the country and never to return.
Abbacy: The dignity, estate, or jurisdiction of an abbot.
Air pump: A kind of pump for exhausting air from a vessel or closed space; also, a pump to condense air or force it into a closed space.
Abduction: The act of abducing or abducting; a drawing apart; a carrying away.
Annunciation: The act of announcing; announcement; proclamation; as, the annunciation of peace.
Ambassadorship: The state, office, or functions of an ambassador.
adrenergic: producing or activated by epinephrine or adrenaline
Air cell: A cavity in the cellular tissue of plants, containing air only.
Asyndetic: Characterized by the use of asyndeton; not connected by conjunctions.
11: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than ten and one less than twelve; -- representing the number eleven as Arabic numerals
Adorableness: The quality of being adorable, or worthy of adoration.
13: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than twelve and one less than fourteen; -- representing the number thirteen as Arabic numerals
12: denoting a quantity consisting of 12 items or units; -- representing the number twelve as Arabic numerals
15: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than fourteen and one less than sixteen; -- representing the number fifteen as Arabic numerals
14: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than thirteen and one less than fifteen; -- representing the number fourteen as Arabic numerals
17: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than sixteen and one less than eighteen; -- representing the number seventeen as Arabic numerals
16: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than fifteen and one less than seventeen; -- representing the number sixteen as Arabic numerals
19: one more than eighteen; denoting a quantity consisting of one more than eighteen and one less than twenty; -- representing the number nineteen as Arabic numerals
Alexiteric: A preservative against contagious and infectious diseases, and the effects of poison in general.
Alcyonoid: Like or pertaining to the Alcyonaria.
Arrear: That which is behind in payment, or which remains unpaid, though due; esp. a remainder, or balance which remains due when some part has been paid; arrearage; -- commonly used in the plural, as, arrears of rent, wages, or taxes.
Abjectedness: A very abject or low condition; abjectness.
Antispast: A foot of four syllables, the first and fourth short, and the second and third long (#).
Actinula: A kind of embryo of certain hydroids (Tubularia), having a stellate form.
Asphyxiate: To bring to a state of asphyxia; to suffocate. [Used commonly in the past pple.]
Anguine: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, a snake or serpent.
Angiosperm: A plant which has its seeds inclosed in a pericarp.  Contrasted with gymnosperm.
Abuser: One who abuses [in the various senses of the verb].
accrementition: The process of generation by development of blastema, or fission of cells, in which the new formation is in all respects like the individual from which it proceeds.
Aver: To assert, or prove, the truth of.
Assemblage: The act of assembling, or the state of being assembled; association.
Anasa: a genus comprising the squash bugs.
Actively: In an active manner; nimbly; briskly; energetically; also, by one's own action; voluntarily, not passively.
Acolyctine: An organic base, in the form of a white powder, obtained from Aconitum lycoctonum.
Amsterdam: a large city which is an industrial center and the nominal capital of the Netherlands.
Alphol: A crystalline derivative of salicylic acid, used as an antiseptic and antirheumatic.
Arrayer: One who arrays. In some early English statutes, applied to an officer who had care of the soldiers' armor, and who saw them duly accoutered.
Abutter: One who, or that which, abuts. Specifically, the owner of a contiguous estate; as, the abutters on a street or a river.
Assassination: The act of assassinating; a killing by treacherous violence.
Across: From side to side; crosswise; as, with arms folded across.
Anchovy: A small fish, about three inches in length, of the Herring family (Engraulis encrasicholus), caught in vast numbers in the Mediterranean, and pickled for exportation. The name is also applied to several allied species.
Arillode: A false aril; an aril originating from the micropyle instead of from the funicle or chalaza of the ovule. The mace of the nutmeg is an arillode.
Awl: A pointed instrument for piercing small holes, as in leather or wood; used by shoemakers, saddlers, cabinetmakers, etc. The blade is differently shaped and pointed for different uses, as in the brad awl, saddler's awl, shoemaker's awl, etc.
Amylaceous: Pertaining to starch; of the nature of starch; starchy.
Agglutinative: Pertaining to agglutination; tending to unite, or having power to cause adhesion; adhesive.
Antinephritic: Counteracting, or deemed of use in, diseases of the kidneys.
awareness: conscious knowledge; as, he had no awareness of his mistakes.
Arctiidae: a family comprising the tiger moths.
Amia: A genus of fresh-water ganoid fishes, exclusively confined to North America; called bowfin in Lake Champlain, dogfish in Lake Erie, and mudfish in South Carolina, etc. See Bowfin.
Apaches: A group of nomadic North American Indians including several tribes native of Arizona, New Mexico, etc.
Avicenniaceae: a family name used in some classifications: coextensive with the genus Avicennia.
ambiversive: intermediate between introversive and extroversive.  Contrasted to introversive and extroversive.
Awe: To strike with fear and reverence; to inspire with awe; to control by inspiring dread.
Alliance: To connect by alliance; to ally.
Annotto: A red or yellowish-red dyeing material, prepared from the pulp surrounding the seeds of a tree (Bixa orellana) belonging to the tropical regions of America. It is used for coloring cheese, butter, etc.
Arterialize: To transform, as the venous blood, into arterial blood by exposure to oxygen in the lungs; to make arterial.
academicianship: the position or state of being a member of an honorary academy.
Anger: To make painful; to cause to smart; to inflame.
Adversely: In an adverse manner; inimically; unfortunately; contrariwise.
Acrylic: Of or containing acryl, the hypothetical radical of which acrolein is the hydride; as, acrylic acid.  The characteristic residue in an acrylic compound is the carbonyl group attached directly to an ethylenic carbon.
Acid process: That variety of either the Bessemer or the open-hearth process in which the converter or hearth is lined with acid, that is, highly siliceous, material. Opposed to basic process.
Abjudge: To take away by judicial decision.
azide: any chemical compound containing the azido group -N3, such as sodium azide (ionic and inorganic) or ethyl azide (organic and nonionic).
24/7: Without interruption; non-stop; continuous; as, the computer manufacturer provides 24/7 technical help.
azido: relating to or containing the azido group -N3.
Aviado: One who works a mine with means provided by another.
Atheist: One who disbelieves or denies the existence of a God, or supreme intelligent Being.
achromatinic: not readily colored by stains; -- of substance of a cell nucleus
Amerce: To punish by a pecuniary penalty, the amount of which is not fixed by law, but left to the discretion of the court; as, the court amerced the criminal in the sum of one hundred dollars.
Autograph: In one's own handwriting; as, an autograph letter; an autograph will.
Anacamptics: The science of reflected light, now called catoptrics.
Atheism: The disbelief or denial of the existence of a God, or supreme intelligent Being.
American Protective Association: A secret organization in the United States, formed in Iowa in 1887, ostensibly for the protection of American institutions by keeping Roman Catholics out of public office. Abbrev. commonly to A. P .A.
Acuteness: The quality of being acute or pointed; sharpness; as, the acuteness of an angle.
Aversely: Backward; in a backward direction; as, emitted aversely.
Alphabetize: To arrange alphabetically; as, to alphabetize a list of words.
Absurdity: The quality of being absurd or inconsistent with obvious truth, reason, or sound judgment.
Arisarum: a genus of tuberous or rhizomatous perennial herbs; mainly Mediterranean area.
Astrometry: The art of making measurements among the stars, or of determining their relative magnitudes.
Avulsion: A tearing asunder; a forcible separation.
Acroterial: Pertaining to an acroterium; as, acroterial ornaments.
Allege: To alleviate; to lighten, as a burden or a trouble.
Accipitral: Pertaining to, or of the nature of, a falcon or hawk; hawklike.
Arthrospore: A bacterial resting cell, -- formerly considered a spore, but now known to occur even in endosporous bacteria.
Amphiuma: A genus of amphibians, inhabiting the Southern United States, having a serpentlike form, but with four minute limbs and two persistent gill openings; the Congo snake.
Apterygiformes: a ratite bird order: flightless ground birds having vestigial wings and long bills and small eyes: kiwis.
Avengement: The inflicting of retributive punishment; satisfaction taken.
Assembly: A company of persons collected together in one place, and usually for some common purpose, esp. for deliberation and legislation, for worship, or for social entertainment.
Ayuntamiento: In Spain and Spanish America, a corporation or body of magistrates in cities and towns, corresponding to mayor and aldermen.
arty: showily imitative of art or artists.
Amanita: A genus of poisonous fungi of the family Agaricaceæ, characterized by having a volva, an annulus, and white spores. The species resemble edible mushrooms, and are frequently mistaken for them. Amanita muscaria, syn. Agaricus muscarius, is the fly amanita, or fly agaric; and Agaricus phalloides is the death cup (or death cap).
Accompaniment: That which accompanies; something that attends as a circumstance, or which is added to give greater completeness to the principal thing, or by way of ornament, or for the sake of symmetry.
Absque hoc: The technical words of denial used in traversing what has been alleged, and is repeated.
Action: A process or condition of acting or moving, as opposed to rest; the doing of something; exertion of power or force, as when one body acts on another; the effect of power exerted on one body by another; agency; activity; operation; as, the action of heat; a man of action.
Allegretto: Quicker than andante, but not so quick as allegro.
Astronomical: Of or pertaining to astronomy; in accordance with the methods or principles of astronomy.
Ariocarpus: a genus of slow-growing geophytic cacti; northern and eastern Mexico; southern Texas.
Amphipodous: Of or pertaining to the Amphipoda.
Adreamed: Visited by a dream; -- used in the phrase, To be adreamed, to dream.
Aceraceae: the family of trees including the maples.
Avenue: A way or opening for entrance into a place; a passage by which a place may by reached; a way of approach or of exit.
Alternation: The reciprocal succession of things in time or place; the act of following and being followed by turns; alternate succession, performance, or occurrence; as, the alternation of day and night, cold and heat, summer and winter, hope and fear.
Asthma: A disease, characterized by difficulty of breathing (due to a spasmodic contraction of the bronchi), recurring at intervals, accompanied with a wheezing sound, a sense of constriction in the chest, a cough, and expectoration.
Alkali waste: Waste material from the manufacture of alkali; specif., soda waste.
Ascomycota: a phylum of higher fungi, coextensive with the class Ascomycetes.  It comprises Hemiascomycetes; Plectomycetes; Pyrenomycetes; Discomycetessac fungi; in some classification systems it is considered a division of the kingdom Fungi.
amphibolite: a metamorphic rock composed chiefly of amphibole and plagioclase.
Actinoid: Having the form of rays; radiated, as an actinia.
Abstersion: Act of wiping clean; a cleansing; a purging.
Appetition: Desire; a longing for, or seeking after, something.
Anglophobe: a person who hates England and everything English.
adsorption: the process by which molecules of a substance form a thin film on the surface of a solid.  Distinguished from absorption, in which the foreign substance penetrates the body of the absorbing material.
authentication: a mark on an article of trade to indicate its origin and authenticity.
Antichrist: A denier or opponent of Christ. Specif.: A great antagonist, person or power, expected to precede Christ's second coming.
arrow-wood: any  plant (Viburnum recognitum) closely related to southern arrow wood; eastern U.S. Maine to Ohio and Georgia.
Autogenetic drainage: A system of natural drainage developed by the constituent streams through headwater erosion.
Antanaclasis: A figure which consists in repeating the same word in a different sense; as, Learn some craft when young, that when old you may live without craft.
Ademption: The revocation or taking away of a grant, donation, legacy, or the like.
Apparel: To make or get (something) ready; to prepare.
Acidulate: To make sour or acid in a moderate degree; to sour somewhat.
All hail: All health; -- a phrase of salutation or welcome.
admonishing: expressing adverse criticism as a corrective
Acacia: A genus of leguminous trees and shrubs. Nearly 300 species are Australian or Polynesian, and have terete or vertically compressed leaf stalks, instead of the bipinnate leaves of the much fewer species of America, Africa, etc.  Very few are found in temperate climates.
Absinthium: The common wormwood (Artemisia absinthium), an intensely bitter plant, used as a tonic and for making the oil of wormwood.
Anglo-Indian: a person of English citizenship born or living in India.
Anonymously: In an anonymous manner; without a name.
Attired: Provided with antlers, as a stag.
applemint: a mint (Mentha rotundifolia or Mentha suaveolens) with apple-scented stems of South and West Europe; naturalized in U.S.
Amphisb\u00e6noid: Like or pertaining to the lizards of the genus Amphisbæna.
Aussie: a native or inhabitant of Australia.
Amontillado: A dry kind of cherry, of a light color.
Auto-infection: Poisoning caused by a virus that originates and develops in the organism itself.
adulterated: having been made impure by addition of inferior ingredients; -- said of substances or foods
Anoa: A small wild ox of Celebes (Anoa depressicornis), allied to the buffalo, but having long nearly straight horns.
Abruption: A sudden breaking off; a violent separation of bodies.
4: one more than three; denoting a quantity consisting of four items or units; -- representing the number four as an Arabic numeral
Although: Grant all this; be it that; supposing that; notwithstanding; though.
Anostraca: an order of small aquatic crustaceans lacking a carapace: fairy shrimps; brine shrimps.
Anadiplosis: A repetition of the last word or any prominent word in a sentence or clause, at the beginning of the next, with an adjunct idea; as, “He retained his virtues amidst all his misfortunes -- misfortunes which no prudence could foresee or prevent.”
Abstractedness: The state of being abstracted; abstract character.
Anglo-Norman: One of the English Normans, or the Normans who conquered England.
Anginous: Pertaining to angina or angina pectoris.
Alka-seltzer: a commerical antacid; -- the tablets dissolve in water to give an effervescent solution.
Acaridan: One of a group of arachnids, including the mites and ticks.
Alytes: a genus of amphibians comprising the midwife toads.
arsonist: a criminal who illegaly sets fire to property.
Acridotheres: a genus of birds comprising the mynas.
Anthropotomy: The anatomy or dissection of the human body; androtomy.
Amphigamous: Having a structure entirely cellular, and no distinct sexual organs; -- a term applied by De Candolle to the lowest order of plants.
Artfully: In an artful manner; with art or cunning; skillfully; dexterously; craftily.
Acrodactylum: The upper surface of the toes, individually.
Anthropomorphize: To attribute a human form or personality to.
AC: an electric current that reverses direction sinusoidally.  Alternative to direct curent, DC.
Anti-Gallican: Opposed to what is Gallic or French.
Amazing: Causing amazement; very wonderful; as, amazing grace.
Assimilable: That may be assimilated; that may be likened, or appropriated and incorporated.
Annotine: A bird one year old, or that has once molted.
Assurance: The act of assuring; a declaration tending to inspire full confidence; that which is designed to give confidence.
Asymptote: A line which approaches nearer to some curve than assignable distance, but, though infinitely extended, would never meet it. Asymptotes may be straight lines or curves. A rectilinear asymptote may be conceived as a tangent to the curve at an infinite distance.
Assimilation: The act or process of assimilating or bringing to a resemblance, likeness, or identity; also, the state of being so assimilated; as, the assimilation of one sound to another.
Amissibility: The quality of being amissible; possibility of being lost.
Allotropize: To change in physical properties but not in substance.
Artfulness: The quality of being artful; art; cunning; craft.
asynchrony: the relation that exists when things occur at unrelated times.
the unit of length equal to the mean distance of the Earth from the sun, about 93 million miles (150 million kiometers); -- used almost exclusively in astronomy, or to describe astronomical distances.
Armillary: Pertaining to, or resembling, a bracelet or ring; consisting of rings or circles.
Acarine: Of or caused by acari or mites; as, acarine diseases.
Acarina: The group of Arachnida which includes the mites and ticks. Many species are parasitic, and cause diseases like the itch and mange.
Attaminate: To corrupt; to defile; to contaminate.
Alkalamide: One of a series of compounds that may be regarded as ammonia in which a part of the hydrogen has been replaced by basic, and another part by acid, atoms or radicals.
Adjective: To make an adjective of; to form or change into an adjective.
Accompanist: The performer in music who takes the accompanying part.
airline: an organization, usually commercial or governmental, providing transportation by airplane for freight or passengers.  The term includes the organization, its personnel, equipment and other properties, such as approved air routes.
Assizer: An officer who has the care or inspection of weights and measures, etc.
Ammonia: A gaseous compound of hydrogen and nitrogen, NH3, with a pungent smell and taste: -- often called volatile alkali, and spirits of hartshorn.
Algometer: An instrument for measuring sensations of pain due to pressure. It has a piston rod with a blunted tip which is pressed against the skin.
Ameer: an independent ruler or chieftan (especially in Africa or Arabia).  Same as Emir.
Aplacophora: A division of Amphineura in which the body is naked or covered with slender spines or setæ, but is without shelly plates.
Appeasable: Capable of being appeased or pacified; placable.
Alexandrian: Of or pertaining to Alexandria in Egypt; as, the Alexandrian library.
Attorney-general: The chief law officer of the state, empowered to act in all litigation in which the law-executing power is a party, and to advise this supreme executive whenever required.
Aporia: A figure in which the speaker professes to be at a loss what course to pursue, where to begin to end, what to say, etc.
Apicular: Situated at, or near, the apex; apical.
Appropriation: The act of setting apart or assigning to a particular use or person, or of taking to one's self, in exclusion of all others; application to a special use or purpose, as of a piece of ground for a park, or of money to carry out some object.
Abjudicate: To reject by judicial sentence; also, to abjudge.
Arca: the type genus of the family Arcidae, including ark shells and blood clams.
Amphidisc: A peculiar small siliceous spicule having a denticulated wheel at each end; -- found in freshwater sponges.
Acraspeda: A group of acalephs, including most of the larger jellyfishes; the Discophora.
Agnoiology: The doctrine concerning those things of which we are necessarily ignorant.
Answerableness: The quality of being answerable, liable, responsible, or correspondent.
11-plus: an examination taken by 11 and 12 year old students to select suitable candidates for grammar school.
Aside: Something spoken aside; as, a remark made by a stageplayer which the other players are not supposed to hear.
\u00c6gis: A shield or protective armor; -- applied in mythology to the shield of Jupiter which he gave to Minerva. Also fig.: A shield; a protection.
Appendaged: Furnished with, or supplemented by, an appendage.
Acokanthera: small genus of trees and shrubs containing strongly toxic cardiac glycosides; distributed from Arabia to Africa.
Aristulate: Having a short beard or awn.
arranged: disposed or placed in a particular kind of order.
Ascitic: Of, pertaining to, or affected by, ascites; dropsical.
Adverbially: In the manner of an adverb.
Alicant: A kind of wine, formerly much esteemed; -- said to have been made near Alicant, in Spain.
Attitude: The posture, action, or disposition of a figure or a statue.
Argosy: A large ship, esp. a merchant vessel of the largest size.
Animative: Having the power of giving life or spirit.
Acceptance: The act of accepting; a receiving what is offered, with approbation, satisfaction, or acquiescence; esp., favorable reception; approval; as, the acceptance of a gift, office, doctrine, etc.
Assertorial: Asserting that a thing is; -- opposed to problematical and apodeictical.
Acetic: Of a pertaining to vinegar; producing vinegar; producing vinegar; as, acetic fermentation.
Antimacassar: A cover for the back or arms of a chair or sofa, etc., to prevent them from wear or from being soiled by macassar or other oil from the hair.
anaphylaxis: hypersensitivity (to a protein or drug) resulting from prior contact with a substance.
Angoumois moth: A small moth (Gelechia cerealella) which is very destructive to wheat and other grain. The larva eats out the interior of the grain, leaving only the shell.
-ant: A suffix sometimes marking the agent for action; as, merchant, covenant, servant, pleasant, etc. Cf. -ent.
Algebra: That branch of mathematics which treats of the relations and properties of quantity by means of letters and other symbols. It is applicable to those relations that are true of every kind of magnitude.
As: A Roman weight, answering to the libra or pound, equal to nearly eleven ounces Troy weight. It was divided into twelve ounces.
-ana: A suffix to names of persons or places, used to denote a collection of notable sayings, literary gossip, anecdotes, etc. Thus, Scaligerana is a book containing the sayings of Scaliger, Johnsoniana of Johnson, etc.
astronaut: a person trained to travel in a spacecraft; one who travels in a spacecraft; -- called in the Soviet Union and Russia cosmonaut.
azadirachtin: a triterpenoid (C35H44O16) isolated from the seeds of the neem tree (Azadirachta indica), used as an insecticide.
Architrave: The lower division of an entablature, or that part which rests immediately on the column, esp. in classical architecture. See Column.
Archivolt: The architectural member surrounding the curved opening of an arch, corresponding to the architrave in the case of a square opening.
Anacharis: A fresh-water weed of the frog's-bit family (Hydrocharidaceæ), native to America. Transferred to England it became an obstruction to navigation. Called also waterweed and water thyme.
Addiction: The state of being addicted; devotion; inclination.
Actinometric: Pertaining to the measurement of the intensity of the solar rays, either (a) heating, or (b) actinic.
Allograph: A writing or signature made by some person other than any of the parties thereto; -- opposed to autograph.
Arenilitic: Of or pertaining to sandstone; as, arenilitic mountains.
Achromatize: To deprive of color; to make achromatic.
Agronomy: The management of land; rural economy; agriculture.
Antisolar: Opposite to the sun; -- said of the point in the heavens 180° distant from the sun.
alerting: a state of readiness to respond.
acetphenetidin: a white crystalline compound used as an analgesic and also as an antipyretic.
About-sledge: The largest hammer used by smiths.
All-possessed: Controlled by an evil spirit or by evil passions; wild.
Avifauna: The birds, or all the kinds of birds, inhabiting a region.
Abomasum: The fourth or digestive stomach of a ruminant, which leads from the third stomach omasum. See Ruminantia.
Affront: An encounter either friendly or hostile.
Aggravation: The act of aggravating, or making worse; -- used of evils, natural or moral; the act of increasing in severity or heinousness; something additional to a crime or wrong and enhancing its guilt or injurious consequences.
Adhere: To stick fast or cleave, as a glutinous substance does; to become joined or united; as, wax   to the finger; the lungs sometimes adhere to the pleura.
Airedale: a breed of large wiry-coated terriers, bred in Yorkshire.
Angling: The act of one who angles; the art of fishing with rod and line.
Axminster: A variety of Turkey carpet, woven by machine or, when more than 27 inches wide, on a hand loom, and consisting of strips of worsted chenille so colored as to produce a pattern on a stout jute backing. It has a fine soft pile. So called from Axminster, England, where it was formerly (1755 -- 1835) made.
Araba: A wagon or cart, usually heavy and without springs, and often covered.
20th: coming next after the nineteenth in a series
Actuator: One who actuates, or puts into action.
acanthoid: shaped like a spine or thorn
Ana\u00ebrobies: Microörganisms which do not require oxygen, but are killed by it.  See obligate anaerobes under anaerobes.
Assuredness: The state of being assured; certainty; full confidence.
Aramaic: Pertaining to Aram, or to the territory, inhabitants, language, or literature of Syria and Mesopotamia; Aramæan; -- specifically applied to the northern branch of the Semitic family of languages, including Syriac and Chaldee.
abs: The abductor muscles of the stomach; -- a contraction used by body-building and health enthusiasts.   Used similarly to pecs and delts.
A\u00ebrolitic: Of or pertaining to aërolites; meteoric; as, aërolitic iron.
Anglify: To convert into English; to anglicize.
Arena: The area in the central part of an amphitheater, in which the gladiators fought and other shows were exhibited; -- so called because it was covered with sand.
awayness: the state of being elsewhere than in particular place.
Arched: Made with an arch or curve; covered with an arch; as, an arched door.
Ahead: In or to the front; in advance; onward.
Adustion: The act of burning, or heating to dryness; the state of being thus heated or dried.
Archbutler: A chief butler; -- an officer of the German empire.
Appendant: Anything attached to another as incidental or subordinate to it.
Aegyptopithecus: an extinct primate of about 38 million years ago; -- fossils were found in Egypt.
Augustinianism: The doctrines held by Augustine or by the Augustinians.
Atresia: Absence or closure of a natural passage or channel of the body; imperforation.
Accountantship: The office or employment of an accountant.
anthropocentricity: an inclination to evaluate reality exclusively in terms of human values.
autacoid: any physiologically active internal secretion, especially one of uncertain classification.
Akeridae: a family comprising the bubble shells.
Aphthous: Pertaining to, or caused by, aphthæ; characterized by aphtæ; as, aphthous ulcers; aphthous fever.
Antagonistic: Opposing in combat, combating; contending or acting against; as, antagonistic forces.
Ardent: Hot or burning; causing a sensation of burning; fiery; as, ardent spirits, that is, distilled liquors; an ardent fever.
Awhile: For a while; for some time; for a short time.
Anarchic: Pertaining to anarchy; without rule or government; in political confusion; tending to produce anarchy; as, anarchic despotism; anarchical opinions.
Auto-intoxication: Poisoning, or the state of being poisoned, from toxic substances produced within the body; autotoxæmia.
Allottee: One to whom anything is allotted; one to whom an allotment is made.
Anicut: A dam or mole made in the course of a stream for the purpose of regulating the flow of a system of irrigation.
Amadavat: The strawberry finch, a small Indian song bird (Estrelda amandava), commonly caged and kept for fighting. The female is olive brown; the male, in summer, mostly crimson; -- called also red waxbill.
Alabaster: A compact variety or sulphate of lime, or gypsum, of fine texture, and usually white and translucent, but sometimes yellow, red, or gray.  It is carved into vases, mantel ornaments, etc.
Alumina: One of the earths, consisting of two parts of aluminium and three of oxygen, Al2O3.
amenities: things that make you comfortable and at ease.
Am\u0153bea: That division of the Rhizopoda which includes the amoeba and similar forms.
Adagio: A piece of music in adagio time; a slow movement; as, an adagio of Haydn.
aftershafted: having an aftershaft (a small feather at the base of some feathers)
American: A native of America; -- originally applied to the aboriginal inhabitants, but now applied to the descendants of Europeans born in America, and especially to the citizens of the United States.
Amoeba: A rhizopod common in fresh water, capable of undergoing many changes of form at will. Same as ameba. See Rhizopoda.
Alsike: A species of clover with pinkish or white flowers; Trifolium hybridum.
Argulus: A genus of copepod Crustacea, parasitic of fishes; a fish louse. See Branchiura.
Amazedly: In amazement; with confusion or astonishment.
Alitrunk: The segment of the body of an insect to which the wings are attached; the thorax.
Atony: Want of tone; weakness of the system, or of any organ, especially of such as are contractile.
Aghast: Terrified; struck with amazement; showing signs of terror or horror.
Atone: To set at one; to reduce to concord; to reconcile, as parties at variance; to appease.
Alimentiveness: The instinct or faculty of appetite for food.
augend: a number to which another number (the addend) is added.
Angienchyma: Vascular tissue of plants, consisting of spiral vessels, dotted, barred, and pitted ducts, and laticiferous vessels.
Avowry: An advocate; a patron; a patron saint.
Argas: A genus of venomous ticks which attack men and animals.  The famous Persian Argas, also called Miana bug, is Argas Persicus; that of Central America, called talaje by the natives, is Argas Talaje.
Amphopeptone: A product of gastric digestion, a mixture of hemipeptone and antipeptone.
Ad libitum: At one's pleasure; as one wishes.
Argal: A species of wild sheep (Ovis ammon, or Ovis argali), remarkable for its large horns.  It inhabits the mountains of Siberia and central Asia.
anomalops: a fish having a luminous organ beneath eye; it inhabits warm waters of the West Pacific and Puerto Rico.  It is called also flashlight fish.
Amateurship: The quality or character of an amateur.
Air line: A path through the air made easy for aërial navigation by steady winds.
Amate: To be a mate to; to match.
Appulse: A driving or running towards; approach; impulse; also, the act of striking against.
Artemis: the virgin goddess of the hunt and the moon in Greek mythology; one of the Olympian deities, daughter of Zeus and Leto and twin sister of Apollo; identified with the Roman Diana.
Admire: To wonder; to marvel; to be affected with surprise; -- sometimes with at.
Animadverter: One who animadverts; a censurer; also [Obs.], a chastiser.
Anchorman: a woman television reporter who coordinates a broadcast to which several correspondents contribute.  Male correlate of anchorwoman.
Artemia: A genus of phyllopod Crustacea found in salt lakes and brines; the brine shrimp. See Brine shrimp.
Aglet: A tag of a lace or of the points, braids, or cords formerly used in dress. They were sometimes formed into small images. Hence, “aglet baby” (Shak.), an aglet image.
Airiness: The state or quality of being airy; openness or exposure to the air; as, the airiness of a country seat.
Amenability: The quality of being amenable; amenableness.
Anaglyptograph: An instrument by which a correct engraving of any embossed object, such as a medal or cameo, can be executed.
Arteritis: Inflammation of an artery or arteries.
Annodated: Curved somewhat in the form of the letter S.
Acceptability: The quality of being acceptable; acceptableness.
Abolishment: The act of abolishing; abolition; destruction.
Abderian: Given to laughter; inclined to foolish or incessant merriment.
Appellant: One who accuses another of felony or treason.
24: one more than twenty-three; denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-four items or units; -- representing the number twenty-four as Arabic numerals
25: one more than twenty-four; denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-five items or units; -- representing the number twenty-five as Arabic numerals
26: denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-six items or units; -- representing the number twenty-six as Arabic numerals
27: denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-seven items or units; -- representing the number twenty-seven as Arabic numerals
20: one more than nineteen; denoting a quantity consisting of twenty items or units; -- representing the number twenty as Arabic numerals
21: one more than twenty; twenty plus one more; denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-one items or units; -- representing the number twenty-one as Arabic numerals
22: one more than twenty-one; denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-two items or units; -- representing the number twenty-two as Arabic numerals
23: one more than twenty-two; denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-three items or units; -- representing the number twenty-three as Arabic numerals
28: denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-eight items or units; -- representing the number twenty-eight as Arabic numerals
29: denoting a quantity consisting of twenty-nine items or units; -- representing the number twenty-nine as Arabic numerals
Anserine: Pertaining to, or resembling, a goose, or the skin of a goose.
Ayrshire: One of a superior breed of cattle from Ayrshire, Scotland. Ayrshires are notable for the quantity and quality of their milk.
Amide: A compound formed by the union of amidogen with an acid element or radical. It may also be regarded as ammonia in which one or more hydrogen atoms have been replaced by an acid atom or radical.
Accouplement: The act of coupling, or the state of being coupled; union.
Amendment: An alteration or change for the better; correction of a fault or of faults; reformation of life by quitting vices.
Answerable: Obliged to answer; liable to be called to account; liable to pay, indemnify, or make good; accountable; amenable; responsible; as, an agent is answerable to his principal; to be answerable for a debt, or for damages.
Abalienation: The act of abalienating; alienation; estrangement.
Altruistic: Regardful of others; beneficent; unselfish; -- opposed to egoistic or selfish.
2d: coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude
Abed: In bed, or on the bed.
Artifice: A handicraft; a trade; art of making.
Absinthism: The condition of being poisoned by the excessive use of absinth.
Apiaceae: a family of plants bearing flowers in umbels; examples are: parsley; carrot; anise; caraway; celery; dill.
Assuefaction: The act of accustoming, or the state of being accustomed; habituation.
Andante: Moving moderately slow, but distinct and flowing; quicker than larghetto, and slower than allegretto.
Atellan: Of or pertaining to Atella, in ancient Italy; as, Atellan plays; farcical; ribald.
Adieu: A farewell; commendation to the care of God at parting.
Arion: In Greek legend, a fabulous horse, the offspring of Poseidon by Demeter (or, in other accounts, Gaea or a harpy) who to escape him had metamorphosed herself into a mare. It was successively owned by Copreus, Oncus, Heracles, and Adrastus. It possessed marvelous powers of speech, and its right feet were those of a man.
Abduce: To draw or conduct away; to withdraw; to draw to a different part.
Anemoscope: An instrument which shows the direction of the wind; a wind vane; a weathercock; -- usually applied to a contrivance consisting of a vane above, connected in the building with a dial or index with pointers to show the changes of the wind.
Abound: To be in great plenty; to be very prevalent; to be plentiful.
A priori: Characterizing that kind of reasoning which deduces consequences from definitions formed, or principles assumed, or which infers effects from causes previously known; deductive or deductively. The reverse of a posteriori.
airframe: the framework and covering of an airplane or rocket (excluding the engines).
Agdistis: Asiatic epithet for Rhea or Cybele.
Affreight: To hire, as a ship, for the transportation of goods or freight.
Ambrosially: After the manner of ambrosia; delightfully.
Architecture: The art or science of building; especially, the art of building houses, churches, bridges, and other structures, for the purposes of civil life; -- often called civil architecture.
Absently: In an absent or abstracted manner.
Antimetabole: A figure in which the same words or ideas are repeated in transposed order.
Anklet: An ornament or a fetter for the ankle; an ankle ring.
Aguilt: To be guilty of; to offend; to sin against; to wrong.
Accurateness: The state or quality of being accurate; accuracy; exactness; nicety; precision.
Ankled: Having ankles; -- used in composition; as, well-ankled.
Agrom: A disease occurring in Bengal and other parts of the East Indies, in which the tongue chaps and cleaves.
Alb Sunday: The first Sunday after Easter Sunday, properly Albless Sunday, because in the early church those who had been baptized on Easter eve laid aside on the following Saturday their white albs which had been put on after baptism.
Abdominal: A fish of the group Abdominales.
Armor-bearer: One who carries the armor or arms of another; an armiger.
Animist: One who maintains the doctrine of animism.
Anatropal: Having the ovule inverted at an early period in its development, so that the chalaza is as the apparent apex; -- opposed to orthotropous.
Arytenoid: Ladle-shaped; -- applied to two small cartilages of the larynx, and also to the glands, muscles, etc., connected with them. The cartilages are attached to the cricoid cartilage and connected with the vocal cords.
Activeness: The quality of being active; nimbleness; quickness of motion; activity.
Anethum: a genus of plants of the parsley family having aromatic seeds and finely divided leaves, including the dill Anethum graveolens.
Animism: The doctrine, taught by Stahl, that the soul is the proper principle of life and development in the body.
Acrodont: One of a group of lizards having the teeth immovably united to the top of the alveolar ridge.
Ascensional: Relating to ascension; connected with ascent; ascensive; tending upward; as, the ascensional power of a balloon.
5th: coming next after the fourth in a series
Affixture: The act of affixing, or the state of being affixed; attachment.
all right: satisfactory; better than average; as, everything is all right.
Alcoranist: One who adheres to the letter of the Koran, rejecting all traditions.
Appropriately: In an appropriate or proper manner; fitly; properly.
Altarpiece: The painting or piece of sculpture above and behind the altar; reredos.
Anglophobia: Intense dread of, or aversion to, England or the English.
Ambush: To lie in wait, for the purpose of attacking by surprise; to lurk.
Auriga: The Charioteer, or Wagoner, a constellation in the northern hemisphere, situated between Perseus and Gemini. It contains the bright star Capella.
Armpit: The hollow beneath the junction of the arm and shoulder; the axilla.
Ambreate: A salt formed by the combination of ambreic acid with a base or positive radical.
Acetylene: A gaseous compound of carbon and hydrogen, in the proportion of two atoms of the former to two of the latter. It is a colorless gas, with a peculiar, unpleasant odor, and is produced for use as an illuminating gas in a number of ways, but chiefly by the action of water on calcium carbide. Its light is very brilliant.
Advocatory: Of or pertaining to an advocate.
Actinidia: a small Asiatic woody vine bearing many-seeded fruit.
Amphictyons: Deputies from the confederated states of ancient Greece to a congress or council. They considered both political and religious matters.
Anthological: Pertaining to anthology; consisting of beautiful extracts from different authors, especially the poets.
Amphictyony: A league of states of ancient Greece; esp. the celebrated confederation known as the Amphictyonic Council. Its object was to maintain the common interests of Greece.
Arthrology: That part of anatomy which treats of joints.
Archtreasurer: A chief treasurer. Specifically, the great treasurer of the German empire.
Amusing: Giving amusement; diverting; as, an amusing story.
Administrative: Pertaining to administration; administering; executive; as, an administrative body, ability, or energy.
Arrival: The act of arriving, or coming; the act of reaching a place from a distance, whether by water (as in its original sense) or by land.
Attask: To take to task; to blame.
airwaves: the medium of transmission of signals by radio or television stations; by radio transmission; -- used non-technically; as, over the airwaves, i. e. by radio or television.
aniseikonia: a visual defect in which the shape and size of an ocular image differ in the two eyes.
Arab: One of a swarthy race occupying Arabia, and numerous in Syria, Northern Africa, etc.
Ascophyllum: a genus of brown algae distinguished by compressed or inflated branchlets along the axis.
Antedon: A genus formerly called genus Comatula.
Alpha: The first letter in the Greek alphabet, answering to A, and hence used to denote the beginning.
Aventine: A post of security or defense.
Ate: The goddess of mischievous folly; also, in later poets, the goddess of vengeance.
Applicancy: The quality or state of being applicable.
Anybody: Any one out of an indefinite number of persons; anyone; any person.
Advancing edge: The front edge (in direction of motion) of a supporting surface; -- contr. with following edge, which is the rear edge.
Admit: To suffer to enter; to grant entrance, whether into a place, or into the mind, or consideration; to receive; to take; as, they were into his house; to admit a serious thought into the mind; to admit evidence in the trial of a cause.
Anecdotic: Pertaining to, consisting of, or addicted to, anecdotes.
Anacardic: Pertaining to, or derived from, the cashew nut; as, anacardic acid.
Anatomically: In an anatomical manner; by means of dissection.
Amboyna wood: A beautiful mottled and curled wood, used in cabinetwork. It is obtained from the Pterocarpus Indicus of Amboyna, Borneo, etc.
Abbreviatory: Serving or tending to abbreviate; shortening; abridging.
Accentually: In an accentual manner; in accordance with accent.
Asterion: The point on the side of the skull where the lambdoid, parieto-mastoid and occipito-mastoid sutures.
Avignon berry: The fruit of the Rhamnus infectorius, eand of other species of the same genus; -- so called from the city of Avignon, in France. It is used by dyers and painters for coloring yellow. Called also French berry.
Anthracic: Of or relating to anthrax; as, anthracic blood.
Armageddon: the final, decisive battle between the forces of good and evil, as foretold in the Apocolypse of Saint John.  Also, the site of that battle.  Used metaphorically for a vast and decisive conflict, attended by cataclysmic destruction.
Amen-Ra: the ancient Egyptian sun god; supreme god of the universe in whom Amen and Ra were combined; principal deity during Theban supremacy.
Adamantine: Made of adamant, or having the qualities of adamant; incapable of being broken, dissolved, or penetrated; as, adamantine bonds or chains.
Advantageous: Being of advantage; conferring advantage; gainful; profitable; useful; beneficial; as, an advantageous position; trade is advantageous to a nation.
Amphictyonic: Of or pertaining to the Amphictyons or their League or Council; as, an Amphictyonic town or state; the Amphictyonic body.
Ambassadorial: Of or pertaining to an ambassador.
19th: coming next after the eighteenth in a series
applesauce: puree of stewed apples usually sweetened and spiced.
8: one more than seven; denoting a quantity consisting of eight items or units; -- representing the number eight as an Arabic numeral
Adventurous: Inclined to adventure; willing to incur hazard; prone to embark in hazardous enterprise; rashly daring; -- applied to persons.
Apozemical: Pertaining to, or resembling, a decoction.
Anthropomancy: Divination by the entrails of human being.
Amenorrh\u0153a: Retention or suppression of the menstrual discharge.
Archenemy: A principal enemy. Specifically, Satan, the grand adversary of mankind.
Adnominal: Pertaining to an adnoun; adjectival; attached to a noun.
actinomycetes: branched gram-positive bacteria, often found in soil, some of which are pathogenic for humans and animals.
Amphiarthrosis: A form of articulation in which the bones are connected by intervening substance admitting slight motion; symphysis.
Aptly: In an apt or suitable manner; fitly; properly; pertinently; appropriately; readily.
Amphioxus: A fishlike creature (Amphioxus lanceolatus), two or three inches long, found in temperature seas; -- also called the lancelet. Its body is pointed at both ends. It is the lowest and most generalized of the vertebrates, having neither brain, skull, vertebræ, nor red blood. It forms the type of the group Acrania, Leptocardia, etc.
Azonic: Confined to no zone or region; not local.
Ancile: The sacred shield of the Romans, said to have-fallen from heaven in the reign of Numa. It was the palladium of Rome.
Atticism: A favoring of, or attachment to, the Athenians.
Angraecum: a genus of tropical Old World epiphytic orchids with showy flowers sometimes grotesque.
Arnicine: An alkaloid obtained from the arnica plant.
11th: coming next after the tenth in a series
Attendancy: The quality of attending or accompanying; attendance; an attendant.
Applaud: To express approbation loudly or significantly.
angrecum: any of various spectacular orchids of the genus Angraecum having 2-ranked dark green leathery leaves and usually nocturnally scented white or ivory flowers.
Antemosaic: Being before the time of Moses.
afro-wig: a wig that gives the appearance of an afro hairdo.
Anew: Over again; another time; in a new form; afresh; as, to arm anew; to create anew.
Adulterous: Guilty of, or given to, adultery; pertaining to adultery; illicit.
Albinism: The state or condition of being an albino: abinoism; leucopathy.
Araucarian: Relating to, or of the nature of, the Araucaria. The earliest conifers in geological history were mostly Araucarian.
Articularly: In an articular or an articulate manner.
Aurate: A combination of auric acid with a base; as, aurate or potassium.
Abraham-man: One of a set of vagabonds who formerly roamed through England, feigning lunacy for the sake of obtaining alms.
Adjudicate: To come to a judicial decision; as, the court adjudicated upon the case.
Ambidexter: A person who uses both hands with equal facility.
Archiater: Chief physician; -- a term applied, on the continent of Europe, to the first or body physician of princes and to the first physician of some cities.
Arthroderm: The external covering of an Arthropod.
Arum: A genus of plants found in central Europe and about the Mediterranean, having flowers on a spadix inclosed in a spathe. The cuckoopint of the English is an example.
Ample: Large; great in size, extent, capacity, or bulk; spacious; roomy; widely extended.
Aborigines: The earliest known inhabitants of a country; native races.
adsorptive: having capacity or tendency to adsorb or cause to accumulate on a surface; displaying adsorption.
Alkali metal: Any one of the univalent metals of group I of the periodic table of the elements, including lithium, sodium, potassium, rubidium, cesium, and francium.  The hydroxides of these metals are soluble in water and form strongly basic solutions.
annihilating: criticising vehemently and effectively; making light of; as, afire with annihilating invective.
Archiepiscopacy: That form of episcopacy in which the chief power is in the hands of archbishops.
Aram\u00e6an: Of or pertaining to the Syrians and Chaldeans, or to their language; Aramaic.
Artificer: An artistic worker; a mechanic or manufacturer; one whose occupation requires skill or knowledge of a particular kind, as a silversmith.
Abluent: Washing away; carrying off impurities; detergent.
Azotic: Pertaining to azote, or nitrogen; formed or consisting of azote; nitric; as, azotic gas; azotic acid.
Alcoholize: To reduce to a fine powder.
Apatura: a genus of large Old World butterflies.
Agrarian: One in favor of an equal division of landed property.
Angolese: a member of the Bantu tribes resident in Angola.
Aculea: A small spiny outgrowth on the wings of certain insects.
Alkoran: The Mohammedan Scriptures. Same as Alcoran and Koran.
abducting: drawing away from the midline of the body or from an adjacent part; -- used especially of muscles
Aguardiente: A inferior brandy of Spain and Portugal.
Aune: A French cloth measure, of different parts of the country (at Paris, 0.95 of an English ell); -- now superseded by the meter.
Amphora: Among the ancients, a two-handled vessel, tapering at the bottom, used for holding wine, oil, etc.
Antechamber: A chamber or apartment before the chief apartment and leading into it, in which persons wait for audience; an outer chamber. See Lobby.
ampule: a small glass bottle which has been or can be sealed hermetically by application of flame to a narrow opening at the top.
Abalone: A univalve mollusk of the genus Haliotis. The shell is lined with mother-of-pearl, and used for ornamental purposes; the sea-ear. Several large species are found on the coast of California, clinging closely to the rocks.
Appressed: Pressed close to, or lying against, something for its whole length, as against a stem.
Angelicalness: The quality of being angelic; excellence more than human.
Adambulacral: Next to the ambulacra; as, the adambulacral ossicles of the starfish.
Arsenious: Pertaining to, consisting of, or containing, arsenic; as, arsenious powder or glass.
Arabin: A carbohydrate, isomeric with cane sugar, contained in gum arabic, from which it is extracted as a white, amorphous substance.
Ambrite: A fossil resin occurring in large masses in New Zealand.
Adjust: To make exact; to fit; to make correspondent or conformable; to bring into proper relations; as, to adjust a garment to the body, or things to a standard.
Activity: The state or quality of being active; nimbleness; agility; vigorous action or operation; energy; active force; as, an increasing variety of human activities.
Artamus: the type genus of the Artamidae.
Atole: A porridge or gruel of maize meal and water, milk, or the like.
Atoll: A coral island or islands, consisting of a belt of coral reef, partly submerged, surrounding a central lagoon or depression; a lagoon island.
Aularian: At Oxford, England, a member of a hall, distinguished from a collegian.
Agonothete: An officer who presided over the great public games in Greece.
Acanthaceous: Armed with prickles, as a plant.
Acknowledgment: The act of acknowledging; admission; avowal; owning; confession.
akvavit: Scandinavian liquor usually flavored with caroway seeds.
Acquaintanceship: A state of being acquainted; acquaintance.
Aromatization: The act of impregnating or secting with aroma.
autolysis: lysis of cells or tissues due to enzymatic activity from within the cell, as contrasted with externally induced lysis.
acetylcholinesterase: an enzyme which exists in nerve cells and hydrolyses acetylcholine into choline and acetic acid.
Alate: Winged; having wings, or side appendages like wings.
Aarons rod: A rod with one serpent twined around it, thus differing from the caduceus of Mercury, which has two.
Alborak: The imaginary milk-white animal on which Mohammed was said to have been carried up to heaven; a white mule.
Apothegm: A short, pithy, and instructive saying; a terse remark, conveying some important truth; a sententious precept or maxim.
Auxetophone: A pneumatic reproducer for a phonograph, controlled by the recording stylus on the principle of the relay. It produces much clearer and louder tones than does the ordinary vibrating disk reproducer.
Altercation: Warm contention in words; dispute carried on with heat or anger; controversy; wrangle; wordy contest.
Astrakhan: Of or pertaining to Astrakhan in Russia or its products; made of an Astrakhan skin.
\u00c6rugo: The rust of any metal, esp. of brass or copper; verdigris.
Ascensive: Rising; tending to rise, or causing to rise.
Anhydrite: A mineral of a white or a slightly bluish color, usually massive. It is anhydrous sulphate of lime, and differs from gypsum in not containing water (whence the name).
Auspicious: Having omens or tokens of a favorable issue; giving promise of success, prosperity, or happiness; predicting good; as, an auspicious beginning.
Androtomous: Having the filaments of the stamens divided into two parts.
Appetitive: Having the quality of desiring gratification; as, appetitive power or faculty.
Arreptitious: Snatched away; seized or possessed, as a demoniac; raving; mad; crack-brained.
Abolition: The act of abolishing, or the state of being abolished; an annulling; abrogation; utter destruction; as, the abolition of slavery or the slave trade; the abolition of laws, decrees, ordinances, customs, taxes, debts, etc.
accoutrement: an item of clothing that is worn or carried, but not part of one's main clothing.
Apiary: A place where bees are kept; a stand or shed for bees; a beehouse.
anaplasia: loss of structural differentiation within a cell or group of cells often with increased capacity for multiplication, as in a malignant tumor.
Alfa: A plant (Macrochloa tenacissima) of North Africa; also, its fiber, used in paper making.
Antibromic: An agent that destroys offensive smells; a deodorizer.
Anastatic: Pertaining to a process or a style of printing from characters in relief on zinc plates.
Antiattrition: Anything to prevent the effects of friction, esp. a compound lubricant for machinery, etc., often consisting of plumbago, with some greasy material; antifriction grease.
Allionia: a small genus of chiefly American herbs.
Air drill: A drill driven by the elastic pressure of condensed air; a pneumatic drill.
Anvil: To form or shape on an anvil; to hammer out; as, anviled armor.
Alcyonacea: A group of soft-bodied Alcyonaria, of which Alcyonium is the type. See Illust. under Alcyonaria.
Annulation: A circular or ringlike formation; a ring or belt.
ammobium: any plant of the genus Ammobium having yellow flowers and silvery foliage.
Arguable: Capable of being argued; admitting of debate.
Amylolytic: Effecting the conversion of starch into soluble dextrin and sugar; as, an amylolytic ferment.
Ash-colored: Of the color of ashes; a whitish gray or brownish gray.
Accuracy: The state of being accurate; freedom from mistakes, this exemption arising from carefulness; exact conformity to truth, or to a rule or model; precision; exactness; nicety; correctness; as, the value of testimony depends on its accuracy.
Axilla: The armpit, or the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and shoulder.
Allegeable: Capable of being alleged or affirmed.
Aboriginal: An original inhabitant of any land; one of the aborigines.
Articulated: United by, or provided with, articulations; jointed; as, an articulated skeleton.
Ascaphus: the type genus of the Ascaphidae; in some classifications included in the family Leiopelmatidae.
Azoic: Destitute of any vestige of organic life, or at least of animal life; anterior to the existence of animal life; formed when there was no animal life on the globe; as, the azoic. rocks.
Arrange: To put in proper order; to dispose (persons, or parts) in the manner intended, or best suited for the purpose; as, troops arranged for battle.
Alutation: The tanning or dressing of leather.
Abortive: That which is born or brought forth prematurely; an abortion.
Autogamy: Self-fertilization, the fertilizing pollen being derived from the same blossom as the pistil acted upon.
Arseniureted: Combined with arsenic; -- said some elementary substances or radicals; as, arseniureted hydrogen.
Amylate: A compound of the radical amyl with oxygen and a positive atom or radical.
Alcyonic: Of or pertaining to the Alcyonaria.
Ammeter: A contraction of amperometer or ampèremeter.
Aliseptal: Relating to expansions of the nasal septum.
adoring: feeling or showing profound respect or veneration.  Opposite of irreverent.
Achievement: The act of achieving or performing; an obtaining by exertion; successful performance; accomplishment; as, the achievement of his object.
Apocryphally: In an apocryphal manner; mythically; not indisputably.
Advance: Before in place, or beforehand in time; -- used for advanced; as, an advance guard, or that before the main guard or body of an army; advance payment, or that made before it is due; advance proofs, advance sheets, pages of a forthcoming volume, received in advance of the time of publication.
Alcalde: A magistrate or judge in Spain and in Spanish America, etc.
Actinozoal: Of or pertaining to the Actinozoa.
Anti-trade: A westerly wind which blows nearly continuously between 30° and 50° of latitude in both the northern and the southern hemisphere.
Animose: Full of spirit; hot; vehement; resolute.
Accendibility: Capacity of being kindled, or of becoming inflamed; inflammability.
Apotelesmatic: Relating to the casting of horoscopes.
Alkaloid: An organic base, especially one of a class of nitrogen-containing substances occurring ready formed in the tissues of plants and the bodies of animals.
Asian: Of or pertaining to Asia; Asiatic.
Achatina: A genus of land snails, often large, common in the warm parts of America and Africa.
Antidromous: Changing the direction in the spiral sequence of leaves on a stem.
Assuming: Pretentious; taking much upon one's self; presumptuous.
An\u00e6sthesia: Entire or partial loss or absence of feeling or sensation; a state of general or local insensibility produced by disease or by the inhalation or application of an anæsthetic.
Agnomen: An additional or fourth name given by the Romans, on account of some remarkable exploit or event; as, Publius Caius Scipio Africanus.
Argo: The name of the ship which carried Jason and his fifty-four companions to Colchis, in quest of the Golden Fleece.
Administratrix: A woman who administers; esp., one who administers the estate of an intestate, or to whom letters of administration have been granted; a female administrator.
Anseriformes: A division of birds including the geese, ducks, and closely allied forms.
Annelidous: Of the nature of an annelid.
agitating: causing or tending to cause anger or resentment.
Astacus: A genus of crustaceans, containing the crawfish of fresh-water lobster of Europe, and allied species of western North America. See Crawfish.
Andreaeales: an order of mosses which comprises a single genus: Andreaea.
Alcoholic: A person given to the use of alcoholic liquors.
Antiphlogistic: Any medicine or diet which tends to check inflammation.
Anemone: A genus of plants of the Ranunculus or Crowfoot family; windflower. Some of the species are cultivated in gardens.
Ascites: A collection of serous fluid in the cavity of the abdomen; dropsy of the peritoneum.
Athalamous: Not furnished with shields or beds for the spores, as the thallus of certain lichens.
androgenic: of or pertaining to androgens; having physiological effects like that of an androgen.
Assessor: One appointed or elected to assist a judge or magistrate with his special knowledge of the subject to be decided; as legal assessors, nautical assessors.
Asyndeton: A figure which omits the connective; as, I came, I saw, I conquered. It stands opposed to polysyndeton.
Affluence: A flowing to or towards; a concourse; an influx.
Assault: To make an assault upon, as by a sudden rush of armed men; to attack with unlawful or insulting physical violence or menaces.
Armistice: A cessation of arms for a short time, by convention; a temporary suspension of hostilities by agreement; a truce.
aplite: light-colored and fine-grained granitic rock consisting chiefly of quartz and feldspars.
Ara\u00e7ari: A South American bird, of the genus Pleroglossius, allied to the toucans. There are several species.
Armorial: Belonging to armor, or to the heraldic arms or escutcheon of a family.
50th: coming next after the fourty-ninth in a series
A\u00ebrenchym: A secondary respiratory tissue or modified periderm, found in many aquatic plants and distinguished by the large intercellular spaces.
Autocratship: The office or dignity of an autocrat.
Acrobatism: Feats of the acrobat; daring gymnastic feats; high vaulting.
Almug: A tree or wood of the Bible (2 Chron. ii. 8; 1 K. x. 11).
A\u00ebrial railway: A stretched wire or rope elevated above the ground and forming a way along which a trolley may travel, for conveying a load suspended from the trolley.
Arteriola: A small artery with a muscular wall.
Antimonious: Pertaining to, or derived from, antimony; -- said of those compounds of antimony in which this element has an equivalence next lower than the highest; as, antimonious acid.
Amylopsin: The diastase of the pancreatic juice.
Answer: A reply to a charge; a defense.
Ailette: A small square shield, formerly worn on the shoulders of knights, -- being the prototype of the modern epaulet.
Aston: To stun; to astonish; to stupefy.
Allyl: An organic radical, C3H5, existing especially in oils of garlic and mustard.
Analyzer: One who, or that which, analyzes.
Autocoherer: A self-restoring coherer, as a microphonic detector.
armyworm: A lepidopterous insect, which in the larval state often travels in great multitudes from field to field, destroying grass, grain, and other crops. The common army worm of the northern United States is the noctuid moth (Pseudaletia unipuncta, formerly Leucania unipuncta. The name is often applied to other related species, as the cotton worm.
Allylene: A gaseous hydrocarbon, C3H4, homologous with acetylene; propine.
Artificially: In an artificial manner; by art, or skill and contrivance, not by nature.
arranging: the act of arranging a piece of music.
Annotative: Characterized by annotations; of the nature of annotation.
