Anisomerous: Having the number of floral organs unequal, as four petals and six stamens.
Animalcule: A small animal, as a fly, spider, etc.
Asylum: A sanctuary or place of refuge and protection, where criminals and debtors found shelter, and from which they could not be forcibly taken without sacrilege.
Afoam: In a foaming state; as, the sea is all afoam.
Archchancellor: A chief chancellor; -- an officer in the old German empire, who presided over the secretaries of the court.
Artificial: Made or contrived by art; produced or modified by human skill and labor, in opposition to natural; as, artificial heat or light, gems, salts, minerals, fountains, flowers.
Ambitus: The exterior edge or border of a thing, as the border of a leaf, or the outline of a bivalve shell.
Apogee: That point in the orbit of the moon which is at the greatest distance from the earth.
Autumn: The third season of the year, or the season between summer and winter, often called “the fall.” Astronomically, it begins in the northern temperate zone at the autumnal equinox, about September 23, and ends at the winter solstice, about December 23; but in popular language, autumn, in America, comprises September, October, and November.
Amorpha: A genus of leguminous shrubs, having long clusters of purple flowers; false or bastard indigo.
Apostrophic: Pertaining to an apostrophe, grammatical or rhetorical.
Alarmed: Aroused to vigilance; excited by fear of approaching danger; agitated; disturbed; as, an alarmed neighborhood; an alarmed modesty.
Agriologist: One versed or engaged in agriology.
Aisle: A lateral division of a building, separated from the middle part, called the nave, by a row of columns or piers, which support the roof or an upper wall containing windows, called the clearstory wall.
Answerless: Having no answer, or impossible to be answered.
Annuloida: A division of the Articulata, including the annelids and allied groups; sometimes made to include also the helminths and echinoderms.
Abietic: Of or pertaining to the fir tree or its products; as, abietic acid, called also sylvic acid.
Abietin: A resinous obtained from Strasburg turpentine or Canada balsam. It is without taste or smell, is insoluble in water, but soluble in alcohol (especially at the boiling point), in strong acetic acid, and in ether.
Archprelate: An archbishop or other chief prelate.
Amiability: The quality of being amiable; amiableness; sweetness of disposition.
airfoil: a surface such as the wing of an airplane designed to provide reactive force when in motion relative to the surrounding air.
ambivalence: mixed feelings or emotions; uncertainty or vacillation in making a choice.
Adultery: The unfaithfulness of a married person to the marriage bed; sexual intercourse by a married man with another than his wife, or voluntary sexual intercourse by a married woman with another than her husband.
anionic: a class of synthetic detergents in which the molecules do not ionize in aqueous solutions.
Ambidextral: Pertaining equally to the right-hand side and the left-hand side.
Archeozoic: the time from 1.5 billion to 5 billion years ago, when the earth's crust was formed; the time when only unicellular organisms and the earliest forms of life are present.  Same as Archaeozoic.
Adurol: Either of two compounds, a chlorine derivative and bromine derivative, of hydroquinone, used as developers.
Actinogram: A record made by the actinograph.
Antibillous: Counteractive of bilious complaints; tending to relieve biliousness.
Ascidiarium: The structure which unites together the ascidiozooids in a compound ascidian.
Aculeus: A prickle growing on the bark, as in some brambles and roses.
Acidic: Containing a high percentage of silica; -- opposed to basic.
accrete: Characterized by accretion; made up; as, accrete matter.
Asemia: Loss of power to express, or to understand, symbols or signs of thought.
Apposition: The act of adding; application; accretion.
Aberration: The act of wandering; deviation, especially from truth or moral rectitude, from the natural state, or from a type.
Antiperistaltic: Opposed to, or checking motion; acting upward; -- applied to an inverted action of the intestinal tube.
Asthenia: Want or loss of strength; debility; diminution of the vital forces.
Abstractly: In an abstract state or manner; separately; absolutely; by itself; as, matter abstractly considered.
Aruru: mother and earth goddess in Gilgamish epic; identified with Sumerian Ki and Ninkhursag (Mama; Nintu).
Achilles: a mythical Greek hero of the Iliad; a foremost Greek warrior at the seige of Troy.
Assize: To assess; to value; to rate.
Architect: A person skilled in the art of building; one who understands architecture, or makes it his occupation to form plans and designs of buildings, and to superintend the artificers employed.
Antibody: Any of various bodies or substances in the blood which act in antagonism to harmful foreign bodies, as toxins or the bacteria producing the toxins. Normal blood serum apparently contains various antibodies, and the introduction of toxins or of foreign cells also stimulates production of their specific antibodies by the immune system.
Adobe: An unburnt brick dried in the sun; also used as an adjective, as, an adobe house, in Texas or New Mexico.
Affectation: An attempt to assume or exhibit what is not natural or real; false display; artificial show.
Asexualization: The act or process of sterilizing an animal or human being, as by vasectomy.
Atharva-Veda: a collection of mantras and formulas.
Anura: One of the orders of amphibians characterized by the absence of a tail, as the frogs and toads.
Asphalte: Asphaltic mastic or cement. See Asphalt, 2.
Africanism: A word, phrase, idiom, or custom peculiar to Africa or Africans.
Anury: Nonsecretion or defective secretion of urine; ischury.
Aponeurosis: Any one of the thicker and denser of the deep fasciæ which cover, invest, and the terminations and attachments of, many muscles. They often differ from tendons only in being flat and thin. See Fascia.
Authorized: Possessed of or endowed with authority; as, an authorized agent.
Athetosis: A variety of chorea, marked by peculiar tremors of the fingers and toes.
Antherozoid: One of the mobile male reproductive bodies in the antheridia of cryptogams.
ascocarpous: of or pertaining to an ascocarp.
Antiperistasis: Opposition by which the quality opposed asquires strength; resistance or reaction roused by opposition or by the action of an opposite principle or quality.
announced: stated publicly; as, their announced intentions.
Apprentice: To bind to, or put under the care of, a master, for the purpose of instruction in a trade or business.
Avocet: A grallatorial bird, of the genus Recurvirostra; the scooper.  The bill is long and bend upward toward the tip.  The American species is Recurvirostra Americana.
Apostemation: The formation of an aposteme; the process of suppuration.
arteria: a blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to the body.
Amphibia: One of the classes of vertebrates.
Antiscians: The inhabitants of the earth, living on different sides of the equator, whose shadows at noon are cast in opposite directions.
Acetabulifera: The division of Cephalopoda in which the arms are furnished with cup-shaped suckers, as the cuttlefishes, squids, and octopus; the Dibranchiata. See Cephalopoda.
Albuminose: A diffusible substance formed from albumin by the action of natural or artificial gastric juice. See Peptone.
Amazonite: A variety of feldspar, having a verdigris-green color.
Attornment: The act of a feudatory, vassal, or tenant, by which he consents, upon the alienation of an estate, to receive a new lord or superior, and transfers to him his homage and service; the agreement of a tenant to acknowledge the purchaser of the estate as his landlord.
Annihilator: One who, or that which, annihilates; as, a fire annihilator.
Acer: type genus of the Aceraceae; trees or shrubs having winged fruit.
audio-lingual: pertaining to a method of teaching language that focuses on listening and speaking.
Auricular: Of or pertaining to the ear, or to the sense of hearing; as, auricular nerves.
Apportionateness: The quality of being apportioned or in proportion.
Administration: The act of administering; government of public affairs; the service rendered, or duties assumed, in conducting affairs; the conducting of any office or employment; direction; management.
Artiodactyla: One of the divisions of the ungulate animals. The functional toes of the hind foot are even in number, and the third digit of each foot (corresponding to the middle finger in man) is asymmetrical and paired with the fourth digit, as in the hog, the sheep, and the ox; -- opposed to Perissodactyla.
Antalkali: Anything that neutralizes, or that counteracts an alkaline tendency in the system.
Antemundane: Being or occurring before the creation of the world.
Acrotomous: Having a cleavage parallel with the base.
Atrophied: Affected with atrophy, as a tissue or organ; arrested in development at a very early stage; rudimentary.
Arthrozoic: Of or pertaining to the Articulata; articulate.
Ankle: The joint which connects the foot with the leg; the tarsus.
Anthropometry: Measurement of the height and other dimensions of human beings, especially at different ages, or in different races, occupations, etc.
Arquated: Shaped like a bow; arcuate; curved.
Argentalium: A (patented) alloy of aluminium and silver, with a density of about 2.9.
Anthracometer: An instrument for measuring the amount of carbonic acid in a mixture.
Aengus: the Irish god of love and beauty; patron deity of young men and women.
Adverbial: Of or pertaining to an adverb; of the nature of an adverb; as, an adverbial phrase or form.
Air sac: One of the spaces in different parts of the bodies of birds, which are filled with air and connected with the air passages of the lungs; an air cell.
Argentous: Of, pertaining to, or containing, silver; -- said of certain silver compounds in which silver has a higher proportion than in argentic compounds; as, argentous chloride.
Aglaomorpha: a genus of epiphytic ferns of tropical Asia.
Adiposeness: The state of being fat; fatness.
aquavit: a Scandinavian liquor usually flavored with caroway seeds; -- also called akvavit.
Auction bridge: A variety of the game of bridge in which the players, beginning with the dealer, bid for the privilege of naming the trump and playing with the dummy for that deal, there being heavy penalties for a player's failure to make good his bid. The score value of each trick more than six taken by the successful bidder is as follows: when the trump is spades, 2; clubs, 6; diamonds, 7; hearts, 8; royal spades (lilies), 9; and when the deal is played with no trump, 10.
Antepaschal: Pertaining to the time before the Passover, or before Easter.
Association: The act of associating, or state of being associated; union; connection, whether of persons of things.
Avolate: To fly away; to escape; to exhale.
Acute-angled: Having acute angles; as, an acute-angled triangle, a triangle with every one of its angles less than a right angle.
Apophysis: A marked prominence or process on any part of a bone.
Avaricious: Actuated by avarice; greedy of gain; immoderately desirous of accumulating property.
Advisable-ness: The quality of being advisable or expedient; expediency; advisability.
Addictedness: The quality or state of being addicted; attachment.
Acceptableness: The quality of being acceptable, or suitable to be favorably received; acceptability.
Ambidexterity: The quality of being ambidextrous; the faculty of using both hands with equal facility.
Amphichroic: Exhibiting or producing two colors, as substances which in the color test may change red litmus to blue and blue litmus to red.
Abib: The first month of the Jewish ecclesiastical year, corresponding nearly to our April. After the Babylonish captivity this month was called Nisan.
Ankerite: A mineral closely related to dolomite, but containing iron.
Amphidromical: Pertaining to an Attic festival at the naming of a child; -- so called because the friends of the parents carried the child around the hearth and then named it.
Antimonate: A compound of antimonic acid with a base or basic radical.
All Souls Day: The second day of November; a feast day of the Roman Catholic church, on which supplications are made for the souls of the faithful dead.
Arriere: “That which is behind”; the rear; -- chiefly used as an adjective in the sense of behind, rear, subordinate.
Alcoholism: A diseased condition of the system, brought about by the continued use of alcoholic liquors.
\u00c6rose: Of the nature of, or like, copper; brassy.
Agiotage: Exchange business; also, stockjobbing; the maneuvers of speculators to raise or lower the price of stocks or public funds.
Abjectness: The state of being abject; abasement; meanness; servility.
Achiote: Seeds of the annotto tree; also, the coloring matter, annotto.
Argentan: An alloy of nickel with copper and zinc; German silver.
Acyclic: Not cyclic; not disposed in cycles or whorls
Admonitory: That conveys admonition; warning or reproving; as, an admonitory glance.
Arthrodynia: An affection characterized by pain in or about a joint, not dependent upon structural disease.
Arthrodynic: Pertaining to arthrodynia, or pain in the joints; rheumatic.
Aldermanship: The condition, position, or office of an alderman.
adam-and-eve: North American orchid (Aplectrum hyemale) bearing a single leaf and yellowish-brown flowers.
Acidimetry: The measurement of the strength of acids, especially by a chemical process based on the law of chemical combinations, or the fact that, to produce a complete reaction, a certain definite weight of reagent is required.
1-dodecanol: An insoluble solid alcohol (C12H25OH) with an unbranched paraffin chain, used to make detergents, such as sodium lauryl sulfate.
\u00c6sthesodic: Conveying sensory or afferent impulses; -- said of nerves.
Arvicola: a genus of mice in some classifications considered synonymous with Microtus.
Allegorist: One who allegorizes; a writer of allegory.
Arvicole: A mouse of the genus Arvicola; the meadow mouse. There are many species.
Audition: The act of hearing or listening; hearing.
affixal: of or pertaining to an affix.
Assure: To make sure or certain; to render confident by a promise, declaration, or other evidence.
Amethystine: Resembling amethyst, especially in color; bluish violet.
Alienation: The act of alienating, or the state of being alienated.
Assignat: One of the notes, bills, or bonds, issued as currency by the revolutionary government of France (1790-1796), and based on the security of the lands of the church and of nobles which had been appropriated by the state.
Assess: To value; to make a valuation or official estimate of for the purpose of taxation.
Area: Any plane surface, as of the floor of a room or church, or of the ground within an inclosure; an open space in a building.
Apyrous: Incombustible; capable of sustaining a strong heat without alteration of form or properties.
Album Gr\u00e6cum: Dung of dogs or hyenas, which becomes white by exposure to air. It is used in dressing leather, and was formerly used in medicine.
Aret: To reckon; to ascribe; to impute.
Aspish: Pertaining to, or like, an asp.
Academicism: A tenet of the Academic philosophy.
anticyclonic: of or pertaining to an anticyclone; moving in the opposite direction of a cyclone.
Aurora: The rising light of the morning; the dawn of day; the redness of the sky just before the sun rises.
Adelantadillo: A Spanish red wine made of the first ripe grapes.
Apheliotropism: The habit of bending from the sunlight; -- said of certain plants.
Anemogram: A record made by an anemograph.
Actinolite: A bright green variety of amphibole occurring usually in fibrous or columnar masses.
1000th: coming next after the nine hundred ninety-ninth in a series
anodize: to coat a metal with an oxide coat by electrolytic action at an anode; -- used especially to coat aluminum.
Aphonia: Loss of voice or vocal utterance.
Avowee: The person who has a right to present to a benefice; the patron; an advowee. See Advowson.
Aparejo: A kind of pack saddle used in the American military service and among the Spanish Americans. It is made of leather stuffed with hay, moss, or the like.
Aphthong: A letter, or a combination of letters, employed in spelling a word, but in the pronunciation having no sound.
Amusette: A light field cannon, or stocked gun mounted on a swivel.
Apocynaceous: Belonging to, or resembling, a family of plants, of which the dogbane (Apocynum) is the type.
Amylene: One of a group of metameric hydrocarbons, C5H10, of the ethylene series. The colorless, volatile, mobile liquid commonly called amylene is a mixture of different members of the group.
Automaton: Any thing or being regarded as having the power of spontaneous motion or action.
Antiparallels: Straight lines or planes which make angles in some respect opposite in character to those made by parallel lines or planes.
amain: To lower the topsail, in token of surrender; to yield.
Ameiuridae: a family comprising the North American catfishes.
A\u00ebrology: That department of physics which treats of the atmosphere.
Adscriptive: Attached or annexed to the glebe or estate and transferable with it.
Anaclastics: That part of optics which treats of the refraction of light; -- commonly called dioptrics.
Anthracomancy: Divination by inspecting a burning coal.
Arriere-ban: A proclamation, as of the French kings, calling not only their immediate feudatories, but the vassals of these feudatories, to take the field for war; also, the body of vassals called or liable to be called to arms, as in ancient France.
Anglican: A member of the Church of England.
Amblyopia: Weakness of sight, without and opacity of the cornea, or of the interior of the eye; the first degree of amaurosis.
Arthrostraca: One of the larger divisions of Crustacea, so called because the thorax and abdomen are both segmented; Tetradecapoda. It includes the Amphipoda and Isopoda.
Armchair: A chair with arms to support the elbows or forearms.
as: Denoting equality or likeness in kind, degree, or manner; like; similar to; in the same manner with or in which; in accordance with; in proportion to; to the extent or degree in which or to which; equally; no less than; as, ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil; you will reap as you sow; do as you are bidden.
Angioscope: An instrument for examining the capillary vessels of animals and plants.
anisogamy: reproduction by the union or fusion of two differing gametes (especially differing in size).
atomiser: a dispenser that turns a liquid (such as perfume) into a fine spray.
anodal: of or at or relating to an anode.  Contrastive to cathodic.
Apagoge: An indirect argument which proves a thing by showing the impossibility or absurdity of the contrary.
Assumpsit: A promise or undertaking, founded on a consideration. This promise may be oral or in writing not under seal. It may be express or implied.
Astrophysics: The science treating of the physical characteristics of the stars and other heavenly bodies, their chemical constitution, light, heat, atmospheres, etc.  It is a branch of astronomy.
Absinthiated: Impregnated with wormwood; as, absinthiated wine.
Ana-: A prefix in words from the Greek, denoting up, upward, throughout, backward, back, again, anew.
Admonish: To warn or notify of a fault; to reprove gently or kindly, but seriously; to exhort.
Agami: A South American bird (Psophia crepitans), allied to the cranes, and easily domesticated; -- called also the gold-breasted trumpeter. Its body is about the size of the pheasant. See Trumpeter.
Asexually: In an asexual manner; without sexual agency.
Appearance: The act of appearing or coming into sight; the act of becoming visible to the eye; as, his sudden appearance surprised me.
Astir: Stirring; in a state of activity or motion; out of bed.
Agama: A genus of lizards, one of the few which feed upon vegetable substances; also, one of these lizards.
Anthraconite: A coal-black marble, usually emitting a fetid smell when rubbed; -- called also stinkstone and swinestone.
Accommodable: That may be accommodated, fitted, or made to agree.
Amrita: Immortality; also, the nectar conferring immortality.
Anas: A genus of water fowls, of the order Anseres, including certain species of fresh-water ducks.
Alacrify: To rouse to action; to inspirit.
Acrogen: A plant of the highest class of cryptogams, including the ferns, etc. See Cryptogamia.
Ambulance: A field hospital, so organized as to follow an army in its movements, and intended to succor the wounded as soon as possible. Often used adjectively; as, an ambulance wagon; ambulance stretcher; ambulance corps.
Anan: An expression equivalent to What did you say? Sir? Eh?
American-Indian: of or pertaining to American Indians
Anal: Pertaining to, or situated near, the anus; as, the anal fin or glands.
around-the-clock: proceeding without interruption for twenty four hours every day.
Augural: Of or pertaining to augurs or to augury; betokening; ominous; significant; as, an augural staff; augural books.
Actinosome: The entire body of a cœlenterate.
Alarming: Exciting, or calculated to excite, alarm; causing apprehension of danger; as, an alarming crisis or report. -- A*larm"ing*ly, adv.
Abstruseness: The quality of being abstruse; difficulty of apprehension.
Awfulness: The quality of striking with awe, or with reverence; dreadfulness; solemnity; as, the awfulness of this sacred place.
African wild dog: a dog (Lycaon pictus) with mottled fur found in Africa, notable for the strong social structure of its family groups.
Aswail: The sloth bear (Melursus labiatus) of India.
Analyze: To subject to analysis; to resolve (anything complex) into its elements; to separate into the constituent parts, for the purpose of an examination of each separately; to examine in such a manner as to ascertain the elements or nature of the thing examined; to consider in detail in order to discover essential features or meaning; as, to analyze an action to ascertain its morality; to analyse a sonnet by Shakespeare; to analyse the evidence in a criminal trial; to analyse your real motives.
Advantage: To give an advantage to; to further; to promote; to benefit; to profit.
Annapurna: wife of Siva and a benevolent aspect of Devi: goddess of plenty.
Aldebaran: A red star of the first magnitude, situated in the eye of Taurus; the Bull's Eye.  It is the bright star in the group called the Hyades.
Apprenticeship: The service or condition of an apprentice; the state in which a person is gaining instruction in a trade or art, under legal agreement.
Angora: A city of Asia Minor (or Anatolia) which has given its name to a goat, a cat, etc.
Abstractive: Having the power of abstracting; of an abstracting nature.
Ablaut: The substitution of one root vowel for another, thus indicating a corresponding modification of use or meaning; vowel permutation; as, get, gat, got; sing, song; hang, hung.
Ammoniacal fermentation: Any fermentation process by which ammonia is formed, as that by which urea is converted into ammonium carbonate when urine is exposed to the air.
Apologetics: That branch of theology which defends the Holy Scriptures, and sets forth the evidence of their divine authority.
Affronter: One who affronts, or insults to the face.
Accredit: To put or bring into credit; to invest with credit or authority; to sanction.
Achene: A small, dry, indehiscent fruit, containing a single seed, as in the buttercup; -- called a naked seed by the earlier botanists.
Abridge: To make shorter; to shorten in duration; to lessen; to diminish; to curtail; as, to abridge labor; to abridge power or rights.
Adoptionist: One of a sect which maintained that Christ was the Son of God not by nature but by adoption.
Affable: Easy to be spoken to or addressed; receiving others kindly and conversing with them in a free and friendly manner; courteous; sociable.
awash: Washed by the waves or tide; -- said of a rock or strip of shore;
arbitrative: of or pertaining to arbitration; relating to or having the authority to arbitrate.
Awkward: Wanting dexterity in the use of the hands, or of instruments; not dexterous; without skill; clumsy; wanting ease, grace, or effectiveness in movement; ungraceful; as, he was awkward at a trick; an awkward boy.
Agreeableness: The quality of being agreeable or pleasing; that quality which gives satisfaction or moderate pleasure to the mind or senses.
Aromatize: To impregnate with aroma; to render aromatic; to give a spicy scent or taste to; to perfume.
adrenocorticotropin: a growth hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland; it stimulates the adrenal cortex.
Annulary: Having the form of a ring; annular.
Allhallowtide: The time at or near All Saints, or November 1st.
Anglo-Saxon: A Saxon of Britain, that is, an English Saxon, or one the Saxons who settled in England, as distinguished from a continental (or “Old”) Saxon.
assembly-line: Of, pertaining to, or resembling an assembly line; as, an assembly-line process; also used metaphorically, as an assembly-line educational system.
anestrus: a state or interval of sexual inactivity between two periods of estrus; -- applies to nonhuman mammals.
Archaistic: Like, or imitative of, anything archaic; pertaining to an archaism.
Abasement: The act of abasing, humbling, or bringing low; the state of being abased or humbled; humiliation.
Antetemple: The portico, or narthex in an ancient temple or church.
Applicable: Capable of being applied; fit or suitable to be applied; having relevance; as, this observation is applicable to the case under consideration.
Antipapal: Opposed to the pope or to popery.
Agrostis: A genus of grasses, including species called in common language bent grass. Some of them, as redtop (Agrostis vulgaris), are valuable pasture grasses.
Afterclap: An unexpected subsequent event; something disagreeable happening after an affair is supposed to be at an end.
Autochronograph: An instrument for the instantaneous self-recording or printing of time.
Antitropal: At the extremity most remote from the hilum, as the embryo, or inverted with respect to the seed, as the radicle.
Agricolist: A cultivator of the soil; an agriculturist.
Antidorcas: A genus of mammals comprising the springbucks (or springboks).  The main species is Antidorcas marsupialis the springbuck, of which there are three subspecies: the cape springbuck (marsupialis), the Kalahari springbuck (hofmeyri) and the Angolan springbuck (angolensis).
Assentation: Insincere, flattering, or obsequious assent; hypocritical or pretended concurrence.
Abditory: A place for hiding or preserving articles of value.
Amaze: Bewilderment, arising from fear, surprise, or wonder; amazement.
Amphid: A salt of the class formed by the combination of an acid and a base, or by the union of two oxides, two sulphides, selenides, or tellurides, as distinguished from a haloid compound.
Agnus Scythicus: The Scythian lamb, a kind of woolly-skinned rootstock. See Barometz.
Attainment: The act of attaining; the act of arriving at or reaching; hence, the act of obtaining by efforts.
airworthy: fit to fly; -- said of aircraft.  Opposite of unairworthy.
Arboriculture: The cultivation of trees and shrubs, chiefly for timber or for ornamental purposes.
Aluminography: Art or process of producing, and printing from, aluminium plates, after the manner of ordinary lithography.
Atom bomb: a bomb of great power in which the explosive energy is derived from the nuclear fission of a fissionable material, such as plutonium or uranium-235. It is a type of nuclear weapon.  The strength of an atom bomb is measured in kilotons, i.e. the equivalent energy released by explosion of a thousand tons of TNT.  The first atomic bomb was manufactured in 1945.
Apohyal: Of or pertaining to a portion of the horn of the hyoid bone.
Anelectrode: The positive pole of a voltaic battery.
Amphi-: A prefix in words of Greek origin, signifying both, of both kinds, on both sides, about, around.
Autocarpous: Consisting of the ripened pericarp with no other parts adnate to it, as a peach, a poppy capsule, or a grape.
Antiphonary: A book containing a collection of antiphons; the book in which the antiphons of the breviary, with their musical notes, are contained.
Albuminous: Pertaining to, or containing, albumen; having the properties of, or resembling, albumen or albumin.
Arcadian: Of or pertaining to Arcadia; pastoral; ideally rural; as, Arcadian simplicity or scenery.
Allayer: One who, or that which, allays.
Alarmist: One prone to sound or excite alarms, especially, needless alarms.
Amalgamation: The act or operation of compounding mercury with another metal; -- applied particularly to the process of separating gold and silver from their ores by mixing them with mercury.
Anglo-Catholicism: The belief of those in the Church of England who accept many doctrines and practices which they maintain were those of the primitive, or true, Catholic Church, of which they consider the Church of England to be the lineal descendant; a doctrine and practice within the Church of England emphasizing the Catholic tradition.
Antiphon: A musical response; alternate singing or chanting. See Antiphony, and Antiphone.
Attractive: That which attracts or draws; an attraction; an allurement.
Asperges: The service or ceremony of sprinkling with holy water.
autism: a mental disorder characterized by inability to engage in normal social interactions and intense self-absorption, and usually accompanied by other symptoms such as language dysfunctions and repetitive behavior.
Agendum: Something to be done; in the pl., a memorandum book; also, a list of items to be considered.  See agenda.
Ahriman: The Evil Principle or Being of the ancient Persians; the Prince of Darkness as opposer to Ormuzd, the King of Light.
40: one more than thirty-nine; four times ten; denoting a quantity consisting of fourty items or units; -- representing the number fourty as an Arabic numeral
Arawn: Lord of Annwfn (the other world; land of fairies).
Amity: Friendship, in a general sense, between individuals, societies, or nations; friendly relations; good understanding; as, a treaty of amity and commerce; the amity of the Whigs and Tories.
Ach: A name given to several species of plants; as, smallage, wild celery, parsley.
Almonry: The place where an almoner resides, or where alms are distributed.
April: The fourth month of the year.
Abor: a language spoken in Northeast India and adjacent regions of West Burma (Myanmar).
Act: To exert power; to produce an effect; as, the stomach acts upon food.
autacoidal: of or pertaining to an autacoid.
Anthropoidea: The suborder of primates which includes the monkeys, apes, and man.
Accessoriness: The state of being accessory, or connected subordinately.
Aldermanic: Relating to, becoming to, or like, an alderman; characteristic of an alderman.
Atropa: a genus of plants of the nightshade family, including the belladonna (Atropa belladonna).
8th: coming next after the seventh in a series
Autonomy: The power or right of self-government; self-government, or political independence, of a city or a state.
Agriculturalist: An agriculturist (which is the preferred form.)
Annals: A relation of events in chronological order, each event being recorded under the year in which it happened.
Allocatur: “Allowed.” The word allocatur expresses the allowance of a proceeding, writ, order, etc., by a court, judge, or judicial officer.
assembled: brought together into a group or crowd.
Arbitrable: Capable of being decided by arbitration; determinable.
Ataraxia: Perfect peace of mind, or calmness.
Alligatoridae: the family of reptiles comprising the alligators, and including the caimans.
Appay: To pay; to satisfy or appease.
Antasthmatic: Opposing, or fitted to relieve, asthma.
Agrypnotic: Anything which prevents sleep, or produces wakefulness, as strong tea or coffee.
Actualist: One who deals with or considers actually existing facts and conditions, rather than fancies or theories; a realist; -- opposed to idealist.
Avowable: Capable of being avowed, or openly acknowledged, with confidence.
Acicula: One of the needlelike or bristlelike spines or prickles of some animals and plants; also, a needlelike crystal.
Anoxia: a physiological state in which insufficient oxygen reaches the tissues of the body, especially when of sufficient severity to cause permanent damage.
Altimetry: The art of measuring altitudes, or heights.
Antique: In general, anything very old; but in a more limited sense, a relic or object of ancient art; collectively, the antique, the remains of ancient art, as busts, statues, paintings, and vases.
achievability: the possibility of being achieved or accomplished; -- a property which may be possessed by a contemplated act.
Annelida: A division of the Articulata, having the body formed of numerous rings or annular segments, and without jointed legs. The principal subdivisions are the Chætopoda, including the Oligochæta or earthworms and Polychæta or marine worms; and the Hirudinea or leeches. See Chætopoda.
Abstergent: A substance used in cleansing; a detergent; as, soap is an abstergent.
Agronomics: The science of the distribution and management of land.
Above-cited: Cited before, in the preceding part of a book or writing.
A\u00ebrocurve: A modification of the aëroplane, having curved surfaces, the advantages of which were first demonstrated by Lilienthal.
Agnosticism: That doctrine which, professing ignorance, neither asserts nor denies.
Autotropism: The tendency of plant organs to grow in a straight line when uninfluenced by external stimuli.
Archpriest: A chief priest; also, a kind of vicar, or a rural dean.
Agminal: Pertaining to an army marching, or to a train.
A\u00ebrophyte: A plant growing entirely in the air, and receiving its nourishment from it; an air plant or epiphyte.
Adjunction: The act of joining; the thing joined or added.
Alpenstock: A long staff, pointed with iron, used in climbing the Alps.
Apotheosize: To exalt to the dignity of a deity; to declare to be a god; to deify; to glorify.
Air cock: A faucet to allow escape of air.
Amicability: The quality of being amicable; friendliness; amicableness.
Agrestic: Pertaining to fields or the country, in opposition to the city; rural; rustic; unpolished; uncouth.
ain: belonging to or on behalf of a specified person especially one's self; preceded by a possessive.
Acescence: The quality of being acescent; the process of acetous fermentation; a moderate degree of sourness.
Augustan: Of or pertaining to Augustus Cæsar or to his times.
Aileron: A half gable, as at the end of a penthouse or of the aisle of a church.
Amatory: Pertaining to, producing, or expressing, sexual love; as, amatory potions.
Antithetic: Pertaining to antithesis, or opposition of words and sentiments; containing, or of the nature of, antithesis; contrasted.
Ascii: Persons who, at certain times of the year, have no shadow at noon; -- applied to the inhabitants of the torrid zone, who have, twice a year, a vertical sun.
Ark shell: A marine bivalve shell belonging to the genus Arca and its allies.
Airol: A grayish green antiseptic powder, consisting of a basic iodide and gallate of bismuth, sometimes used in place of iodoform.
Afloat: Borne on the water; floating; on board ship.
Actinolitic: Of the nature of, or containing, actinolite.
Aweather: On the weather side, or toward the wind; in the direction from which the wind blows; -- opposed to alee; as, helm aweather!
Antinomian: One who maintains that, under the gospel dispensation, the moral law is of no use or obligation, but that faith alone is necessary to salvation. The sect of Antinomians originated with John Agricola, in Germany, about the year 1535.
Aril: A exterior covering, forming a false coat or appendage to a seed, as the loose, transparent bag inclosing the seed of the white water lily. The mace of the nutmeg is also an aril.
Asphyxiation: The act of causing asphyxia; a state of asphyxia.
Affiliable: Capable of being affiliated to or on, or connected with in origin.
Anenst: Over against; as, he lives anent the church.
Anthropoid: Resembling man; -- applied especially to certain apes, as the ourang or gorilla.
25th: coming next after the twenty-fourth in a series
Azotite: A salt formed by the combination of azotous, or nitrous, acid with a base; a nitrite.
Antichthon: A hypothetical earth counter to ours, or on the opposite side of the sun.
Accruer: The act of accruing; accretion; as, title by accruer.
Approximator: One who, or that which, approximates.
Aurantiaceous: Pertaining to, or resembling, the Aurantiaceæ, an order of plants (formerly considered natural), of which the orange is the type.
Abjection: The act of bringing down or humbling.
Arrogative: Making undue claims and pretension; prone to arrogance.
Actuary: A registrar or clerk; -- used originally in courts of civil law jurisdiction, but in Europe used for a clerk or registrar generally.
Antitype: That of which the type is the pattern or representation; that which is represented by the type or symbol.
Air plant: A plant deriving its sustenance from the air alone; an aërophyte.
Adamic: Of or pertaining to Adam, or resembling him.
Adipoma: A mass of fat found internally; also, a fatty tumor.
Antitypy: Opposition or resistance of matter to force.
Antiquated: Grown old. Hence: Bygone; obsolete; out of use; old-fashioned; as, an antiquated law.
applewood: wood of any of various apple trees of the genus Malus.
Abdominalia: A group of cirripeds having abdominal appendages.
Astrometer: An instrument for comparing the relative amount of the light of stars.
Avena: A genus of grasses, including the common oat (Avena sativa); the oat grasses.
Austrotaxus: a genus having but one species; the New Caledonian yew.
acknowledged: Generally accepted or recognized as correct or reasonable.  Opposite of unacknowledged.
Anacrotism: A secondary notch in the pulse curve, obtained in a sphygmographic tracing.
Autohypnotism: Hypnotism of one's self by concentration of the attention on some object or idea.
Antipasch: The Sunday after Easter; Low Sunday.
Acatalectic: Not defective; complete; as, an acatalectic verse.
Alternate: To happen, succeed, or act by turns; to follow reciprocally in place or time; -- followed by with; as, the flood and ebb tides alternate with each other.
Alcoranic: Of or pertaining to the Koran.
Arrogance: The act or habit of arrogating, or making undue claims in an overbearing manner; that species of pride which consists in exorbitant claims of rank, dignity, estimation, or power, or which exalts the worth or importance of the person to an undue degree; proud contempt of others; lordliness; haughtiness; self-assumption; presumption.
Androphore: A support or column on which stamens are raised.
Artifact: A product of human workmanship; -- applied esp. to the simpler products of aboriginal art as distinguished from natural objects.
24th: coming next after the twenty-third in a series
Afforestation: The act of converting into forest or woodland.
Anthropology: The science of the structure and functions of the human body.
Armenian: A native or one of the people of Armenia; also, the language of the Armenians.
Adjacence: The state or attribute of being adjacent or contiguous; contiguity; the attribute of being so near as to be touching; as, the adjacency of lands or buildings.
Arborist: One who makes trees his study, or who is versed in the knowledge of trees.
Antozone: A compound formerly supposed to be modification of oxygen, but now known to be hydrogen dioxide; -- so called because apparently antagonistic to ozone, converting it into ordinary oxygen.
actinian: any sea anemone or related animal.
Aspergill: The brush used in the Roman Catholic church for sprinkling holy water on the people.
aminobenzine: an oily poisonous liquid amine obtained from nitrobenzene and used to make dyes and plastics and medicines.  Same as aniline.
Apparentness: Plainness to the eye or the mind; visibleness; obviousness.
Abrahamic: Pertaining to Abraham, the patriarch; as, the Abrachamic covenant.
Afflation: A blowing or breathing on; inspiration.
Abomination: The feeling of extreme disgust and hatred; abhorrence; detestation; loathing; as, he holds tobacco in abomination.
Accidentality: The quality of being accidental; accidentalness.
Arguer: One who argues; a reasoner; a disputant.
Adjustment: The act of adjusting, or condition of being adjusted; act of bringing into proper relations; regulation.
Areopagus: The highest judicial court at Athens. Its sessions were held on Mars' Hill. Hence, any high court or tribunal
Advil: a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medicine used to relieve the pain of arthritis and as an analgesic and antipyretic; Advil and Motrin and Nuprin are trademarks of brands of ibuprofen tablets.
Anyone: One taken at random rather than by selection; anybody. [Commonly written as two words.]
A\u00ebrially: Like, or from, the air; in an aërial manner.
Azerbaijani: a native or inhabitant of Azerbaijan.
Andromede: A meteor appearing to radiate from a point in the constellation Andromeda, -- whence the name.
Andromeda: A northern constellation, supposed to represent the mythical Andromeda.
Abstemiousness: The quality of being abstemious, temperate, or sparing in the use of food and strong drinks. It expresses a greater degree of abstinence than temperance.
Ague: To strike with an ague, or with a cold fit.
Amanitine: The poisonous principle of some fungi.
Absenteeism: The state or practice of an absentee; esp. the practice of absenting one's self from the country or district where one's estate is situated.
Angor: Great anxiety accompanied by painful constriction at the upper part of the belly, often with palpitation and oppression.
Absentment: The state of being absent; withdrawal.
Anteposition: The placing of a before another, which, by ordinary rules, ought to follow it.
aphaeretic: relating to or formed by or consisting of aphaeresis.
Adorner: He who, or that which, adorns; a beautifier.
Antarctic: Opposite to the northern or arctic pole; relating to the southern pole or to the region near it, and applied especially to a circle, distant from the pole 23° 28′. Thus we say the antarctic pole, circle, ocean, region, current, etc.
\u00c6grotat: A medical certificate that a student is ill.
Alignment: The act of adjusting to a line; arrangement in a line or lines; the state of being so adjusted; a formation in a straight line; also, the line of adjustment; esp., an imaginary line to regulate the formation of troops or of a squadron.
Aertex: a trademark for a loosely woven cotton fabric that is used to make shirts and underwear.
Adamite: A descendant of Adam; a human being.
Asking: The act of inquiring or requesting; a petition; solicitation.
Abeyant: Being in a state of abeyance.
Argol: Crude tartar; an acidulous salt from which cream of tartar is prepared. It exists in the juice of grapes, and is deposited from wines on the sides of the casks.
Addression: The act of addressing or directing one's course.
Academy: A garden or grove near Athens (so named from the hero Academus), where Plato and his followers held their philosophical conferences; hence, the school of philosophy of which Plato was head.
Annulate: Furnished with, or composed of, rings; ringed; surrounded by rings of color.
aerialist: an athlete who performs acts high above the ground on a trapeze or high wire, requiring skill and agility and coordination.
Annulata: A class of articulate animals, nearly equivalent to Annelida, including the marine annelids, earthworms, Gephyrea, Gymnotoma, leeches, etc. See Annelida.
Astragalar: Of or pertaining to the astragalus.
Antiarin: A poisonous principle obtained from antiar.
Adelphia: A “brotherhood,” or collection of stamens in a bundle; -- used in composition, as in the class names, Monadelphia, Diadelphia, etc.
Athink: To repent; to displease; to disgust.
Astony: To stun; to bewilder; to astonish; to dismay.
Awarder: One who awards, or assigns by sentence or judicial determination; a judge.
Anteroom: A room before, or forming an entrance to, another; a waiting room.
10th: coming next after the ninth in a series
Arachnidial: Of or pertaining to the Arachnida.
Alibi: The plea or mode of defense under which a person on trial for a crime proves or attempts to prove that he was in another place when the alleged act was committed; as, to set up an alibi; to prove an alibi.
Anthropotomist: One who is versed in anthropotomy, or human anatomy.
Allayment: An allaying; that which allays; mitigation.
\u00c6tiology: The science, doctrine, or demonstration of causes; esp., the investigation of the causes of any disease; the science of the origin and development of things.
Apiol: An oily liquid derived from parsley.
Autocratrix: A female sovereign who is independent and absolute; -- a title given to the empresses of Russia.
Anthocarpous: Having some portion of the floral envelopes attached to the pericarp to form the fruit, as in the checkerberry, the mulberry, and the pineapple.
Assiduous: Constant in application or attention; devoted; attentive; unremitting.
Appendix: Something appended or added; an appendage, adjunct, or concomitant.
Absent: To take or withdraw (one's self) to such a distance as to prevent intercourse; -- used with the reflexive pronoun.
Alarm: To call to arms for defense; to give notice to (any one) of approaching danger; to rouse to vigilance and action; to put on the alert.
Amphigen: An element that in combination produces amphid salt; -- applied by Berzelius to oxygen, sulphur, selenium, and tellurium.
Acanthopterygious: Having fins in which the rays are hard and spinelike; spiny-finned.
Alary: Of or pertaining to wings; also, wing-shaped.
Allophylic: Pertaining to a race or a language neither Aryan nor Semitic.
Automixte system: A system (devised by Henri Pieper, a Belgian) of driving automobiles employing a gasoline engine and an auxiliary reversible dynamo. When there is an excess of power the dynamo is driven by the engine so as to charge a small storage battery; when there is a deficiency of power the dynamo reverses and acts as an auxiliary motor. Sometimes called Pieper system.
Anorthosite: A granular igneous rock composed almost exclusively of a soda-lime feldspar, usually labradorite.
Abash: To destroy the self-possession of; to confuse or confound, as by exciting suddenly a consciousness of guilt, mistake, or inferiority; to put to shame; to disconcert; to discomfit.
Anaconda: A large South American snake of the Boa family (Eunectes murinus), which lives near rivers, and preys on birds and small mammals. The name is also applied to a similar large serpent (Python tigris) of Ceylon.
Aboma: A large South American serpent (Boa aboma).
Antimoniureted: Combined with or containing antimony; as, antimoniureted hydrogen.
Antennule: A small antenna; -- applied to the smaller pair of antennæ or feelers of Crustacea.
anesthetize: to cause to become unconscious by administration of an anaesthetic agent.
Ascending: Rising; moving upward; as, an ascending kite.
Assiduity: Constant or close application or attention, particularly to some business or enterprise; diligence.
Adelopod: An animal having feet that are not apparent.
Attender: One who, or that which, attends.
Apostleship: The office or dignity of an apostle.
Anxiety: Concern or solicitude respecting some thing or event, future or uncertain, which disturbs the mind, and keeps it in a state of painful uneasiness.
Antecommunion: A name given to that part of the Anglican liturgy for the communion, which precedes the consecration of the elements.
Aam: A Dutch and German measure of liquids, varying in different cities, being at Amsterdam about 41 wine gallons, at Antwerp 361/2, at Hamburg 381/4.
Antichlor: Any substance (but especially sodium hyposulphite) used in removing the excess of chlorine left in paper pulp or stuffs after bleaching.
applejack: Apple brandy; a brandy distilled from cider.
A\u00ebrometer: An instrument for ascertaining the weight or density of air and gases.
8vo: the size of a book whose pages are made by folding a sheet of paper three times to form eight leaves.
Albata: A white metallic alloy; which is made into spoons, forks, teapots, etc.   British plate or German silver. See German silver, under German.
Apositic: Destroying the appetite, or suspending hunger.
Andiron: A utensil for supporting wood when burning in a fireplace, one being placed on each side; a firedog; as, a pair of andirons.
Antistrophe: In Greek choruses and dances, the returning of the chorus, exactly answering to a previous strophe or movement from right to left. Hence: The lines of this part of the choral song.
Air hammer: a hammer powered by compressed air so as to be able to provide powerful repeated strokes; a pneumatic hammer.
Abide: To wait for; to be prepared for; to await; to watch for; as, I abide my time.
Anhistous: Without definite structure; as, an anhistous membrane.
Ability: The quality or state of being able; power to perform, whether physical, moral, intellectual, conventional, or legal; capacity; skill or competence in doing; sufficiency of strength, skill, resources, etc.; -- in the plural, faculty, talent.
Apiology: The scientific or systematic study of honey bees.
Annuloid: Of or pertaining to the Annuloida.
Airing: A walk or a ride in the open air; a short excursion for health's sake.
Archiepiscopal: Of or pertaining to an archbishop; as, Canterbury is an archiepiscopal see.
Aliunde: From another source; from elsewhere; as, a case proved aliunde; evidence aliunde.
Allomerism: Variability in chemical constitution without variation in crystalline form.
Annoyer: One who, or that which, annoys.
Almighty: Unlimited in might; omnipotent; all-powerful; irresistible.
Apopemptic: Sung or addressed to one departing; valedictory; as, apopemptic songs or hymns.
-ation: A suffix forming nouns of action, and often equivalent to the verbal substantive in -ing. It sometimes has the further meanings of state, and that which results from the action. Many of these nouns have verbs in -ate; as, alliterate -ation, narrate -ation; many are derived through the French; as, alteration, visitation; and many are formed on verbs ending in the Greek formative -ize (Fr. -ise); as, civilization, demoralization.
Archer: A bowman, one skilled in the use of the bow and arrow.
Assignment: An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use; or for a particular time, as of a cause or causes in court.
Asterisk: The figure of a star, thus, &unr_;, used in printing and writing as a reference to a passage or note in the margin, to supply the omission of letters or words, or to mark a word or phrase as having a special character.
Affranchisement: The act of making free; enfranchisement.
Addorsed: Set or turned back to back.
Arbor Dian\u00e6: A precipitation of silver, in a beautiful arborescent form.
A\u00ebronautic: Pertaining to aëronautics, or aërial sailing.
A\u00ebrostation: That part of aëronautics that deals with passive balloons; the art of raising and guiding balloons in the air.
Ambidextrous: Having the faculty of using both hands with equal ease.
\u00c6ruginous: Of the nature or color of verdigris, or the rust of copper.
Aristotelianism: The philosophy of Aristotle, otherwise called the Peripatetic philosophy.
AFL-CIO: the combined organizations of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations.
allergist: a physician skilled in the diagnosis and treatment of allergies.
analog computer: a computer that represents information by continuously variable quantities (e.g., positions or voltages).
Apodosis: The consequent clause or conclusion in a conditional sentence, expressing the result, and thus distinguished from the protasis or clause which expresses a condition. Thus, in the sentence, “Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him,” the former clause is the protasis, and the latter the apodosis.
Axstone: A variety of jade. It is used by some savages, particularly the natives of the South Sea Islands, for making axes or hatchets.
Assignee: A person to whom an assignment is made; a person appointed or deputed by another to do some act, perform some business, or enjoy some right, privilege, or property; as, an assignee of a bankrupt. See Assignment (c).   An assignee may be by special appointment or deed, or be created by jaw; as an executor.
Animate: Endowed with life; alive; living; animated; lively.
autolytic: of, pertaining to, or causing autolysis.
Astructive: Building up; constructive; -- opposed to destructive.
Aforehand: Prepared; previously provided; -- opposed to behindhand.
Aria: An air or song; a melody; a tune.
Arid: Exhausted of moisture; parched with heat; dry; barren.
agelong: lasting through all time; unending; as, The agelong struggle for freedom.
Auriscope: An instrument for examining the condition of the ear.
Abstraction: The act of abstracting, separating, or withdrawing, or the state of being withdrawn; withdrawal.
agitprop: agitation and propaganda; -- used especially for such activities carried out on behalf of communist activists.
Abetment: The act of abetting; as, an abetment of treason, crime, etc.
Anecdotal: Pertaining to, or abounding with, anecdotes; as, anecdotal conversation.
Avile: To abase or debase; to vilify; to depreciate.
Auriscopy: Examination of the ear by the aid of the auriscope.
Asiaticism: Something peculiar to Asia or the Asiatics.
Abbotship: The state or office of an abbot.
Azotize: To impregnate with azote, or nitrogen; to nitrogenize.
Antirenter: One opposed to the payment of rent; esp. one of those who in 1840-47 resisted the collection of rents claimed by the patroons from the settlers on certain manorial lands in the State of New York.
After-glow: A glow of refulgence in the western sky after sunset.
Anthropomorphite: One who ascribes a human form or human attributes to the Deity or to a polytheistic deity.
air bladder: An air sac, sometimes double or variously lobed, in the visceral cavity of many fishes. It originates in the same way as the lungs of air-breathing vertebrates, and in the adult may retain a tubular connection with the pharynx or esophagus.
Adsuki bean: A cultivated variety of the Asiatic gram, now introduced into the United States.
After: Subsequently in time or place; behind; afterward; as, he follows after.
addend: a number that is added to another number.
Anemonella: a genus consisting of one species: the rue anemone.
abortus: a fetus which has been aborted; same as abortion{2}.
Arabian: A native of Arabia; an Arab.
Addisons disease: A morbid condition causing a peculiar brownish discoloration of the skin, and thought, at one time, to be due to disease of the suprarenal capsules (two flat triangular bodies covering the upper part of the kidneys), but now known not to be dependent upon this causes exclusively. It is usually fatal.
Archduke: A prince of the imperial family of Austria.
Atimy: Public disgrace or stigma; infamy; loss of civil rights.
Accoast: To lie or sail along the coast or side of; to accost.
Alogian: One of an ancient sect who rejected St. John's Gospel and the Apocalypse, which speak of Christ as the Logos.
Auk: A name given to various species of arctic sea birds of the family Alcidæ. The great auk, now extinct, is Alca impennis (or Plautus impennis) . The razor-billed auk is Alca torda.  See Puffin, Guillemot, and Murre.
Apophyge: The small hollow curvature given to the top or bottom of the shaft of a column where it expands to meet the edge of the fillet; -- called also the scape.
Applicatory: Having the property of applying; applicative; practical.
Argumental: Of, pertaining to, or containing, argument; argumentative.
Anasarcous: Belonging, or affected by, anasarca, or dropsy; dropsical.
Adjectival: Of or relating to the relating to the adjective; of the nature of an adjective; adjective.
Aristotelean: of or pertaining to Aristotle; Aristotelian.
Amniotic: Of or pertaining to the amnion; characterized by an amnion; as, the amniotic fluid; the amniotic sac.
Assaulter: One who assaults, or violently attacks; an assailant.
Acroteleutic: The end of a verse or psalm, or something added thereto, to be sung by the people, by way of a response.
Almshouse: A house appropriated for the use of the poor; a poorhouse.
Above-mentioned: Mentioned or named before; aforesaid;  mentioned or named earlier in the same text (in written documents).
Affrontiveness: The quality that gives an affront or offense.
50: one more than fourty-nine; five times ten; denoting a quantity consisting of fifty items or units; -- representing the number fifty as an Arabic numeral
Assyriology: The science or study of the antiquities, language, etc., of ancient Assyria.
Affiliation: Adoption; association or reception as a member in or of the same family or society.
Aphrodisian: Pertaining to Aphrodite or Venus. “Aphrodisian dames” [that is, courtesans].
Afterpiece: A piece performed after a play, usually a farce or other small entertainment.
Ascham: A sort of cupboard, or case, to contain bows and other implements of archery.
Aphrodisiac: That which (as a drug, or some kinds of food) stimulate sexual desire.
avant-guard: The van or advanced body of an army. See Vanguard.
Again: Against; also, towards (in order to meet).
Arsis: That part of a foot where the ictus is put, or which is distinguished from the rest (known as the thesis) of the foot by a greater stress of voice.
Atropine: A poisonous, white, crystallizable alkaloid, extracted from the Atropa belladonna, or deadly nightshade, and the Datura Stramonium, or thorn apple. It is remarkable for its power in dilating the pupil of the eye. Called also daturine.
Apogeotropic: Bending away from the ground; -- said of leaves, etc.
Apyrexia: The absence or intermission of fever.
Ablaqueate: To lay bare, as the roots of a tree.
Anisette: A French cordial or liqueur flavored with anise seeds.
Aster: A genus of herbs with compound white or bluish flowers; starwort; Michaelmas daisy.
Accepter: A person who accepts; a taker.
Astel: An arch, or ceiling, of boards, placed over the men's heads in a mine.
Arch\u00e6ologist: One versed in archæology; an antiquary.
Anelectric: Not becoming electrified by friction; -- opposed to idioelectric.
Applicant: One who apples for something; one who makes request; a petitioner.
Autobiographer: One who writes his own life or biography.
Alkalescence: A tendency to become alkaline; or the state of a substance in which alkaline properties begin to be developed, or to predominant.
4-hitter: a game in which a pitcher allows the opposing team 4 hits.
Apetalous: Having no petals, or flower leaves. [See Illust. under Anther].
Adenose: Like a gland; full of glands; glandulous; adenous.
archeopteryx: an extinct primitive toothed bird (Archaeopteryx lithographica) of the Upper Jurassic having a long feathered tail and hollow bones; usually considered the most primitive of all known birds.  Same as archaeopteryx.
Argument: To make an argument; to argue.
Argonautic: Of or pertaining to the Argonauts.
Antimony: An elementary substance, resembling a metal in its appearance and physical properties, but in its chemical relations belonging to the class of nonmetallic substances. Atomic weight, 120. Symbol, Sb.
Anabolic: Pertaining to anabolism; an anabolic changes, or processes, more or less constructive in their nature.
Amnion: A thin membrane surrounding the embryos of mammals, birds, and reptiles.
Assertion: The act of asserting, or that which is asserted; positive declaration or averment; affirmation; statement asserted; position advanced.
adaptational: having a capacity for adaptation.  Opposed to maladaptive.
Antitragus: A prominence on the lower posterior portion of the concha of the external ear, opposite the tragus. See Ear.
Amen: To say Amen to; to sanction fully.
Autunite: A lemon-yellow phosphate of uranium and calcium occurring in tabular crystals with basal cleavage, and in micalike scales. H., 2-2.5. Sp. gr., 3.05-3.19.
Atomizer: One who, or that which, atomizes; esp., an instrument for reducing a liquid to spray for disinfecting, cooling, or perfuming.
Ancestry: Condition as to ancestors; ancestral lineage; hence, birth or honorable descent.
Archiblastula: A hollow blastula, supposed to be the primitive form; a cœloblastula.
astrophysics: the  concerned with the physical and chemical properties of celestial bodies.
Accessarily: In the manner of an accessary.
Amylolysis: The conversion of starch into soluble products, as dextrins and sugar, esp. by the action of enzymes.
26th: coming next after the twenty-fifth in a series
Abruptness: The state of being abrupt or broken; craggedness; ruggedness; steepness.
Articulata: One of the four subkingdoms in the classification of Cuvier. It has been much modified by later writers.
Articulate: To joint; to unite by means of a joint; to put together with joints or at the joints.
adore: To worship with profound reverence; to pay divine honors to; to honor as a deity or as divine.
Anaptotic: Having lost, or tending to lose, inflections by phonetic decay; as, anaptotic languages.
Alstonia: genus of evergreen trees or shrubs with white funnel-shaped flowers and milky sap; tropical Africa to southeast Asia and Polynesia.
acedia: apathy and inactivity in the practice of virtue (personified as one of the deadly sins).
Anachronism: A misplacing or error in the order of time; an error in chronology by which events are misplaced in regard to each other, esp. one by which an event is placed too early; falsification of chronological relation.
Alienist: One who treats diseases of the mind.
Alienism: The status or legal condition of an alien; alienage.
Alluvial: Pertaining to, contained in, or composed of, alluvium; relating to the deposits made by flowing water; washed away from one place and deposited in another; as, alluvial soil, mud, accumulations, deposits.
Autoradiogram: an image produced upon photographic film by exposure of the film to a radioactive substance in close proximity to (usually in contact with) the film.
Alkalization: The act of rendering alkaline by impregnating with an alkali; a conferring of alkaline qualities.
Aden-: Combining forms of the Greek word for gland; -- used in words relating to the structure, diseases, etc., of the glands.
Anagrammatism: The act or practice of making anagrams.
Anachronic: Characterized by, or involving, anachronism; anachronistic.
Apomecometry: The art of measuring the distance of objects afar off.
A\u00ebroboat: A form of hydro-aëroplane; a flying boat.
Air pipe: A pipe for the passage of air; esp. a ventilating pipe.
Allotriophagy: A depraved appetite; a desire for improper food.
Adjectivally: As, or in the manner of, an adjective; adjectively.
Amplification: The act of amplifying or enlarging in dimensions; enlargement; extension.
Actinozoa: A group of Cœlenterata, comprising the Anthozoa and Ctenophora. The sea anemone, or actinia, is a familiar example.
aurorean: of or pertaining to the dawn.
antimatter: Matter whch is composed of antiparticles such as antiprotons, positrons, and antineutrons.
Autobiographist: One who writes his own life; an autobiographer.
Autotypography: A process resembling “nature printing,” by which drawings executed on gelatin are impressed into a soft metal plate, from which the printing is done as from copperplate.
Acuminose: Terminating in a flat, narrow end.
Apparition: The act of becoming visible; appearance; visibility.
Acquire: To gain, usually by one's own exertions; to get as one's own; as, to acquire a title, riches, knowledge, skill, good or bad habits.
Arctisca: A group of Arachnida. See Illust. in Appendix.
Anac\u0153nosis: A figure by which a speaker appeals to his hearers or opponents for their opinion on the point in debate.
Arecoline: An oily liquid substance, C8H13O2N, the chief alkaloid of the betel nut, to which the latter owes its anthelmintic action.
Aglow: In a glow; glowing; as, cheeks aglow; the landscape all aglow.
Autotypy: The art or process of making autotypes.
Atropism: A condition of the system produced by long use of belladonna.
Anything: In any measure; anywise; at all.
Asbestic: Of, pertaining to, or resembling asbestus; inconsumable; asbestine.
artwork: photographs, illustrations, or other visual representations other than the text, in a printed publication.
Athletics: The art of training by athletic exercises; the games and sports of athletes.
Amperage: The strength of a current of electricity carried by a conductor or generated by a machine, measured in ampères.
Aspersion: A sprinkling, as with water or dust, in a literal sense.
Arctostaphylos: a genus of plants including the bearberry; manzanita.
all-purpose: not limited in use or function.
Aphyllous: Destitute of leaves, as the broom rape, certain euphorbiaceous plants, etc.
Allium: A genus of plants, including the onion, garlic, leek, chive, etc.
Attollent: Lifting up; raising; as, an attollent muscle.
Antenna: A movable, articulated organ of sensation, attached to the heads of insects and Crustacea. There are two in the former, and usually four in the latter. They are used as organs of touch, and in some species of Crustacea the cavity of the ear is situated near the basal joint. In insects, they are popularly called horns, and also feelers. The term in also applied to similar organs on the heads of other arthropods and of annelids.
Agitate: To move with a violent, irregular action; as, the wind agitates the sea; to agitate water in a vessel.
Ateles: A genus of American monkeys with prehensile tails, and having the thumb wanting or rudimentary. See Spider monkey, and Coaita.
algorithmic: of or pertaining to an algorithm.
Accomplicity: The act or state of being an accomplice.
Alopius: type genus of the family Alopiidae; in some classifications considered a genus of the family Lamnidae.
Alkalinity: The quality which constitutes an alkali; alkaline property.
Antipole: The opposite pole; anything diametrically opposed.
Arabinose: A sugar of the composition C5H10O5, obtained from cherry gum by boiling it with dilute sulphuric acid.
Ago: Past; gone by; since; as, ten years ago; gone long ago.
Areal: Of or pertaining to an area; as, areal interstices (the areas or spaces inclosed by the reticulate vessels of leaves).
Annuity: A sum of money, payable yearly, to continue for a given number of years, for life, or forever; an annual allowance.
Anaplasty: The art of operation of restoring lost parts or the normal shape by the use of healthy tissue.
autotelism: belief that a work of art is an end in itself or its own justification.
Annihilation: The act of reducing to nothing, or nonexistence; or the act of destroying the form or combination of parts under which a thing exists, so that the name can no longer be applied to it; as, the annihilation of a corporation.
Appeach: To impeach; to accuse; to asperse; to inform against; to reproach.
Atomize: To reduce to atoms, or to fine spray.
Angola pea: A tropical plant (Cajanus indicus) and its edible seed, a kind of pulse; -- so called from Angola in Western Africa. Called also pigeon pea and Congo pea.
Anona: A genus of tropical or subtropical plants of the natural order Anonaceæ, including the soursop.
Aread: To tell, declare, explain, or interpret; to divine; to guess; as, to aread a riddle or a dream.
atomistical: divided into separate and often disparate elements.
Adios: Adieu; farewell; good-by; -- chiefly used among Spanish-speaking people.
Ariel: In the Cabala, a water spirit; in later folklore, a light and graceful spirit of the air.
Appointment: The act of appointing; designation of a person to hold an office or discharge a trust; as, he erred by the appointment of unsuitable men.
Austerlitz: a decisive battle during the Napoleonic campaigns (1805); the French under Napoleon defeated the Russian and Austrian armies of Czar Alexander I and Emperor Francis II.
Abiological: Pertaining to the study of inanimate things.
1st: preceding all other objects or events in order, time, or importance; occurring before all other members of a series.
Alcoholature: An alcoholic tincture prepared with fresh plants.
Airily: In an airy manner; lightly; gaily; jauntily; flippantly.
Asteism: Genteel irony; a polite and ingenious manner of deriding another.
Anomalistic: Irregular; departing from common or established rules.
Arhant: a Buddhist who has attained nirvana.
anginal: of or pertaining to angina or angina pectoris.
Appel: A tap or stamp of the foot as a warning of intent to attack; -- called also attack.
Anarthrous: Used without the article; as, an anarthrous substantive.
Amorphozoa: Animals without a mouth or regular internal organs, as the sponges.
Aperea: The wild Guinea pig of Brazil (Cavia aperea).
aspartame: an artificial sweetener containing an aspartic acid peptide, (C14H18N2O5); it is 160 times sweeter than sucrose (cane sugar) and is used as a calorie-free sweetener. Chemically it is N-L-α-aspartyl-L-phenylalanine-1-methyl ester.  It is sold also under the trade name Equal.
Angularity: The quality or state of being angular; angularness.
Ashes: The earthy or mineral particles of combustible substances remaining after combustion, as of wood or coal.
Antimeter: A modification of the quadrant, for measuring small angles.
arteriovenous: connecting an artery to a vein.
Amazedness: The state of being amazed, or confounded with fear, surprise, or wonder.
Agree: To make harmonious; to reconcile or make friends.
Artificiality: The quality or appearance of being artificial; that which is artificial.
Amole: Any detergent plant, or the part of it used as a detergent, as the roots of Agave Americana, Chlorogalum pomeridianum, etc.
Avenalin: A crystalline globulin, contained in oat kernels, very similar in composition to excelsin, but different in reactions and crystalline form.
Ashtoreth: The principal female divinity of the Phœnicians, as Baal was the principal male divinity.
Ardent spirits: any type of strongly alcoholic beverage prepared by distillation of an alcohol-containing fermented material.
Autocrat: An absolute sovereign; a monarch who holds and exercises the powers of government by claim of absolute right, not subject to restriction; as, Autocrat of all the Russias (a title of the Czar).
Acrotic: Pertaining to or affecting the surface.
Amendable: Capable of being amended; as, an amendable writ or error.
Achlamydeous: Naked; having no floral envelope, neither calyx nor corolla.
Accurately: In an accurate manner; exactly; precisely; without error or defect.
1: used of a single unit or thing; not two or more; -- representing the number one as an Arabic numeral
Advertisement: The act of informing or notifying; notification.
Anurous: Destitute of a tail, as the frogs and toads.
\u00c6: A diphthong in the Latin language; used also by the Saxon writers. It answers to the Gr. ai. The Anglo-Saxon short æ was generally replaced by a, the long &aemacr_; by e or ee.  In derivatives from Latin words with ae, it is mostly superseded by e. For most words found with this initial combination, the reader will therefore search under the letter E.
Average: To form, or exist in, a mean or medial sum or quantity; to amount to, or to be, on an average; as, the losses of the owners will average twenty five dollars each; these spars average ten feet in length.
Advent: The period including the four Sundays before Christmas.
aeolic: Æolian, 1; as, the Æolic dialect; the Æolic mode.
Ancome: A small ulcerous swelling, coming suddenly; also, a whitlow.
4th: coming next after the third in position
4to: the size of a book whose pages are made by folding a sheet of paper twice to form four leaves.
Angiocarpous: Having fruit inclosed within a covering that does not form a part of itself; as, the filbert covered by its husk, or the acorn seated in its cupule.
aeolotropic: Exhibiting differences of quality or property in different directions; having properties with different values along different axes; not isotropic.  In specialized contexts, synonymous with anisotropic.
Advene: To accede, or come (to); to be added to something or become a part of it, though not essential.
arrow-shaped: like an arrow head without flaring base lobes; -- of a leaf shape.
Asleep: In a state of sleep; in sleep; dormant.
Artichoke: The Cynara scolymus, a plant somewhat resembling a thistle, with a dilated, imbricated, and prickly involucre. The head (to which the name is also applied) is composed of numerous oval scales, inclosing the florets, sitting on a broad receptacle, which, with the fleshy base of the scales, is much esteemed as an article of food.
auxin: a substance which, in small concentrations, promotes root formation, bud growth, or certain other processes such as fruit ripening or leaf drop in plants.
Asthma paper: Paper impregnated with saltpeter. The fumes from the burning paper are often inhaled as an alleviative by asthmatics.
Arow: In a row, line, or rank; successively; in order.
Apanthropy: An aversion to the company of men; a love of solitude.
Anchor shot: A shot made with the object balls in an anchor space.
Accord: To agree; to correspond; to be in harmony; -- followed by with, formerly also by to; as, his disposition accords with his looks.
Adipic: Pertaining to, or derived from, fatty or oily substances; -- applied to certain acids obtained from fats by the action of nitric acid.
Auscultate: To practice auscultation; to examine by auscultation.
Antiquitarian: An admirer of antiquity. [Used by Milton in a disparaging sense.]
ascetical: pertaining to or characteristic of an ascetic
Adherency: The state or quality of being adherent; adherence.
Anarch: The author of anarchy; one who excites revolt.
Antiphlogistian: An opposer of the theory of phlogiston.
Atomically: In an atomic manner; in accordance with the atomic philosophy.
Adherence: The quality or state of adhering.
Assimulate: To feign; to counterfeit; to simulate; to resemble.
Andalusite: A silicate of aluminium, occurring usually in thick rhombic prisms, nearly square, of a grayish or pale reddish tint. It was first discovered in Andalusia, Spain.
anesthyl: a mixture of methyl chloride and ethyl chloride; sprayed on as a local anesthetic.
Affectively: In an affective manner; impressively; emotionally.
Adroit: Dexterous in the use of the hands or in the exercise of the mental faculties; exhibiting skill and readiness in avoiding danger or escaping difficulty; ready in invention or execution; -- applied to persons and to acts; as, an adroit mechanic, an adroit reply.
Azurite: Blue carbonate of copper; blue malachite.
Apogeotropism: The apogeotropic tendency of some leaves, and other parts.
Augurship: The office, or period of office, of an augur.
Archery: The use of the bow and arrows in battle, hunting, etc.; the art, practice, or skill of shooting with a bow and arrows.
Avicula: A genus of marine bivalves, having a pearly interior, allied to the pearl oyster; -- so called from a supposed resemblance of the typical species to a bird.
Amovability: Liability to be removed or dismissed from office.
Amioidei: An order of ganoid fishes of which Amia is the type. See Bowfin and Ganoidei.
Audaciousness: The quality of being audacious; impudence; audacity.
Ageratum: A genus of plants, one species of which (Ageratum Mexicanum) has lavender-blue flowers in dense clusters.
Androsphinx: A man sphinx; a sphinx having the head of a man and the body of a lion.
Acarpellous: Having no carpels.  Opposite of  carpellate.
Alinasal: Pertaining to expansions of the nasal bone or cartilage.
Ant thrush: One of several species of tropical birds, of the Old World, of the genus Pitta, somewhat resembling the thrushes, and feeding chiefly on ants.
all-rounder: a versatile person who is expert at many things.
Agalmatolite: A soft, compact stone, of a grayish, greenish, or yellowish color, carved into images by the Chinese, and hence called figure stone, and pagodite. It is probably a variety of pinite.
Arbitrarily: In an arbitrary manner; by will only; despotically; absolutely.
Angelic: Of or derived from angelica; as, angelic acid; angelic ether.
Achras: tropical trees having papery leaves and large fruit.
audio system: a system of electronic equipment for recording or reproducing sound.
Albuminosis: A morbid condition due to excessive increase of albuminous elements in the blood.
abampere: a unit of electrical current equal to 10 amperes.
1000: denoting a quantity consisting of one more than nine hundred ninety nine and one less than one thousand and one; -- representing the number one thousand as Arabic numerals
Atrypa: A extinct genus of Branchiopoda, very common in Silurian limestones.
Aorist: A tense in the Greek language, which expresses an action as completed in past time, but leaves it, in other respects, wholly indeterminate.
Anthropotomical: Pertaining to anthropotomy, or the dissection of human bodies.
Acrimony: A quality of bodies which corrodes or destroys others; also, a harsh or biting sharpness; as, the acrimony of the juices of certain plants.
Auto-inoculation: Inoculation of a person with virus from his own body.
Achlamydate: Not possessing a mantle; -- said of certain gastropods.
Apheresis: The dropping of a letter or syllable from the beginning of a word; e. g., cute for acute.
Acanthurus: type genus of the family Acanthuridae; doctorfishes.
Ankh: A tau cross with a loop at the top, used as an attribute or sacred emblem, symbolizing generation or enduring life. Called also crux ansata.
arsehole: execretory opening at the end of the alimentary canal.
Aphasia: Loss of the power of speech, or of the appropriate use of words, the vocal organs remaining intact, and the intelligence being preserved. It is dependent on injury or disease of the brain.
Aphasic: Pertaining to, or affected by, aphasia; speechless.
anesthetized: rendered insensible by anesthetizing.  Same as anaesthetized.
Attle: Rubbish or refuse consisting of broken rock containing little or no ore.
Andricus: a genus of cynipid gall wasps, chiefly affecting oaks.
Admissibility: The quality of being admissible; admissibleness; as, the admissibility of evidence.
Aranea: a genus of common garden spiders.
Apatosaurus: a genus of extinct dinosaurs comprising the brontosaurs; apatosaurs.
Archimedean: Of or pertaining to Archimedes, a celebrated Greek philosopher; constructed on the principle of Archimedes' screw; as, Archimedean drill, propeller, etc.
Acetophenone: A crystalline ketone, CH3.CO.C6H5, which may be obtained by the dry distillation of a mixture of the calcium salts of acetic and benzoic acids. It is used as a hypnotic under the name of hypnone.
Apertion: The act of opening; an opening; an aperture.
Alkalify: To become changed into an alkali.
Anabatic: Pertaining to anabasis; as, an anabatic fever.
agnostical: of or pertaining to agnosticism; agnostic.
Amenity: The quality of being pleasant or agreeable, whether in respect to situation, climate, manners, or disposition; pleasantness; civility; suavity; gentleness.
alphanumerics: a character set that includes letters and digits and punctuation marks.
Aristotelian: Of or pertaining to Aristotle, the famous Greek philosopher (384-322 b. c.).
Affabrous: Executed in a workmanlike manner; ingeniously made.
Autophony: An auscultatory process, which consists in noting the tone of the observer's own voice, while he speaks, holding his head close to the patient's chest.
