Aoudad: An African sheeplike quadruped (the Ammotragus lervia, formerly Ammotragus tragelaphus) having a long mane on the breast and fore legs; the wild sheep of northern Africa; -- called also Barbary sheep. It is, perhaps, the chamois of the Old Testament.
Advertise: To give notice to; to inform or apprise; to notify; to make known; hence, to warn; -- often followed by of before the subject of information; as, to advertise a man of his loss.
Aggression: The first attack, or act of hostility; the first act of injury, or first act leading to a war or a controversy; unprovoked attack; assault; as, a war of aggression. “Aggressions of power.”
Anobiidae: the family comprising the deathwatch beetles.
Arbitratrix: A female who arbitrates or judges.
Arch\u00e6an: The earliest period in geological period, extending up to the Lower Silurian. It includes an Azoic age, previous to the appearance of life, and an Eozoic age, including the earliest forms of life.
Assart: To grub up, as trees; to commit an assart upon; as, to assart land or trees.
Apple-faced: Having a round, broad face, like an apple.
Aquifoliaceae: a family of widely distributed shrubs and trees.
Anathematic: Pertaining to, or having the nature of, an anathema.
Aristate: Having a pointed, beardlike process, as the glumes of wheat; awned.
Avaiably: In an available manner; profitably; advantageously; efficaciously.
Alquifou: A lead ore found in Cornwall, England, and used by potters to give a green glaze to their wares; potter's ore.
Aubade: An open air concert in the morning, as distinguished from an evening serenade; also, a pianoforte composition suggestive of morning.
Atmology: That branch of science which treats of the laws and phenomena of aqueous vapor.
acetophenetidin: a white crystalline compound used as an analgesic and also as an antipyretic.
Acanthophis: a genus of Australian elapid snakes.
Awakener: One who, or that which, awakens.
appurtenances: miscellaneous articles needed for a particular operation or sport etc.
Aftergrowth: A second growth or crop, or (metaphorically) development.
anemophilous: pollinated by the wind; -- of flowering plants; especially grasses etc.
Ailurus: a genus comprising the lesser pandas.
Appositional: Pertaining to apposition; put in apposition syntactically.
Ardois system: A widely used system of electric night signals in which a series of double electric lamps (white and red) is arranged vertically on a mast, and operated from a keyboard below.
Anglophilia: exaggerated admiration for England and English customs.
anthropogenesis: the evolution or genesis of the human race.
Aviary: A house, inclosure, large cage, or other place, for keeping birds confined; a bird house.
Artocarpeous: Of or pertaining to the breadfruit, or to the genus Artocarpus.
Anglemeter: An instrument to measure angles, esp. one used by geologists to measure the dip of strata.
Anthropic: Like or related to man; human.
Aerobics: physical exercises performed in a sustained and strenuous fashion designed to cause a temporary increase in respiration rate and heart rate, such a running, swimming, walking, or calisthenics.  Calisthenic sessions in groups, performed by following a leader in moving to a rhythmic musical accompaniment, are a popular form of aerobics.
Addibility: The quantity of being addible; capability of addition.
Autocratic: Of or pertaining to autocracy or to an autocrat; absolute; holding independent and arbitrary powers of government.
Artotyrite: One of a sect in the primitive church, who celebrated the Lord's Supper with bread and cheese, alleging that the first oblations of men not only of the fruit of the earth, but of their flocks. [Gen. iv. 3, 4.]
Attribution: The act of attributing or ascribing, as a quality, character, or function, to a thing or person, an effect to a cause.
Alabaman: A native or resident of Alabama.
Anapestic: Pertaining to an anapest; consisting of an anapests; as, an anapestic meter, foot, verse.
Arminianism: The religious doctrines or tenets of the Arminians.
Argyrol: a compound of protein and silver used as a mild antiseptic; Argyrol is the trademark.
Alyssum: A genus of cruciferous plants; madwort. The sweet alyssum (Alyssum maritimum), cultivated for bouquets, bears small, white, sweet-scented flowers.
Annual: A thing happening or returning yearly; esp. a literary work published once a year.
Aggressor: The person who first attacks or makes an aggression; he who begins hostility or a quarrel; an assailant.
Athenian: Of or pertaining to Athens, the metropolis of Greece.
Acrostically: After the manner of an acrostic.
Amp\u00e8re hour: The quantity of electricity delivered in one hour by a current whose average strength is one ampère. It is used as a unit of quantity, and is equal to 3600 coulombs. The terms Ampère minute and Ampère second are sometimes similarly used.
Adventurousness: The quality or state of being adventurous; daring; venturesomeness.
Allonymous: Published under the name of some one other than the author.
Afro-American: of or pertaining to or characteristic of Americans of African ancestry or their history or culture.
Aleuronat: Flour made of aleurone, used as a substitute for ordinary flour in preparing bread for diabetic persons.
Alloquy: A speaking to another; an address.
Aggregate: A mass, assemblage, or sum of particulars; as, a house is an aggregate of stone, brick, timber, etc.
Anonaceous: Pertaining to the order of plants including the soursop, custard apple, etc.
Airometer: A hollow cylinder to contain air. It is closed above and open below, and has its open end plunged into water.
Acme: The top or highest point; the culmination.
Arcograph: An instrument for drawing a circular arc without the use of a central point; a cyclograph.
Authenticness: The quality of being authentic; authenticity.
Appalling: Such as to appall; as, an appalling accident.
attelet: a type of skewer with an ornamental handle which is used for holding foods for presentation at the table, but not while cooking.
Arouse: To excite to action from a state of rest; to stir, or put in motion or exertion; to rouse; to excite; as, to arouse one from sleep; to arouse the dormant faculties.
Albertite: A bituminous mineral resembling asphaltum, found in the county of Albert, New Brunswick.
Audiphone: An instrument which, placed against the teeth, conveys sound to the auditory nerve and enables the deaf to hear more or less distinctly; a dentiphone.
Aspirate: Pronounced with the h sound or with audible breath.
Acouchy: A small species of agouti (Dasyprocta acouchy).
Apocopation: Shortening by apocope; the state of being apocopated.
Agrarianism: An equal or equitable division of landed property; the principles or acts of those who favor a redistribution of land.
60: one more than fifty-nine; denoting a quantity consisting of sixty items or units; -- representing the number sixty as an Arabic numeral
Administrable: Capable of being administered; as, an administrable law.
Alpenglow: A reddish glow seen near sunset or sunrise on the summits of mountains; specif., a reillumination sometimes observed after the summits have passed into shadow, supposed to be due to a curving downward (refraction) of the light rays from the west resulting from the cooling of the air.
Apron: An article of dress, of cloth, leather, or other stuff, worn on the fore part of the body, to keep the clothes clean, to defend them from injury, or as a covering. It is commonly tied at the waist by strings.
Ascendency: Governing or controlling influence; the state that exists when one person or group has power over another; domination; power.
agueweed: a gentian of East North America having clusters of bristly blue flowers.
500: one more than four hundred ninety-nine; five times one hundred; denoting a quantity consisting of five hundred items or units; -- representing the number five hundred as Arabic numerals
Asbestiform: Having the form or structure of asbestus.
Aye-aye: A singular nocturnal quadruped, allied to the lemurs, found in Madagascar (Cheiromys Madagascariensis), remarkable for its long fingers, sharp nails, and rodent-like incisor teeth.
Acquiescency: The quality of being acquiescent; acquiescence.
Austro-Hungarian: Of or pertaining to the monarchy composed of Austria and Hungary.
Astrophotometer: A photometer for measuring the brightness of stars.
Amphiblastic: Segmenting unequally; -- said of telolecithal ova with complete segmentation.
Articulator: One who, or that which, articulates; as: (a) One who enunciates distinctly. (b) One who prepares and mounts skeletons. (c) An instrument to cure stammering.
Aleppo boil: A chronic skin affection terminating in an ulcer, most commonly of the face. It is endemic along the Mediterranean, and is probably due to a specific bacillus. Called also Aleppo ulcer, Biskara boil, Delhi boil, Oriental sore, etc.
agitated: troubled emotionally and usually deeply.  Opposite of unagitated.
aeonian: Eternal; everlasting; lasting for an indefinitely long time; immortal; not subject to death.  Opposite of mortal.
Aphrodite: The Greek goddess of love, corresponding to the Venus of the Romans.
Arietation: The act of butting like a ram; act of using a battering-ram.
Anthropocentric: Assuming man as the center or ultimate end; -- applied to theories of the universe or of any part of it, as the solar system.
Anomalous: Deviating from a general rule, method, or analogy; abnormal; irregular; as, an anomalous proceeding.
Applot: To divide into plots or parts; to apportion.
Acrolithan: Pertaining to, or like, an acrolith.
An\u00e6sthetization: The process of anæsthetizing; also, the condition of the nervous system induced by anæsthetics.
Accensor: One of the functionaries who light and trim the tapers.
ascoma: an ascocarp having the spore-bearing layer of cells (the hymenium) on a broad disklike receptacle.
Allelomorph: One of the pure unit characters commonly existing singly or in pairs in the germ cells of Mendelian hybrids, and exhibited in varying proportion among the organisms themselves; same as allele, 2. Allelomorphs which under certain circumstances are themselves compound are called hypallelomorphs. See Mendel's law.
Angwantibo: A small lemuroid mammal (Arctocebus Calabarensis) of Africa. It has only a rudimentary tail.
Annotinous: A year old; in Yearly growths.
Axolotl: An amphibian of the salamander tribe found in the elevated lakes of Mexico; the siredon.
Autoclave: A kind of French stewpan with a steam-tight lid.
Associate in Applied Science: an associate degree conferred for successful studies in applied science.
Amotus: Elevated, -- as a toe, when raised so high that the tip does not touch the ground.
Arithmetic: The science of numbers; the art of computation by figures.
Antigalastic: Causing a diminution or a suppression of the secretion of milk.
Avale: To cause to descend; to lower; to let fall; to doff.
Astigmatism: A defect of the eye or of a lens, in consequence of which the rays derived from one point are not brought to a single focal point, thus causing imperfect images or indistinctness of vision.
airfield: a place where planes take off and land; an airport; -- usually used of airports other than those with regularly sheduled commercial flights, such as those at military bases or small fields for private aircraft.
anti-aircraft: designed for or used for defense against attack by aircraft; as, anti-aircraft cannon.
Agincourt: a battle in which English longbowmen under Henry V decisively defeated a much larger French army in 1415.  It was named for the site at which it occurred.
Atmolysis: The act or process of separating mingled gases of unequal diffusibility by transmission through porous substances.  See also gaseous diffusion.
Arctation: Constriction or contraction of some natural passage, as in constipation from inflammation.
Astrologize: To apply astrology to; to study or practice astrology.
Accompanier: He who, or that which, accompanies.
Australian ballot: A system of balloting or voting in public elections, originally used in South Australia, in which there is such an arrangement for polling votes that secrecy is compulsorily maintained, and the ballot used is an official ballot printed and distributed by the government.
Air-tight: A stove the draft of which can be almost entirely shut off.
agnathan: an eel-shaped vertebrate without jaws or paired appendages; a member of the Agnatha.  The group includes the cyclostomes and some extinct forms.
ascosporic: of or pertaining to an ascospore.
Afforcement: A fortress; a fortification for defense.
Anarthropoda: One of the divisions of Articulata in which there are no jointed legs, as the annelids; -- opposed to Arthropoda.
Army: A collection or body of men armed for war, esp. one organized in companies, battalions, regiments, brigades, and divisions, under proper officers.
Absorption: The act or process of absorbing or sucking in anything, or of being absorbed and made to disappear; as, the absorption of bodies in a whirlpool, the absorption of a smaller tribe into a larger.
Arms: Instruments or weapons of offense or defense.
Anglicize: To make English; to English; to anglify; render conformable to the English idiom, or to English analogies.
Astonishment: The condition of one who is stunned. Hence: Numbness; loss of sensation; stupor; loss of sense.
After damp: An irrespirable gas, remaining after an explosion of fire damp in mines; choke damp. See Carbonic acid.
Altruist: One imbued with altruism; -- opposed to egoist.
Archiepiscopate: The office of an archbishop; an archbishopric.
Abecedarian: Pertaining to, or formed by, the letters of the alphabet; alphabetic; hence, rudimentary.
Anti\u00e6: The two projecting feathered angles of the forehead of some birds; the frontal points.
Acuminate: To end in, or come to, a sharp point.
Altruism: Regard for others, both natural and moral; devotion to the interests of others; brotherly kindness; -- opposed to egoism or selfishness.
Abraid: To awake; to arouse; to stir or start up; also, to shout out.
Acclivity: A slope or inclination of the earth, as the side of a hill, considered as ascending, in opposition to declivity, or descending; an upward slope; ascent.
Alcoran: The Mohammedan Scriptures; the Koran (now the usual form).
Arpeggio: The production of the tones of a chord in rapid succession, as in playing the harp, and not simultaneously; a strain thus played.
Amphigenous: Increasing in size by growth on all sides, as the lichens.
Anthotaxy: The arrangement of flowers in a cluster; the science of the relative position of flowers; inflorescence.
Anomura: A group of decapod Crustacea, of which the hermit crab in an example.
Administerial: Pertaining to administration, or to the executive part of government.
Amorphism: A state of being amorphous; esp. a state of being without crystallization even in the minutest particles, as in glass, opal, etc.
askant: toward the side, rather than directly ahead; -- used of a glance.
Anise: An umbelliferous plant (Pimpinella anisum) growing naturally in Egypt, and cultivated in Spain, Malta, etc., for its carminative and aromatic seeds.
Agrappes: Hooks and eyes for armor, etc.
Autonomous: Independent in government; having the right or power of self-government.
Annunciation lily: The common white lily (Lilium candidum). So called because it is usually introduced by painters in pictures of the Annunciation.
Alectryomancy: Divination by means of a cock and grains of corn placed on the letters of the alphabet, the letters being put together in the order in which the grains were eaten.
Antepenult: The last syllable of a word except two, as -syl- in monosyllable.
Agamist: An unmarried person; also, one opposed to marriage.
aquaculture: the cultivation of aquatic animals, such as fish or shellfish, or of plants, such as seaweed, in a controlled and sometimes enclosed body of water.  The term includes use of either salt or fresh water.  It is a form of agriculture, but under water.
Ashamed: Affected by shame; abashed or confused by guilt, or a conviction or consciousness of some wrong action or impropriety.
Apsu: father of the gods and consort of Tiamat.
Amitotic: Of or pertaining to amitosis; karyostenotic; -- opposed to mitotic.
Assign: A person to whom property or an interest is transferred; as, a deed to a man and his heirs and assigns.
Apse: A projecting part of a building, esp. of a church, having in the plan a polygonal or semicircular termination, and, most often, projecting from the east end. In early churches the Eastern apse was occupied by seats for the bishop and clergy.
alkane series: a series of acyclic non-aromatic saturated hydrocarbons with the general formula CnH(2n+2). They include methane, ethane, propane, butane, and the paraffins.
Arbitrariness: The quality of being arbitrary; despoticalness; tyranny.
Arrish: The stubble of wheat or grass; a stubble field; eddish.
Assuring: That assures; tending to assure; giving confidence.
Aventre: To thrust forward (at a venture), as a spear.
Adulation: Servile flattery; praise in excess, or beyond what is merited.
Agitator: One who agitates; one who stirs up or excites others; as, political reformers and agitators.
Achromatization: The act or process of achromatizing.
Anopla: One of the two orders of Nemerteans. See Nemertina.
Amphitropal: Having the ovule inverted, but with the attachment near the middle of one side; half anatropous.
Archdeaconry: The district, office, or residence of an archdeacon. See Benefice.
Alum stone: A subsulphate of alumina and potash; alunite.
Architective: Used in building; proper for building.
Anguillidae: a natural family of eels that live in fresh water as adults but return to the sea to spawn.
Astay: An anchor is said to be astay, when, in heaving it, an acute angle is formed between the cable and the surface of the water.
Arace: To tear up by the roots; to draw away.
Anil: A West Indian plant (Indigofera anil), one of the original sources of indigo; also, the indigo dye.
A\u00ebrostat: A balloon, especially a passive balloon; a balloon without motive power.  Contrasted with aerodyne.
5: one more than four; denoting a quantity consisting of five items or units; -- representing the number five as an Arabic numeral
anthelminthic: capable of expelling or destroying parasitic worms.
Albatross: A web-footed bird, of the genus Diomedea, of which there are several species. They are the largest of sea birds, capable of long-continued flight, and are often seen at great distances from the land. They are found chiefly in the southern hemisphere.
Axled: Having an axle; -- used in composition.
Aphis lion: The larva of the lacewinged flies (Chrysopa), which feeds voraciously upon aphids. The name is also applied to the larvæ of the ladybugs (Coccinella).
Ascidian: One of the Ascidioidea, or in a more general sense, one of the Tunicata. Also as an adj.
Arcturus: A fixed star of the first magnitude in the constellation Boötes.
Absorbable: Capable of being absorbed or swallowed up.
Adrift: Floating at random; in a drifting condition; at the mercy of wind and waves. Also fig.
Accordion: A small, portable, keyed wind instrument, whose tones are generated by play of the wind upon free metallic reeds.
Asteriated: Radiated, with diverging rays; as, asteriated sapphire.
Arcuately: In the form of a bow.
Affrontive: Tending to affront or offend; offensive; abusive.
Antimask: A secondary mask, or grotesque interlude, between the parts of a serious mask.
Approving: Expressing approbation; commending; as, an approving smile.
Alliaceous: Of or pertaining to the genus Allium, or garlic, onions, leeks, etc.; having the smell or taste of garlic or onions.
Amyl: A univalent hydrocarbon radical, C5H11, of the paraffine series found in amyl alcohol or fusel oil, etc.
Aphesis: The loss of a short unaccented vowel at the beginning of a word; -- the result of a phonetic process; as, squire for esquire.
al-: All; wholly; completely; as, almighty, almost.
ash-key: the winged seed of the ash tree.
Aphanite: A very compact, dark-colored &unr_;ock, consisting of hornblende, or pyroxene, and feldspar, but neither of them in perceptible grains.
Anxiously: In an anxious manner; with painful uncertainty; solicitously.
Ablution: The act of washing or cleansing; specifically, the washing of the body, or some part of it, as a religious rite.
Astern: In or at the hinder part of a ship; toward the hinder part, or stern; backward; as, to go astern.
Aroint: To drive or scare off by some exclamation.
Anastigmatic: Not astigmatic;  free of astigmatism; -- pertaining to a lens or lens system, and used especially of a lens system which consists of a converging lens and a diverging lens of equal and opposite astigmatism but different focal lengths, and sensibly free from astigmatism.
Abduct: To take away surreptitiously by force; to carry away (a human being) wrongfully and usually by violence; to kidnap.
Apothegmatic: Pertaining to, or in the manner of, an apothegm; sententious; pithy.
Anthozoa: The class of the Cœlenterata which includes the corals and sea anemones. The three principal groups or orders are Acyonaria, Actinaria, and Madreporaria.
Anthropopathism: The ascription of human feelings or passions to God, or to a polytheistic deity.
Acoustically: In relation to sound or to hearing.
Aviate: To fly, or navigate the air, in an aëroplane or heavier-than-air flying machine.
Abraxas: A mystical word used as a charm and engraved on gems among the ancients; also, a gem stone thus engraved.
actinopod: protozoa having stiff rodlike radiating pseudopods.
Assessorship: The office or function of an assessor.
Amaranthaceae: a cosmopolitan family of herbs and shrubs.
Anisodactylous: Characterized by unequal toes, three turned forward and one backward, as in most passerine birds.
Antares: The principal star in Scorpio: -- called also the Scorpion's Heart.
Alliteral: Pertaining to, or characterized by alliteration.
Apocope: The cutting off, or omission, of the last letter, syllable, or part of a word.
Archetypally: With reference to the archetype; originally. “Parts archetypally distinct.”
Amylic: Pertaining to, or derived from, amyl; as, amylic ether.
Anelectrotonus: The condition of decreased irritability of a nerve in the region of the positive electrode or anode on the passage of a current of electricity through it.
Amblypoda: A group of large, extinct, herbivorous mammals, common in the Tertiary formation of the United States.
Absolutely: In an absolute, independent, or unconditional manner; wholly; positively.
Abusion: Evil or corrupt usage; abuse; wrong; reproach; deception; cheat.
Altarage: The offerings made upon the altar, or to a church.
Anchylosis: Stiffness or fixation of a joint; formation of a stiff joint.
Append: To hang or attach to, as by a string, so that the thing is suspended; as, a seal appended to a record; the inscription was appended to the column.
Argillo-areenaceous: Consisting of, or containing, clay and sand, as a soil.
-arch: A suffix meaning a ruler, as in monarch (a sole ruler).
Algarot: A term used for the Powder of Algaroth, a white powder which is a compound of trichloride and trioxide of antimony. It was formerly used in medicine as an emetic, purgative, and diaphoretic.
Acred: Possessing acres or landed property; -- used in composition; as, large-acred men.
altar boy: a boy who assists a priest at the clebration of the Holy Mass and other forms of public worship; -- also called acolyte.
Anomalopidae: a natural family comprising the flashlightfishes.
ameboid: resembling an amoeba especially in the shape or manner of motion
Authentically: In an authentic manner; with the requisite or genuine authority.
Amarantaceous: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, the family of plants of which the amaranth is the type.
Adorer: One who adores; a worshiper; one who admires or loves greatly; an ardent admirer.
Antisocial: Tending to interrupt or destroy social intercourse; averse to society, or hostile to its existence; as, antisocial principles.
Amorphozoic: Of or pertaining to the Amorphozoa.
antibaryon: the antiparticle of a baryon; a hadron with a baryon number of -1.
Approaching: The act of ingrafting a sprig or shoot of one tree into another, without cutting it from the parent stock; -- called, also, inarching and grafting by approach.
Augurial: Relating to augurs or to augury.
Armament: A body of forces equipped for war; -- used of a land or naval force.
Aluminous: Pertaining to or containing alum, or alumina; as, aluminous minerals, aluminous solution.
Apropos: Opportunely or opportune; seasonably or seasonable.
After-mentioned: Mentioned afterwards; as, persons after-mentioned (in a writing).
Atrichornithidae: a antural family comprising the scrubbirds.
Anacardiaceous: Belonging to, or resembling, a family, or order, of plants of which the cashew tree is the type, and the species of sumac are well known examples.
Alluminor: An illuminator of manuscripts and books; a limner.
Associator: An associate; a confederate or partner in any scheme.
airplane: a heavier-than-air aircraft.  Same as aeroplane{2}.
Aggrade: To bring, or tend to bring, to a uniform grade, or slope, by addition of material; as, streams aggrade their beds by depositing sediment.
Amphicarpic: Producing fruit of two kinds, either as to form or time of ripening.
Anacamptic: Reflecting of reflected; as, an anacamptic sound (and echo).
Aricine: An alkaloid, first found in white cinchona bark.
Aptychus: A shelly plate found in the terminal chambers of ammonite shells. Some authors consider them to be jaws; others, opercula.
activator: any agency bringing about activation; (Biol.) a molecule that increases the activity of an enzyme or a protein that increases the production of a gene product in DNA transcription.
Antemeridian: Being before noon; in or pertaining to the forenoon. (Abbrev. a. m.)
Actinometer: An instrument for measuring the direct heating power of the sun's rays.
Apocarpous: Either entirely or partially separate, as the carpels of a compound pistil; -- opposed to syncarpous.
antebellum: belonging to a period before a war, especially the American Civil War.
Associationist: One who explains the higher functions and relations of the soul by the association of ideas; e. g., Hartley, J. C. Mill.
Aphth\u00e6: Roundish pearl-colored specks or flakes in the mouth, on the lips, etc., terminating in white sloughs. They are commonly characteristic of thrush.
Alehouse: A house where ale is retailed; hence, a tippling house.
Associationism: The doctrine or theory held by associationists.
Almanac: A book or table, containing a calendar of days, and months, to which astronomical data and various statistics are often added, such as the times of the rising and setting of the sun and moon, eclipses, hours of full tide, stated festivals of churches, terms of courts, etc.
Armet: A kind of helmet worn in the 14th, 15th, and 16th centuries.
Antependium: The hangings or screen in front of the altar; an altar cloth; the frontal.
Apician: Belonging to Apicius, a notorious Roman epicure; hence applied to whatever is peculiarly refined or dainty and expensive in cookery.
Armed: Furnished with weapons of offense or defense; furnished with the means of security or protection.
Arian: Pertaining to Arius, a presbyter of the church of Alexandria, in the fourth century, or to the doctrines of Arius, who held Christ to be inferior to God the Father in nature and dignity, though the first and noblest of all created beings.
Arsenicate: To combine with arsenic; to treat or impregnate with arsenic.
Avenaceous: Belonging to, or resembling, oats or the oat grasses.
Albumose: A compound or class of compounds formed from albumin by dilute acids or by an acid solution of pepsin. Used also in combination, as antialbumose, hemialbumose.
Anglo-Jewish: of English-speaking jews and their culture
Amentaceous: Resembling, or consisting of, an ament or aments; as, the chestnut has an amentaceous inflorescence.
Apn\u0153a: Partial privation or suspension of breath; suffocation; same as apnea.
Almoner: One who distributes alms, esp. the doles and alms of religious houses, almshouses, etc.; also, one who dispenses alms for another, as the almoner of a prince, bishop, etc.
Antimoniated: Combined or prepared with antimony; as, antimoniated tartar.
Ailantus: A genus of beautiful trees, natives of the East Indies. The tree imperfectly diœcious, and the staminate or male plant is very offensive when blossom.
arbitrageur: someone who engages in arbitrage; i. e. one who purchases securities in one market for immediate resale in another in the hope of profiting from the price differential.
Acclimatization: The act of acclimatizing; the process of inuring to a new climate, or the state of being so inured.
Anenterous: Destitute of a stomach or an intestine.
Anfractuous: Winding; full of windings and turnings; sinuous; tortuous; as, the anfractuous spires of a born.
Alleluia: An exclamation signifying Praise ye Jehovah. Hence: A song of praise to God. See Hallelujah, the commoner form.
Anapest: A metrical foot consisting of three syllables, the first two short, or unaccented, the last long, or accented (˘ ˘ -); the reverse of the dactyl. In Latin d&ebreve_;-&ibreve_;-tās, and in English in-ter-vene", are examples of anapests.
Affreightment: The act of hiring, or the contract for the use of, a vessel, or some part of it, to convey cargo.
Apriority: The quality of being innate in the mind, or prior to experience; a priori reasoning.
Aluminize: To treat or impregnate with alum; to alum.
Anopheles: A genus of mosquitoes which are secondary hosts of the malaria parasites, and whose bite is the usual, if not the only, means of infecting human beings with malaria. Several species are found in the United States. They may be distinguished from the ordinary mosquitoes of the genus Culex by the long slender palpi, nearly equaling the beak in length, while those of the female Culex are very short. They also assume different positions when resting, Culex usually holding the body parallel to the surface on which it rests and keeping the head and beak bent at an angle, while Anopheles holds the body at an angle with the surface and the head and beak in line with it. Unless they become themselves infected by previously biting a subject affected with malaria, the insects cannot transmit the disease.
Accentuate: To pronounce with an accent or with accents.
Acrostic: Pertaining to, or characterized by, acrostics.
Alcoholate: A crystallizable compound of a salt with alcohol, in which the latter plays a part analogous to that of water of crystallization.
Alban: A white crystalline resinous substance extracted from gutta-percha by the action of alcohol or ether.
Actinometry: The measurement of the force of solar radiation.
\u00c6olotropy: Difference of quality or property in different directions.
Asunder: Apart; separate from each other; into parts; in two; separately; into or in different pieces or places.
Atmologist: One who is versed in atmology.
Accubation: The act or posture of reclining on a couch, as practiced by the ancients at meals.
antiblack: discriminatory against black people; opposed to black people
artiodactyl: of, pertaining to, or belonging to the order Artiodactyla.
Adroitness: The quality of being adroit; skill and readiness; dexterity.
Apogean: Connected with the apogee; as, apogean (neap) tides, which occur when the moon has passed her apogee.
A cheval: Astride; with a part on each side; -- used specif. in designating the position of an army with the wings separated by some line of demarcation, as a river or road.
Aceric: Pertaining to, or obtained from, the maple; as, aceric acid.
Angelize: To raise to the state of an angel; to render angelic.
Abarticulation: Articulation, usually that kind of articulation which admits of free motion in the joint; diarthrosis.
Alunogen: A white fibrous mineral frequently found on the walls of mines and quarries, chiefly hydrous sulphate of alumina; -- also called feather alum, and hair salt.
Ascription: The act of ascribing, imputing, or affirming to belong; also, that which is ascribed.
Attemperation: The act of attempering or regulating.
Admirableness: The quality of being admirable; wonderful excellence.
autoeroticism: using you own body as a sexual object.
Aircraft: Any vehicle, such as an airplane, helicopter, balloon, etc., for floating in, or flying through, the air.
Abroad: At large; widely; broadly; over a wide space; as, a tree spreads its branches abroad.
Analectic: Relating to analects; made up of selections; as, an analectic magazine.
archesporium: a primitive cell or group of cells from which a mother cell develops.
Archducal: Of or pertaining to an archduke or archduchy.
Aloeaceae: one of many families or subfamilies into which some classification systems subdivide the Liliaceae but not widely accepted.
Apostasy: An abandonment of what one has voluntarily professed; a total desertion of departure from one's faith, principles, or party; esp., the renunciation of a religious faith; as, Julian's apostasy from Christianity.
Astride: With one leg on each side, as a man when on horseback; with the legs stretched wide apart; astraddle.
Assignation: The act of assigning or allotting; apportionment.
Adight: To set in order; to array; to attire; to deck, to dress.
Andantino: Rather quicker than andante; between that allegretto.
Apus: A genus of fresh-water phyllopod crustaceans. See Phyllopod.
Amaurotic: Affected with amaurosis; having the characteristics of amaurosis.
amah: a woman hired to suckle a child of someone else.
70: one more than sixty-nine; denoting a quantity consisting of seventy items or units; -- representing the number sevent as an Arabic numeral
Augustine: A member of one of the religious orders called after St. Augustine; an Austin friar.
Amplectant: Clasping a support; as, amplectant tendrils.
Aludel: One of the pear-shaped pots open at both ends, and so formed as to be fitted together, the neck of one into the bottom of another in succession; -- used in the process of sublimation.
\u00c6sthete: One who makes much or overmuch of æsthetics.
Aphidian: Of or pertaining to the family Aphidæ.
Akimbo: With a crook or bend; with the hand on the hip and elbow turned outward.
Anallantoidea: The division of Vertebrata in which no allantois is developed. It includes amphibians, fishes, and lower forms.
Appreciative: Having or showing a just or ready appreciation or perception; as, an appreciative audience.
Amain: To lower, as a sail, a yard, etc.
Armipotent: Powerful in arms; mighty in battle.
Allegory: A figurative sentence or discourse, in which the principal subject is described by another subject resembling it in its properties and circumstances. The real subject is thus kept out of view, and we are left to collect the intentions of the writer or speaker by the resemblance of the secondary to the primary subject.
Abysmal: Pertaining to, or resembling, an abyss; bottomless; unending; profound.
Auricled: Having ear-shaped appendages or lobes; auriculate; as, auricled leaves.
Afrocarpus: dioecious evergreen trees or shrubs; equatorial to S and SE Africa: yellowwood2; similar to trees or genus Podocarpus.
Accident: Literally, a befalling; an event that takes place without one's foresight or expectation; an undesigned, sudden, and unexpected event; chance; contingency; often, an undesigned and unforeseen occurrence of an afflictive or unfortunate character; a casualty; a mishap; as, to die by an accident.
Abaft: Toward the stern; aft; as, to go abaft.
Affluxion: The act of flowing towards; afflux.
Antonomastic: Pertaining to, or characterized by, antonomasia.
Arrogantly: In an arrogant manner; with undue pride or self-importance.
Attorn: To turn, or transfer homage and service, from one lord to another. This is the act of feudatories, vassals, or tenants, upon the alienation of the estate.
Along: (Now heard only in the prep. phrase along of.)
Adenography: That part of anatomy which describes the glands.
arthrosporous: of or pertaining to an arthrospore{2}.
Aptitude: A natural or acquired disposition or capacity for a particular purpose, or tendency to a particular action or effect; as, oil has an aptitude to burn.
A\u00ebrophobia: Dread of a current of air.
Alabamian: A native or resident of Alabama.
Anthroponomics: The science of the laws of the development of the human organism in relation to other organisms and to environment.
Archbishop: A chief bishop; a church dignitary of the first class (often called a metropolitan or primate) who superintends the conduct of the suffragan bishops in his province, and also exercises episcopal authority in his own diocese.
arb: Someone who engages in arbitrage (who purchases securities in one market for immediate resale in another in the hope of profiting from the price differential); shortened form of arbitrageur.
Anticlimax: A sentence in which the ideas fall, or become less important and striking, at the close; -- the opposite of climax. It produces a ridiculous effect.
Arrha: Money or other valuable thing given to evidence a contract; a pledge or earnest.
Assassinate: An assassination, murder, or murderous assault.
Argand lamp: A lamp with a circular hollow wick and glass chimney which allow a current of air both inside and outside of the flame.
Argilliferous: Producing clay; -- applied to such earths as abound with argil.
Angled: Having an angle or angles; -- used in compounds; as, right-angled, many-angled, etc.
Axiom: A self-evident and necessary truth, or a proposition whose truth is so evident as first sight that no reasoning or demonstration can make it plainer; a proposition which it is necessary to take for granted; as, “The whole is greater than a part;”  “A thing can not, at the same time, be and not be.”
Anti-Semitism: Opposition to, or hatred of, Semites, esp. Jews.  The word is sometimes also applied to acts motivated by or evincing antisemitism.
Argentine: A siliceous variety of calcite, or carbonate of lime, having a silvery-white, pearly luster, and a waving or curved lamellar structure.
Angles: An ancient Low German tribe, that settled in Britain, which came to be called Engla-land (Angleland or England). The Angles probably came from the district of Angeln (now within the limits of Schleswig), and the country now Lower Hanover, etc.
anaphor: a word (such as a pronoun) used to avoid repetition; the referent of an anaphor is determined by its antecedent.
Age: To cause to grow old; to impart the characteristics of age to; as, grief ages us.
Adminicular: Supplying help; auxiliary; corroborative; explanatory; as, adminicular evidence.
Acclimature: The act of acclimating, or the state of being acclimated.
Aga: In Turkey, a commander or chief officer. It is used also as a title of respect.
A\u00ebronef: A power-driven, heavier-than-air flying machine.  Now called airplane.
Anthropophagy: The eating of human flesh; cannibalism.
aminopyrine: a white crystalline substance used as an analgesic and antipyretic.
Accumulation: The act of accumulating, the state of being accumulated, or that which is accumulated; as, an accumulation of earth, of sand, of evils, of wealth, of honors.
Allspice: The berry of the pimento (Eugenia pimenta), a tree of the West Indies; a spice of a mildly pungent taste, and agreeably aromatic; Jamaica pepper; pimento. It has been supposed to combine the flavor of cinnamon, nutmegs, and cloves; and hence the name. The name is also given to other aromatic shrubs; as, the Carolina allspice (Calycanthus floridus); wild allspice (Lindera benzoin), called also spicebush, spicewood, and feverbush.
Amotion: Removal; ousting; especially, the removal of a corporate officer from his office.
A\u00ebrometry: The science of measuring the air, including the doctrine of its pressure, elasticity, rarefaction, and condensation; pneumatics.
Abrogation: The act of abrogating; repeal by authority.
Apollonian: Of, pertaining to, or resembling, Apollo.
Acromial: Of or pertaining to the acromion.
Abscession: A separating; removal; also, an abscess.
Acritical: Having no crisis; giving no indications of a crisis; as, acritical symptoms, an acritical abscess.
actinomyxidian: a type of parasite of worms.
Argyroxiphium: a small genus of Hawaiian spreading and rosette-forming shrubs.
Authorization: The act of giving authority or legal power; establishment by authority; sanction or warrant.
Antanagoge: A figure which consists in answering the charge of an adversary, by a counter charge.
Auricula: A species of Primula, or primrose, called also, from the shape of its leaves, bear's-ear.
Affectionately: With affection; lovingly; fondly; tenderly; kindly.
Archebiosis: The origination of living matter from non-living. See Abiogenesis.
\u00c6olipile: An apparatus consisting chiefly of a closed vessel (as a globe or cylinder) with one or more projecting bent tubes, through which steam is made to pass from the vessel, causing it to revolve.
Academic: One holding the philosophy of Socrates and Plato; a Platonist.
Acreable: Of an acre; per acre; as, the acreable produce.
Austerity: Sourness and harshness to the taste.
Amygdalate: An emulsion made of almonds; milk of almonds.
Analemma: An orthographic projection of the sphere on the plane of the meridian, the eye being supposed at an infinite distance, and in the east or west point of the horizon.
Attitudinarianism: A practicing of attitudes; posture making.
Annealer: One who, or that which, anneals.
Adventure: To try the chance; to take the risk.
9: one more than eight and one less than ten; denoting a quantity consisting of nine items or units; -- representing the number nine as an Arabic numeral
Angulometer: An instrument for measuring external angles.
Anseres: A Linnæan order of aquatic birds swimming by means of webbed feet, as the duck, or of lobed feet, as the grebe. In this order were included the geese, ducks, auks, divers, gulls, petrels, etc.
Abnormality: The state or quality of being abnormal; variation; irregularity.
Allegorization: The act of turning into allegory, or of understanding in an allegorical sense.
Apprehension: The act of seizing or taking hold of; seizure; as, the hand is an organ of apprehension.
Afflictive: Giving pain; causing continued or repeated pain or grief; distressing.
A\u00ebriferous: Conveying or containing air; air-bearing; as, the windpipe is an aëriferous tube.
atrociousness: the quality of being shockingly cruel and inhumane.
Almost: Nearly; well nigh; all but; for the greatest part.
avant-garde: Of, pertaining to, or belonging to the avant-garde.
Associate in Arts: a college degree granted for successful completion of a two-year course of study in arts or general topics.
Antestature: A small intrenchment or work of palisades, or of sacks of earth.
Abhorrent: Abhorring; detesting; having or showing abhorrence; loathing; hence, strongly opposed to; as, abhorrent thoughts.
Alkanet: A dyeing matter extracted from the roots of Alkanna tinctoria, which gives a fine deep red color.
Argyrotaenia: a genus comprising the orange tortrix.
Alpen: Of or pertaining to the Alps.
Auspicial: Of or pertaining to auspices; auspicious.
Albinoism: The state or condition of being an albino; albinism.
Abut: To project; to terminate or border; to be contiguous; to meet; -- with on, upon, or against; as, his land abuts on the road.
anaphylactic: of or pertaining to anaphylaxis; caused by anaphylaxis.
Anacrusis: A prefix of one or two unaccented syllables to a verse properly beginning with an accented syllable.
Alto: Formerly the part sung by the highest male, or counter-tenor, voices; now the part sung by the lowest female, or contralto, voices, between in tenor and soprano. In instrumental music it now signifies the tenor.
Air hole: A hole to admit or discharge air; specifically, a spot in the ice not frozen over.
Alpestrine: Pertaining to the Alps, or other high mountains; as, Alpestrine diseases, etc.
\u00c6stho-physiology: The science of sensation in relation to nervous action.
Algology: The study or science of algæ or seaweeds.
Air: To expose to the air for the purpose of cooling, refreshing, or purifying; to ventilate; as, to air a room.
Anxious: Full of anxiety or disquietude; greatly concerned or solicitous, esp. respecting something future or unknown; being in painful suspense; -- applied to persons; as, anxious for the issue of a battle.
Appraisal: A valuation by an authorized person; an appraisement.
Archaeornithes: a subclass of primitive reptilelike fossil birds of the Jurassic or early Cretaceous.
Arming: The act of furnishing with, or taking, arms.
Astroite: A radiated stone or fossil; star-stone.
Anode: The positive pole of an electric battery, or more strictly the electrode by which the current enters the electrolyte on its way to the other pole; -- opposed to cathode.
Allurer: One who, or that which, allures.
Avolation: The act of flying; flight; evaporation.
Atabal: A kettledrum; a kind of tabor, used by the Moors.
Anagasta: a genus of moths whose larvae are flour moths.
Alloxanate: A combination of alloxanic acid and a base or base or positive radical.
Aries: The Ram; the first of the twelve signs in the zodiac, which the sun enters at the vernal equinox, about the 21st of March.
Albuminin: The substance of the cells which inclose the white of birds' eggs.
Auld licht: A member of the conservative party in the Church of Scotland in the latter part of the 18th century.
A\u00ebromancy: Divination from the state of the air or from atmospheric substances; also, forecasting changes in the weather.
Abirritation: A pathological condition opposite to that of irritation; debility; lack of strength; asthenia.
Attendant: One who attends or accompanies in any character whatever, as a friend, companion, servant, agent, or suitor.
Anastate: One of a series of substances formed, in secreting cells, by constructive or anabolic processes, in the production of protoplasm; -- opposed to katastate.
Adipose: Of or pertaining to animal fat; fatty.
Anorthopia: Distorted vision, in which straight lines appear bent.
Apterous: Destitute of wings; apteral; as, apterous insects.
Archbishopric: The jurisdiction or office of an archbishop; the see or province over which archbishop exercises archiepiscopal authority.
Anabolism: The constructive metabolism of the body, as distinguished from catabolism.
A\u00ebrostatic: Of or pertaining to aërostatics; pneumatic.
Annuent: Nodding; as, annuent muscles (used in nodding).
Adulatress: A woman who flatters with servility.
acidotic: of or pertaining to acidosis; suffering from acidosis.
Approximately: With approximation; so as to approximate; nearly.
Aerodyne: a heavier-than-air aircraft; same as aeroplane.  Contrasted with aerostat.
allometry: the study of the relative growth of a part of an organism in relation to the growth of the whole.
Adaptiveness: The quality of being adaptive; capacity to adapt.
Algous: Of or pertaining to the algæ, or seaweeds; abounding with, or like, seaweed.
Alcaldia: The jurisdiction or office of an alcalde; also, the building or chamber in which he conducts the business of his office.
Attrahent: That which attracts, as a magnet.
Admix: To mingle with something else; to mix.
Advowson: The right of presenting to a vacant benefice or living in the church. [Originally, the relation of a patron (advocatus) or protector of a benefice, and thus privileged to nominate or present to it.]
Ana\u00ebrobia: Anaërobic bacteria. They are called facultative anaërobes when able to live either in the presence or absence of free oxygen; obligate anaërobes, or obligatory anaërobes, when they thrive only in its absence.
Ana\u00ebrobic: Not requiring air or oxygen for life; -- applied especially to those microbes to which free oxygen is unnecessary; anaërobiotic; -- opposed to aërobic.
Auxanometer: An instrument to measure the growth of plants.
A\u00ebroyacht: A form of hydro-aëroplane; a flying boat.
Awned: Furnished with an awn, or long bristle-shaped tip; bearded.
Anchylose: To affect or be affected with anchylosis; to unite or consolidate so as to make a stiff joint; to grow together into one.
Asarabacca: An acrid herbaceous plant (Asarum Europæum), the leaves and roots of which are emetic and cathartic. It is principally used in cephalic snuffs.
abscondment: the act of running away sectretly (as to avoid arrest).
adaptive radiation: the evolutionary generation of multiple specialized life forms from one ancestral form, evidenced in the fossil record.  The inverse of extinction.
Acidulent: Having an acid quality; sour; acidulous.
Aggressive: Tending or disposed to aggress; having or showing determination and energetic pursuit of one's own ends at the expense of others or mindless of others' needs or desires; characterized by aggression; making assaults; unjustly attacking; as, an aggressive policy, war, person, nation; an aggressive businessman; an aggressive basketball player; he was aggressive and imperious in his convictions; aggressive drivers.  Opposite of unaggressive.
Abatvoix: The sounding-board over a pulpit or rostrum.
Atman: The life principle, soul, or individual essence.
Afterthought: Reflection after an act; later or subsequent thought.
Attracter: One who, or that which, attracts.
achondroplasia: a skeletal disorder beginning before birth; cartilage is converted to bone resulting in dwarfism.
Aloneness: A state of being alone, or without company; solitariness.
Attack: The act of attacking, or falling on with force or violence; an onset; an assault; -- opposed to defense.
Asteroid: A starlike body; esp. one of the numerous small planets whose orbits lie between those of Mars and Jupiter; -- called also planetoids and minor planets.
Agglutination: The act of uniting by glue or other tenacious substance; the state of being thus united; adhesion of parts.
Adrogate: To adopt (a person who is his own master).
arthrosporic: of or pertaining to an arthrospore{2}.
Areca: A genus of palms, one species of which (Areca catechu) produces the areca nut, or betel nut, which is chewed in India and Southeast Asia with the leaf of the Piper Betle and lime.
Apparitor: Formerly, an officer who attended magistrates and judges to execute their orders.
Antiquist: An antiquary; a collector of antiques.
Airless: Not open to a free current of air; wanting fresh air, or communication with the open air.
Audit: To settle or adjust an account.
Assimilate: To become similar or like something else.
Axile: Situated in the axis of anything; as an embryo which lies in the axis of a seed.
Amp\u00e8remeter: An instrument for measuring the strength of an electrical current in ampères.
Accentuation: Act of accentuating; applications of accent.
Airmanship: Art, skill, or ability in the practice of aerial navigation; aircraft piloting.
Alkahest: The fabled “universal solvent” of the alchemists; a menstruum capable of dissolving all bodies.
Afro-Asian: of or relating to the nations of Africa and Asia or their peoples.
Atrabiliary: Of or pertaining to atra bilis or black bile, a fluid formerly supposed to be produced by the kidneys.
Anglomania: A mania for, or an inordinate attachment to, English customs, institutions, etc.
amyloidosis: a disorder characterized by deposit of amyloid in organs or tissues; often secondary to chronic rheumatoid arthritis or tuberculosis or multiple myeloma.
Anorthoscope: An optical toy for producing amusing figures or pictures by means of two revolving disks, on one of which distorted figures are painted.
Ashy: Pertaining to, or composed of, ashes; filled, or strewed with, ashes.
Aracanese: Of or pertaining to Aracan, a province of British Burmah.
Antibacchius: A foot of three syllables, the first two long, and the last short (#).
apractic: having uncoordinated muscular movements, symptomatic of a CNS disorder; suffering from apraxia.
Alimentation: The act or process of affording nutriment; the function of the alimentary canal.
Asset: Any article or separable part of one's assets.
Attire: Dress; clothes; headdress; anything which dresses or adorns; esp., ornamental clothing.
Assuager: One who, or that which, assuages.
Adynamic: Pertaining to, or characterized by, debility of the vital powers; weak.
Adynamia: Considerable debility of the vital powers, as in typhoid fever.
Apocalypse: One of a numerous class of writings proceeding from Jewish authors between 250  b. c. and 150 a. d., and designed to propagate the Jewish faith or to cheer the hearts of the Jewish people with the promise of deliverance and glory; or proceeding from Christian authors of the opening centuries and designed to portray the future.
Acroceraunian: Of or pertaining to the high mountain range of “thunder-smitten” peaks (now Kimara), between Epirus and Macedonia.
Austromancy: Soothsaying, or prediction of events, from observation of the winds.
Appellor: The person who institutes an appeal, or prosecutes another for a crime.
Armorist: One skilled in coat armor or heraldry.
Amortization: The act or right of alienating lands to a corporation, which was considered formerly as transferring them to dead hands, or in mortmain.
Apical: At or belonging to an apex, tip, or summit.
Angiotomy: Dissection of the blood vessels and lymphatics of the body.
Axinite: A borosilicate of alumina, iron, and lime, commonly found in glassy, brown crystals with acute edges.
Anodonta: a genus of thin-shelled freshwater mussels.
Analogize: To employ, or reason by, analogy.
Angelot: A French gold coin of the reign of Louis XI., bearing the image of St. Michael; also, a piece coined at Paris by the English under Henry VI.
A\u00ebrocyst: One of the air cells of algals.
Anticlinorium: The upward elevation of the crust of the earth, resulting from a geanticlinal.
Anconeus: A muscle of the elbow and forearm.
Adjudge: To award judicially in the case of a controverted question; as, the prize was adjudged to the victor.
airgun: A kind of gun in which the elastic force of condensed air is used to discharge the ball.  The air is powerfully compressed into a reservoir attached to the gun, by a condensing pump, and is controlled by a valve actuated by the trigger.  The common BB gun is a type of air gun.
Aliquant: An aliquant part of a number or quantity is one which does not divide it without leaving a remainder; thus, 5 is an aliquant part of 16. Opposed to aliquot.
aquifer: an underground bed or layer yielding ground water for wells and springs etc.; as, the Oglala aquifer.  The water contained in an aquifer may be of great age, and in such cases is sometimes called fossil water.
Arrest: The act of stopping, or restraining from further motion, etc.; stoppage; hindrance; restraint; as, an arrest of development.
3-hitter: a game in which a pitcher allows the opposing team only 3 hits.
Antedonidae: A natural family of feather stars; formerly called family Comatulidae.
Aureomycin: a yellow crystalline antibiotic (generic name chlortetracycline) used to treat certain bacterial and rickettsial diseases.
Anus: The posterior opening of the alimentary canal, through which the excrements are expelled.
Antiar: A Virulent poison prepared in Java from the gum resin of one species of the upas tree (Antiaris toxicaria).
Alewife: A North American fish (Clupea vernalis) of the Herring family. It is called also ellwife, ellwhop, branch herring. The name is locally applied to other related species.
artefactual: of or pertaining to an artefact.
Argumentation: The act of forming reasons, making inductions, drawing conclusions, and applying them to the case in discussion; the operation of inferring propositions, not known or admitted as true, from facts or principles known, admitted, or proved to be true.
Allhallown: Of or pertaining to the time of Allhallows. [Obs.] “Allhallown summer.” Shak. (i. e., late summer; “Indian Summer”).
Anacardium: A genus of plants including the cashew tree. See Cashew.
Acrobat: One who practices rope dancing, high vaulting, or other daring gymnastic feats.
Aloin: A bitter purgative principle in aloes.
Adverseness: The quality or state of being adverse; opposition.
antimycin: one of several antibiotic substances produced by several species of Streptomyces, active against various fungi. They are used only experimentally, not in medicine. The two best-known antimycins are antimycin A1 (C28H40N2O9) and antimycin A3 (C26H36N2O9).  They are notable for their mechanism of action, interference with the proton pumping mechanism of fungi.
Absinthin: The bitter principle of wormwood (Artemisia absinthium).
aardvark: An edentate mammal, of the genus Orycteropus (Orycteropus afer), somewhat resembling a pig, common in some parts of Southern Africa.  It is a nocturnal ungulate, burrows in the ground with its powerful claws, and feeds entirely on ants and termites, which it catches with its long, extensile, slimy tongue.  It is the sole extant representative of the order Tubulidentata.
Almond: The fruit of the almond tree.
Absinthic: Relating to the common wormwood or to an acid obtained from it.
Awfully: In an awful manner; in a manner to fill with terror or awe; fearfully; reverently.
Anisomeric: Not isomeric; not made of the same components in the same proportions.
Amicable: Friendly; proceeding from, or exhibiting, friendliness; after the manner of friends; peaceable; as, an amicable disposition, or arrangement.
Altrices: Nursers, -- a term applied to those birds whose young are hatched in a very immature and helpless condition, so as to require the care of their parents for some time; -- opposed to præcoces.
Alto-cumulus: A fleecy cloud formation consisting of large whitish or grayish globular cloudlets with shaded  portions, often grouped in flocks or rows.
Abidance: The state of abiding; abode; continuance; compliance (with).
Attend: To apply the mind, or pay attention, with a view to perceive, understand, or comply; to pay regard; to heed; to listen; -- usually followed by to.
Antorbital: Pertaining to, or situated in, the region of the front of the orbit.
Amadou: A spongy, combustible substance, prepared from fungus (Boletus and Polyporus) which grows on old trees; German tinder; punk. It has been employed as a styptic by surgeons, but its common use is as tinder, for which purpose it is prepared by soaking it in a strong solution of niter.
Appreciatory: Showing appreciation; appreciative; as, appreciatory commendation.
Alliterate: To compose alliteratively; also, to constitute alliteration.
Adaptability: The quality of being adaptable; suitableness.
A\u00ebrofoil: A plane or arched surface for sustaining bodies by its movement through the air; a spread wing, as of a bird.
Agonistic: Pertaining to violent contests, bodily or mental; pertaining to athletic or polemic feats; athletic; combative; hence, strained; unnatural.
Alnage: Measurement (of cloth) by the ell; also, a duty for such measurement.
Affair: That which is done or is to be done; matter; concern; as, a difficult affair to manage; business of any kind, commercial, professional, or public; -- often in the plural. “At the head of affairs.” Junius.
Actinomyxidia: an order comprising parasites of worms.
Argus shell: A species of shell (Cypræa argus), beautifully variegated with spots resembling those in a peacock's tail.
Alternant: Composed of alternate layers, as some rocks.
Aeolus: The god of the winds, in ancient mythology.
Acaleph\u00e6: A group of Cœlenterata, including the Medusæ or jellyfishes, and hydroids; -- so called from the stinging power they possess. Sometimes called sea nettles.
Alienable: Capable of being alienated, sold, or transferred to another; as, land is alienable according to the laws of the state.
Alpaca: An animal of Peru (Lama paco), having long, fine, wooly hair, supposed by some to be a domesticated variety of the llama.
Acheron: A river in the Nether World or infernal regions; also, the infernal regions themselves. By some of the English poets it was supposed to be a flaming lake or gulf.
Anolis: A genus of lizards which belong to the family Iguanidæ. They take the place in the New World of the chameleons in the Old, and in America are often called chameleons.
Attar: A fragrant essential oil; esp., a volatile and highly fragrant essential oil obtained from the petals of roses.
Articulus: A joint of the cirri of the Crinoidea; a joint or segment of an arthropod appendage.
Affirmation: Confirmation of anything established; ratification; as, the affirmation of a law.
Azobenzene: A substance (C6H5.N2.C6H5) derived from nitrobenzene, forming orange red crystals which are easily fusible.
Asse: A small foxlike animal (Vulpes cama) of South Africa, valued for its fur.
Amphigoric: Nonsensical; absurd; pertaining to an amphigory.
Assamar: The peculiar bitter substance, soft or liquid, and of a yellow color, produced when meat, bread, gum, sugar, starch, and the like, are roasted till they turn brown.
Alkali flat: A sterile plain, containing an excess of alkali, at the bottom of an undrained basin in an arid region; a playa.
Alsatia: a region of northeastern France famous for its wines.
Almuce: Same as Amice, a hood or cape.
Anonymity: The quality or state of being anonymous; anonymousness; also, that which anonymous.
Antimonite: A compound of antimonious acid and a base or basic radical.
Appanage: The portion of land assigned by a sovereign prince for the subsistence of his younger sons.
Air vessel: A vessel, cell, duct, or tube containing or conducting air; as the air vessels of insects, birds, plants, etc.; the air vessel of a pump, engine, etc. For the latter, see Air chamber. The air vessels of insects are called tracheæ, of plants spiral vessels.
Acquaintable: Easy to be acquainted with; affable.
Antiphonal: A book of antiphons or anthems.
Absorb: To swallow up; to engulf; to overwhelm; to cause to disappear as if by swallowing up; to use up; to include.
Arcellidae: A natural family of soil and freshwater protozoa; cosmopolitan.
Attentive: Heedful; intent; observant; regarding with care or attention.
Aaronic: Pertaining to Aaron, the first high priest of the Jews.
Amende: A pecuniary punishment or fine; a reparation or recantation.
Amorousness: The quality of being amorous, or inclined to sexual love; lovingness.
Arbalest: A crossbow, consisting of a steel bow set in a shaft of wood, furnished with a string and a trigger, and a mechanical device for bending the bow.  It served to throw arrows, darts, bullets, etc.
Adar: The twelfth month of the Hebrew ecclesiastical year, and the sixth of the civil. It corresponded nearly with March.
Affectedly: In an affected manner; hypocritically; with more show than reality.
Aztec: Of or relating to one of the early races in Mexico that inhabited the great plateau of that country at the time of the Spanish conquest in 1519.
Amends: Compensation for a loss or injury; recompense; reparation.
Adam: The name given in the Bible to the first man, the progenitor of the human race.
Acclamatory: Pertaining to, or expressing approval by, acclamation.
Adad: the Babylonian god of storms and wind.
Apostil: A marginal note on a letter or other paper; an annotation.
Accurate: In exact or careful conformity to truth, or to some standard of requirement, the result of care or pains; free from failure, error, or defect; exact; as, an accurate calculator; an accurate measure; accurate expression, knowledge, etc.
Alfilaria: The pin grass (Erodium cicutarium), a weed in California.
Antichristianism: Opposition or contrariety to the Christian religion.
Auditory: An assembly of hearers; an audience.
Adipolytic: Hydrolyzing fats; converting neutral fats into glycerin and free fatty acids, esp. by the action of an enzyme; as, adipolytic action.  Contrast saponify, to hydrolyze fat by the action of an alkali.
Angevine: Of or pertaining to Anjou in France.
Apposable: Capable of being apposed, or applied one to another, as the thumb to the fingers of the hand; able to be brought into direct spatial opposition.
Aftertaste: A taste which remains in the mouth after eating or drinking.
80: one more than seventy-nine and one less than eighty-one; denoting a quantity consisting of eighty items or units; -- representing the number eighty as Arabic numerals
Anhydride: An oxide of a nonmetallic body or an organic radical, capable of forming an acid by uniting with the elements of water; -- so called because it may be formed from an acid by the abstraction of water.
Acetabuliform: Shaped like a shallow cup; saucer-shaped; as, an acetabuliform calyx.
Antipode: One of the antipodes; anything exactly opposite.
autopilot: a device that automatically keeps ships or planes or spacecraft on a steady course.
Arenicolite: An ancient wormhole in sand, preserved in the rocks.
Ambassadress: A female ambassador; also, the wife of an ambassador.
\u00c6gean: Of or pertaining to the sea, or arm of the Mediterranean sea, east of Greece. See Archipelago.
Amphipoda: A numerous group of fourteen -- footed Crustacea, inhabiting both fresh and salt water. The body is usually compressed laterally, and the anterior pairs or legs are directed downward and forward, but the posterior legs are usually turned upward and backward. The beach flea is an example. See Tetradecapoda and Arthrostraca.
Aquiparous: Secreting water; -- applied to certain glands.
Avant: The front of an army. [Obs.] See Van.
Archipelagic: Of or pertaining to an archipelago.
Asarone: A crystallized substance, resembling camphor, obtained from the Asarum Europæum; -- called also camphor of asarum.
Azygous: Odd; having no fellow; not one of a pair; single; as, the azygous muscle of the uvula.
Abdication: The act of abdicating; the renunciation of a high office, dignity, or trust, by its holder; commonly the voluntary renunciation of sovereign power; as, abdication of the throne, government, power, authority.
Architeuthis: A genus of gigantic cephalopods, allied to the squids, found esp. in the North Atlantic and about New Zealand.
Apiculate: Terminated abruptly by a small, distinct point, as a leaf.
Accordingly: Agreeably; correspondingly; suitably; in a manner conformable.
Ascocarp: In ascomycetous fungi, the spherical, discoid, or cup-shaped body within which the asci are collected, and which constitutes the mature fructification. The different forms are known in mycology under distinct names. Called also spore fruit.
Aplanatic: Having two or more parts of different curvatures, so combined as to remove spherical aberration; -- said of a lens.
Anthroposophy: Knowledge of the nature of man; hence, human wisdom.
Acicular: Needle-shaped; slender like a needle or bristle, as some leaves or crystals; also, having sharp points like needles.
Autoclastic: Broken in place; -- said of rocks having a broken or brecciated structure due to crushing, in contrast to those of brecciated materials brought from a distance.
Aqueous: Partaking of the nature of water, or abounding with it; watery.
Ambulacrum: One of the radical zones of echinoderms, along which run the principal nerves, blood vessels, and water tubes. These zones usually bear rows of locomotive suckers or tentacles, which protrude from regular pores. In star fishes they occupy the grooves along the under side of the rays.
arcella: An amoebalike protozoan with a chitinous shell resembling an umbrella.
Anabaptize: To rebaptize; to rechristen; also, to rename.
astounded: struck with an intense and usually sudden surprise sufficient to produce wonder or perplexity
Accelerator: One who, or that which, accelerates. Also as an adj.; as, accelerator nerves.
Albugineous: Of the nature of, or resembling, the white of the eye, or of an egg; albuminous; -- a term applied to textures, humors, etc., which are perfectly white.
Afferent: Bearing or conducting inwards to a part or organ; -- opposed to efferent; as, afferent vessels; afferent nerves, which convey sensations from the external organs to the brain.
A\u00ebrometric: Of or pertaining to aërometry; as, aërometric investigations.
Aphanitic: Resembling aphanite; having a very fine-grained structure.
Acromegaly: Chronic enlargement of the extremities and face.
Ampersand: A word used to describe the character &unr_;, &unr_;, or &.
Absolutism: The state of being absolute; the system or doctrine of the absolute; the principles or practice of absolute or arbitrary government; despotism.
Actuality: The state of being actual; reality; as, the actuality of God's nature.
agency: The faculty of acting or of exerting power; the state of being in action; action; instrumentality.
Anoplothere: A genus of extinct quadrupeds of the order Ungulata, whose were first found in the gypsum quarries near Paris; characterized by the shortness and feebleness of their canine teeth (whence the name).
Adage: An old saying, which has obtained credit by long use; a proverb.
Accoucheur: A man who assists women in childbirth; a man midwife; an obstetrician.
Anabranch: A branch of a river that reënters, or anastomoses with, the main stream; also, less properly, a branch which loses itself in sandy soil.
Absolutist: Of or pertaining to absolutism; arbitrary; despotic; as, absolutist principles.
Acclimation: The process of becoming, or the state of being, acclimated, or habituated to a new climate; acclimatization.
Arquebusier: A soldier armed with an arquebus.
Assignor: An assigner; a person who assigns or transfers an interest; as, the assignor of a debt or other chose in action.
Aculeated: Having a sharp point; armed with prickles; prickly; aculeate.
Anthemis: Chamomile; a genus of composite, herbaceous plants.
Ascititious: Supplemental; not inherent or original; adscititious; additional; assumed.
actiniarian: any sea anemone or related animal.
Absterse: To absterge; to cleanse; to purge away.
Avicularia: See prehensile processes on the cells of some Bryozoa, often having the shape of a bird's bill.
Audenesque: of or pertaining to W. H. Auden.
Ampelopsis: A genus formerly including the Virginia creeper.
Acronyc: Rising at sunset and setting at sunrise, as a star; -- opposed to cosmical.
Adjoining: Joining to; contiguous; adjacent; as, an adjoining room.
ambiversion: a balanced disposition intermediate between extroversion and introversion.
adrenocortical: of or pertaining to the adrenal cortex.
Abietene: A volatile oil distilled from the resin or balsam of the nut pine (Pinus sabiniana) of California.
Abelian: One of a sect in Africa (4th century), mentioned by St. Augustine, who states that they married, but lived in continence, after the manner, as they pretended, of Abel.
Auspice: A divining or taking of omens by observing birds; an omen as to an undertaking, drawn from birds; an augury; an omen or sign in general; an indication as to the future.
Archly: In an arch manner; with attractive slyness or roguishness; slyly; waggishly.
Arceuthobium: A genus of chiefly American plants parasitic on conifers.
Arear: Backward; in or to the rear; behindhand.
Abandon: A complete giving up to natural impulses; freedom from artificial constraint; careless freedom or ease.
Aural: Of or pertaining to the ear; as, aural medicine and surgery.
Alight: Lighted; lighted up; in a flame.
Aristophanic: Of or pertaining to Aristophanes, the Athenian comic poet.
Aphetism: An aphetized form of a word.
Autochthon: One who is supposed to rise or spring from the ground or the soil he inhabits; one of the original inhabitants or aborigines; a native; -- commonly in the plural. This title was assumed by the ancient Greeks, particularly the Athenians.
Aurocyanide: A double cyanide of gold and some other metal or radical; -- called also cyanaurate.
Atheize: To discourse, argue, or act as an atheist.
acquired: gotten through environmental forces.  Contrasted with inherited.
Amphibiotica: A division of insects having aquatic larvæ.
Aphakial: Pertaining to aphakia; as, aphakial eyes.
Aluminic: Of or containing aluminium; as, aluminic phosphate.
Ambulator: One who walks about; a walker.
Apis: A genus of insects of the order Hymenoptera, including the common honeybee (Apis mellifica) and other related species. See Honeybee.
Arr\u00eat: A judgment, decision, or decree of a court or high tribunal; also, a decree of a sovereign.
Antipyretic: Efficacious in preventing or allaying fever.
Alchemize: To change by alchemy; to transmute.
audiovisual: materials using sight or sound to present information; -- usually used in the plural.
Anastatica: a genus of plants consisting of a single species, rose of Jericho (also called resurrection plant).
Admitted: Received as true or valid; acknowledged.
A\u00ebrotherapeutics: Treatment of disease by the use of air or other gases.
Anthelion: A halo opposite the sun, consisting of a colored ring or rings around the shadow of the spectator's own head, as projected on a cloud or on an opposite fog bank.
Aleut: a member of the people inhabiting the Aleutian Islands.  Same as Aleutian, n.
Anatomic: Of or relating to anatomy or dissection; as, the anatomic art; anatomical observations.
Axil: The angle or point of divergence between the upper side of a branch, leaf, or petiole, and the stem or branch from which it springs.
Anglicity: The state or quality of being English.
Agonize: To cause to suffer agony; to subject to extreme pain; to torture.
Antiochian: Pertaining to Antiochus, a contemporary with Cicero, and the founder of a sect of philosophers.
Apishly: In an apish manner; with servile imitation; foppishly.
Antedate: To date before the true time; to assign to an earlier date; ; thus, to antedate a deed or a bond is to give it a date anterior to the true time of its execution.
Axis: A straight line, real or imaginary, passing through a body, on which it revolves, or may be supposed to revolve; a line passing through a body or system around which the parts are symmetrically arranged.
Antiputrefactive: Counteracting, or preserving from, putrefaction; antiseptic.
Anisotrope: Not isotropic; having different properties in different directions; thus, crystals of the isometric system are optically isotropic, but all other crystals are anisotropic.
Arborescent: Resembling a tree; becoming woody in stalk; dendritic; having crystallizations disposed like the branches and twigs of a tree.
A\u00ebrogun: A cannon capable of being trained at very high angles for use against aircraft.  Now usually referred to an anitaircraft cannon.
Annwfn: the other world; land of fairies.
All fours: All four legs of a quadruped; or the two legs and two arms of a person.
Alkaline: Of or pertaining to an alkali or to alkalies; having the properties of an alkali.
Atmo: The standard atmospheric pressure used in certain physical measurements calculations; conventionally, that pressure under which the barometer stands at 760 millimeters, at a temperature of 0° Centigrade, at the level of the sea, and in the latitude of Paris.
Active: Having the power or quality of acting; causing change; communicating action or motion; acting; -- opposed to passive, that receives; as, certain active principles; the powers of the mind.
Ansa: A name given to either of the projecting ends of Saturn's ring.
Adjusting plane: A small plane or surface, usually capable of adjustment but not of manipulation, for preserving lateral balance in an aëroplane or flying machine.
Adrip: In a dripping state; as, leaves all adrip.
Appreciate: To rise in value. [See note under Rise, v. i.]
Aridity: The state or quality of being arid or without moisture; dryness.
Archness: The quality of being arch; cleverness; sly humor free from malice; waggishness.
Arbitral: Of or relating to an arbiter or an arbitration.
Acceptation: Acceptance; reception; favorable reception or regard; state of being acceptable.
Agitable: Capable of being agitated, or easily moved.
Astrologic: Of or pertaining to astrology; professing or practicing astrology.
Arrastre: A rude apparatus for pulverizing ores, esp. those containing free gold.
Archmarshal: The grand marshal of the old German empire, a dignity that to the Elector of Saxony.
Angiospermous: Having seeds inclosed in a pod or other pericarp.
Aphaniptera: A group of wingless insects, of which the flea in the type. See Flea.
Aslake: To mitigate; to moderate; to appease; to abate; to diminish.
Alme: An Egyptian dancing girl; an Alma.
Acontias: Anciently, a snake, called dart snake; now, one of a genus of reptiles closely allied to the lizards.
Avatar: The descent of a deity to earth, and his incarnation as a man or an animal; -- chiefly associated with the incarnations of Vishnu.
Alms: Anything given gratuitously to relieve the poor, as money, food, or clothing; a gift of charity.
appropriated: taken without permission or consent especially by public authority.
archaeozoic: Like or belonging to the earliest forms of animal life.
Acaroid: Shaped like or resembling a mite.
Absoluteness: The quality of being absolute; independence of everything extraneous; unlimitedness; absolute power; independent reality; positiveness.
Antipathous: Having a natural contrariety; adverse; antipathetic.
Alligator: A large carnivorous reptile of the Crocodile family, peculiar to America. It has a shorter and broader snout than the crocodile, and the large teeth of the lower jaw shut into pits in the upper jaw, which has no marginal notches. Besides the common species of the southern United States, there are allied species in South America.
Astragalus: The ankle bone, or hock bone; the bone of the tarsus which articulates with the tibia at the ankle.
Arteriolosclerosis: a form of arteriosclerosis which affects predominantly the arterioles, found especially in people with chronic hypertension.
Argentina: a country in South America, bordering Chile and Bolivia.
Anomaly: Deviation from the common rule; an irregularity; anything anomalous.
Amalgamator: One who, or that which, amalgamates. Specifically: A machine for separating precious metals from earthy particles by bringing them in contact with a body of mercury with which they form an amalgam.
abulic: showing abnormal inability to act or make decisions
abulia: an abnormally intense inability to make decisions; severe irresolution.
Anagogic: Mystical; having a secondary spiritual meaning; as, the rest of the Sabbath, in an anagogical sense, signifies the repose of the saints in heaven; an anagogical explication.
Adiaphoristic: Pertaining to matters indifferent in faith and practice.
Absentee: One who absents himself from his country, office, post, or duty; especially, a landholder who lives in another country or district than that where his estate is situated; as, an Irish absentee.
Ametabolian: Of or pertaining to insects that do undergo any metamorphosis.
Antiquarianize: To act the part of an antiquary.
Arbitrage: Judgment by an arbiter; authoritative determination.
Antidote: To counteract or prevent the effects of, by giving or taking an antidote.
Aldine: An epithet applied to editions (chiefly of the classics) which proceeded from the press of Aldus Manitius, and his family, of Venice, for the most part in the 16th century and known by the sign of the anchor and the dolphin. The term has also been applied to certain elegant editions of English works.
Alloxan: An oxidation product of uric acid. It is of a pale reddish color, readily soluble in water or alcohol.
Availability: The quality of being available; availableness.
Azalea: A genus of showy flowering shrubs, mostly natives of China or of North America; false honeysuckle. The genus is scarcely distinct from Rhododendron.
Astrometeorology: The investigation of the relation between the sun, moon, and stars, and the weather.
