Armiger: Formerly, an armor bearer, as of a knight, an esquire who bore his shield and rendered other services. In later use, one next in degree to a knight, and entitled to armorial bearings. The term is now superseded by esquire.
Anthropogeny: The science or study of human generation, or the origin and development of man.
Aweigh: Just drawn out of the ground, and hanging perpendicularly; atrip; -- said of the anchor.
Aphasmidia: one of two subgroups of Nematoda used in some classification systems.
Annotatory: Pertaining to an annotator; containing annotations.
Adjection: The act or mode of adding; also, the thing added.
Acardiac: Without a heart; as, an acardiac fetus.
Abassi: A silver coin of Persia, worth about twenty cents.
14th: coming next after the thirteenth in a series
Astragalomancy: Divination by means of small bones or dice.
Annihilationist: One who believes that eternal punishment consists in annihilation or extinction of being; a destructionist.
\u00c6stivation: The state of torpidity induced by the heat and dryness of summer, as in certain snails; -- opposed to hibernation.
Autographic: Pertaining to an autograph, or one's own handwriting; of the nature of an autograph.
Alexanders: A name given to two species of the genus Smyrnium, formerly cultivated and used as celery now is; -- called also horse parsely.
Albigensian: Of or pertaining to the Albigenses.
Annealing: The process used to render glass, iron, etc., less brittle, performed by allowing them to cool very gradually from a high heat.
axenic: raised under sterile conditions; -- of experimental animals; as, axenic conditions.
Acoustic: A medicine or agent to assist hearing.
Anchoret: One who renounces the world and secludes himself, usually for religious reasons; a hermit; a recluse.
Americana: any artifact (such a books or furniture or art) that is distinctive to America.
Assent: The act of assenting; the act of the mind in admitting or agreeing to anything; concurrence with approval; consent; agreement; acquiescence.
Ambiguously: In an ambiguous manner; with doubtful meaning.
Anchored: Held by an anchor; at anchor; held safely; as, an anchored bark; also, shaped like an anchor; forked; as, an anchored tongue.
Applicability: The quality of being applicable or fit to be applied.
Asquint: With the eye directed to one side; not in the straight line of vision; obliquely; awry, so as to see distortedly; as, to look asquint.
Angelica: An aromatic umbelliferous plant (Archangelica officinalis or Angelica archangelica) the leaf stalks of which are sometimes candied and used in confectionery, and the roots and seeds as an aromatic tonic.
actinomycin: any of various red antibiotics isolated from soil bacteria with a three-ring heterocyclic nucleus with an attached peptide chain.
Acierage: The process of coating the surface of a metal plate (as a stereotype plate) with steellike iron by means of voltaic electricity; steeling.
automat: a vending machine from which you can get food.
acetol: Methyl ketol; also, any of various homologues of the same.
Anisospore: A sexual spore in which the sexes differ in size; -- opposed to isospore.
Appropriative: Appropriating; making, or tending to, appropriation; as, an appropriative act.
Anthracoid: Resembling anthrax in action; of the nature of anthrax; as, an anthracoid microbe.
Affectionateness: The quality of being affectionate; fondness; affection.
Air jacket: A jacket having air-tight cells, or cavities which can be filled with air, to render persons buoyant in swimming.
Authentics: A collection of the Novels or New Constitutions of Justinian, by an anonymous author; -- so called on account of its authenticity.
Anabaptistry: The doctrine, system, or practice, of Anabaptists.
Anticlinal: The crest or line in which strata slope or dip in opposite directions.
Ascospore: One of the spores contained in the asci of lichens and fungi. [See Illust. of Ascus.]
Adductor: A muscle which draws a limb or part of the body toward the middle line of the body, or closes extended parts of the body; -- opposed to abductor; as, the adductor of the eye, which turns the eye toward the nose.
Annunciator: One who announces. Specifically: An officer in the church of Constantinople, whose business it was to inform the people of the festivals to be celebrated.
Amt: An administrative territorial division in Denmark and Norway.
Appraiser: One who appraises; esp., a person appointed and sworn to estimate and fix the value of goods or estates.
amnesia: Forgetfulness; also, a defect of speech, from cerebral disease, in which the patient substitutes wrong words or names in the place of those he wishes to employ.
Arithmetically: Conformably to the principles or methods of arithmetic.
Anythingarian: One who holds to no particular creed or dogma.
automated: accomplished by machinary without the intervention of a human operator; -- of processes.
Atavism: The recurrence, or a tendency to a recurrence, of the original type of a species in the progeny of its varieties; resemblance to remote rather than to near ancestors; reversion to the original form.
Ant-lion: A neuropterous insect, the larva of which makes in the sand a pitfall to capture ants, etc. The common American species is Myrmeleon obsoletus, the European is Myrmeleon formicarius.
Alive: Having life, in opposition to dead; living; being in a state in which the organs perform their functions; as, an animal or a plant which is alive.
Antidiphtheritic: Destructive to, or hindering the growth of, diphtheria bacilli.
Amphibolic: Of or pertaining to amphiboly; ambiguous; equivocal.
Apophlegmatic: Designed to facilitate discharges of phlegm or mucus from mouth or nostrils.
Armadillidium: the type genus of the Armadillidiidae.
Actualisation: A making actual or really existent; giving the appearance of reality.
Avowal: An open declaration; frank acknowledgment; as, an avowal of such principles.
acrogenic: pertaining to acrogens, flowerless plants (ferns or mosses) in which growth occurs only at the tip of the main stem.
Amvis: An explosive consisting of ammonium nitrate, a derivative of nitrobenzene, chlorated napthalene, and wood meal.
Achromatism: The state or quality of being achromatic; as, the achromatism of a lens; achromaticity.
acid-forming: yielding an acid in aqueous solution
Appreciable: Capable of being appreciated or estimated; large enough to be estimated; perceptible; as, an appreciable quantity.
Authorship: The quality or state of being an author; function or dignity of an author.
Anthropography: That branch of anthropology which treats of the actual distribution of the human race in its different divisions, as distinguished by physical character, language, institutions, and customs, in contradistinction to ethnography, which treats historically of the origin and filiation of races and nations.
Antiburgher: One who seceded from the Scottish Burghers (1747), deeming it improper to take the Burgess oath.
Advocacy: The act of pleading for or supporting; work of advocating; intercession.
Atterrate: To fill up with alluvial earth.
Aphidophagous: Feeding upon aphides, or plant lice, as do beetles of the family Coccinellidæ.
Arrose: To drench; to besprinkle; to moisten.
Amber seed: Seed of the Hibiscus abelmoschus, somewhat resembling millet, brought from Egypt and the West Indies, and having a flavor like that of musk; musk seed.
Antheraea: a genus of large moths whose larvae produce silk of high quality.
Appointable: Capable of being appointed or constituted.
\u00c6neid: The great epic poem of Virgil, of which the hero is Æneas.
accompanyist: a person who provides musical accompaniment (usually on a piano).
